results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

This class is a combination of a movement, music and development class for Babies (PeKip inspired) as well as a support group for new Moms (Dads are welcome!). While learning songs, finger plays and exercises to support your baby's development you will meet other new German speaking Moms to exchange experiences and make new friendships. We create a safe environment to ask any questions you might have.

What you’ll get out of 6 weeks class:

• A supportive group of Moms (and Dads) who go through similar experiences at the same time 

• Get access to valuable, first-hand parenting resources in White Plains and around NYC. 

• Discover new and old German nursery rhymes, finger plays and lot’s of games and activities to stimulate your baby’s development

Baby’s Erstes Jahr is led by Dorothea Liedel, pediatric nurse and Mom of 3. 

Tuition for 6 weeks: $150

results.description: It might be a bit chilly, but nevertheless a fine day to visit the Garden. We'll take a look at the Rose Garden (yes, some roses are still in bloom!), The new Native Plant Garden, and the Perennial Garden, as well as walk through NYC's only primeval forest. Fall foliage should be at or near its peak. Around 2 miles at a very leisurely pace. Take the 10:25 Harlem Line train from Grand Central, arriving at the "Botanical Garden" station at 10:45. Alternatively, take the 4 or D subway to "Bedford Park Blvd." and then the #26 bus east to the Mosholu Gate entrance. We'll meet just inside the Gate at 10:47. Admission to the Garden is free on Wednesdays, but the conservatory (optional) will set you back $25 ($22 for seniors). If driving, park in the parking facility by the station ($12) or on a nearby street (free). No coordination of rides. The 3:37 train gets you back to Grand Central at 3:59, or you can take the bus and subway back. Bring lunch and beverage, or buy it in the cafeteria. Please rsvp, call, or email me to make sure that the visit is on, to let me know you are coming (although I will of course miss you, there is no need to let me know that you are not coming), and if you have any questions. No pets; no smoking. Bob Susser[masked]; [masked]

results.description:
Hello,

7v7 game, 90min+, bring a white & black tee-shirt.

Don't be late, we start on time!


This long running pick-up plays in Chinatown and has a storied history. The game has been going 12+ years, and was born by a group of Irish, English, Scottish and German expats who needed a mid-week footballing outlet. The group has now expanded to include players from around a dozen countries.

The group is looking for additional players to complement the game. The match is played in a sporting yet competitive spirit. This is for seasoned players - NO beginners please.

A good attitude, positional sense and a preference for passing is a must. We usually play for 1.5 hours year round.


Someone usually brings pinnies, but bring a white and black top just in case.

Note: RSVP is required to attend the game. There are a number of regulars who attend each week in addition to the meetup list - not all players are listed on the meetup.

See you there.
results.name: Chinatown Pick-up Wednesdays @12:00pm

results.description:
Success breeds success. There is nothing like achieving a goal to make you feel good and want to achieve more.  Small action steps completed regularly will take you closer to where you want to be.  Will Rogers said it best: "You may be on the right track but you will get run over if you just sit there!" 

Toastmasters has helped over 4 million members in 116 countries improve their speaking and leadership skills. 

Toastmasters has helped us and it can help you too. Why not attend a meeting and see for yourself?

What's the biggest benefit you may receive from Toastmasters?

The ability to speak with confidence before a large audience

The ability to overcome nervous butterflies and focus on the goal of my presentation

I've learned how to conduct an effective business meeting

More confidence to speak in public, even in impromptu situations

More comfortable speaking in front of a group

Being able to more effectively share the things I've learned with others

Greater self-confidence because of Toastmasters' encouraging feedback

The opportunity to meet new people in a fun and friendly atmosphere

More confidence and a greater ability to think on my feet

A feeling of accomplishment by helping others

I have gained self-confidence and improved my performance at work

I'm a much better listener -- more attentive, patient and less judgmental

The ability (and confidence) to combine words with appropriate gestures for a better speech

A greater belief in yourself and your capabilities. 

The ability to speak in front of a group of people with confidence, conviction and certainty

Knowing that there are people out there that started out just like you and now they are good speakers. You can do this!

Realising that it is not all that scary to stand in front of a group of people and talk

Gain experience in an area of my life I always thought to be non-existent -- public speaking. If I can do it, anyone can

A noticeable improvement, week by week, in my writing and speaking abilities

Courage to put yourself in challenging situations.

Meet new people from many backgrounds and walks of life and hearing their stories. Everyone has something to teach.

build your self-confidence, meet new people and expand your social circle

results.description:
Student Testimonial:

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe, Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014
--------------------------------------------------------------------


Come and experience how this unique meditation can help you purify your body/mind and unleash the creative power within you.

* Increase self-awareness
* Stronger emotional intelligence
* Greater mental clarity, focus and inspiration.

Bodhi Meditation Energize your body Strenthen your mind Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

Students will experience two forms of Bodhi Meditation.

* Seated
* Movement

Your class instructor is Nan Ni Gilbert. Nan is a NYS licensed acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist. Nan is also one of the most advanced Bodhi Meditation energy healer in North America


Time:. 1:00 PM – 2:30 PM 

Day: Wednesdays 

Where: Room #102, 

Freeport Recreation Center 

130 E Merrick Rd, Freeport, NY 11520 

Contact: Nan, [masked],[masked]

**The Bodhi Meditation classes at the Freeport Rec Center are free but all participates are required to have a Freeport Rec Center Activity Card. The cost is $5.00 for Freeport Residents and $10.00 for Non-Residents. It's a one time annual fee payable to the Freeport Rec Center. If it's your first class please arrive early to purchase your activity card.

I leave you with Master JinBodhi's Golden Words:

(Editor's note: The following phrases were suggested by Master JinBodhi and subsequently introduced to his students as a daily practice. Starting your day by loudly reciting these phrases three times, either all of them or a select few, will bring you energy and joy. Give it a try and experience how uplifted you feel...)

1.Self-Confidence

I am most compassionate.

I am most confident.

I am most tolerant.

I am most courageous.

I keep my word.

I am most punctual.

I can do anything.

2. The Power of Knowledge

I am full of wisdom.

I am most knowledgeable.

I love reading.

I love observing.

I love listening.

I love thinking.

I take decisive action.

3. Life Purpose

 I am a gift from the Universe.

I am most charming.

I am most talented.

I can sing most beautifully.

I like challenge.

I am responsible for my actions.

I will fulfill my life purpose.

4. Cause and Consequence

（not for reading loud）

What you give is what you receive.

Care for others, and you are taken care of.

Smile at others, and they will smile at you.

Treat others with sincerity, and sincerity will be given to you.

Make trouble for others, and trouble will find you.

Frequent generosity begets abundance.

Seek to give, not to be rewarded.

Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 3.00pm and finishes at 3.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Join Mahna Mahna fashion showroom for a night of fright this October 28th. 

Mahna Mahna is a beautiful showroom where stylists and fashion bloggers can rent stunning designer and one-of-a-kind couture clothes, shoes, and jewelry at affordable prices ($30 and up) - we're talking jaw dropping pieces from Prada, Balenciaga, Alexander McQueen, Fendi and much much more. Could this place be the reason some fashion bloggers get on the best-dressed list during NYFW? i.e. you can get photographed in stylish ensembles for a steal!

Confirmed attendees will receive a $50 gift certificate for your next rental good through the new year.

Costumes are optional ; )

results.name: Open Night

results.description:
￼“Collective Song Club”   Meets every other Wednesday – 5:30-8:30PM

The "Collective Song Club” will begin on October 14th and follow every other Wednesday evening (skipping the night before Thanksgiving).

Location: Planet Studio NYC (www.planetstudionyc.com) 

244 West 54th Street between Broadway and 8th Avenue in Suite 800B on the 8th floor. It will begin at 5:30PM so those heading home from work can stop in without it getting too late. Each session will end promptly at 8:30pm when the studio will go back into record mode for the evening schedule. Drop in at anytime up until 7:30pm during each session. You can’t even really be late! Leave when you like!

The CSC will be led by Collective founder Peter Bliss.


The goal of the Collective Song Club is to create a nurturing space for songwriters, artists and producers to present their works in progress, completed songs and productions as well as ask questions about the music business. Vetting songs about to be recorded will give you one more moment of clarity and reflection before you spend energy and dollars on your recording. Song tempos and keys can be discussed as well as best possible producers and vocalists for your project. The studio will have guitars and a keyboard available so no need to feel you have to bring your own. The studio can playback a CD, your iPhone or Android, MP3 player, or connect via the internet to your website or Dropbox. Bring a few lyric sheets of the song you would like to share. The entire evening is about forming a creative community that enhances your art and helps you grow as a songwriter.


There will be no advance payment or sign-up necessary. Each session will cost $20 per person payable at the door as we begin. The studio has a “Square” reader so you can put it on your debit / credit card for $22 with the additional sum to cover the handling charge. Come one week or skip a session - feeling inspired - come on down - feeling tired or have a change of plans - there’s no need to feel like you have to be there. Sessions might be crowded - some might be just a few people - or you!


There are no requirements other than to become a full member of the Collective. The annual membership fee until the end of 2015 is only $35. This membership entitles you to participate in all the Collective workshops as well as perform a song (or have your song performed) in our quarterly Member Benefit Showcases held at the Bitter End. It's easy to become a member - go to www.newyorksongwriterscollective.com and look for "Sign Up/Sign In" in he top right corner of the webpage!


The CSC is an experiment that will hopefully find a place and grow with the necessary changes and additions as it is established. Could it happen every week save for special days and holidays? Could special guests from the industry drop in that would be announced shortly before a session on the Collective website? We shall see! 

Peter Bliss songs have been recorded by artists like Barbra Streisand, NYSNC, Peter Wolf of J.Geils Band, Southside Johnny, and many more. Peter’s journey began as an artist/songwriter releasing his United Artists debut LP in his early twenties. He continued writing and producing for artists, television and film. He’s shared his expertise creating workshop and event programs for the Songwriters Hall of Fame and now the New York Songwriters Collective. Peter works from his “Planet Studio NYC” recording studios located in Manhattan, arranging, recording and producing other artists to help bring their music to life. Peter is once again taking to the stage singing his own songs.

  
￼￼
results.name: The "Collective Song Club" presented by the New York Songwriters Collective

results.description:
Ever hear about how Watson beat Ken Jennings and Brad Rutter on Jeopardy? Well come hear about how Watson has evolved since then!

Join us to hear more about IBM Watson and the available Watson Services on Bluemix. You'll learn how you can start leveraging cognitive computing for your next application developed on Bluemix and the cool upcoming Watson Services on Bluemix. 

Agenda
5:30 pm: Networking/Food & Beverages
6:00 pm: Welcome and Introduction
6:15 pm: Overview of Watson Developer Cloud. Introduce recently released services.
7:15 pm: Break
7:30 pm: Demo of coding against the Watson APIs
8:30 pm: Wrap-up
8:45 pm: Networking
9:00 pm: End of Meeting
results.name: Watson Services on Bluemix

results.description:
Code Driven NYC features fascinating technical and organizational talks from experienced engineers and leaders. 


• Colin Vernon, Director of Platform and Cloud at littleBits (DIY electronics for prototyping and learning): "Engineering Engineers for Engineers"


• Spencer Kimball, Founder and CEO at Cockroach Labs (scalable, available, and transactional open-source database)


• Duncan Grazier, VP Engineering at Shopkeep (cloud-based iPad point of sale system)


This is a developer-only audience (i.e., no recruiters, etc.) and it is completely free to join and attend. Join us for an evening where all attendees are active software developers, with food/drink/networking before and after great speakers, and excellent conversations about development and engineering.

Schedule: doors open & networking begins at 5:45pm; talks begin at 6:15pm; networking continues at about 7:30pm.

Code Driven NYC is organized by FirstMark, an early stage venture capital firm based in New York City. Our mission is to partner with exceptional entrepreneurs who are changing the world by solving meaningful problems. We are privileged to work alongside the founders of remarkable businesses like Pinterest, Lumosity, NewsCred, Tapad, Shopify, Riot Games, and more.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevator to the 3rd floor

results.description:
Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].

This event starts out as a Happy Hour  then becomes a chance to watch the Presidential Debates or The Mets World Series Game with other fun people! Here is how it works...  We have space reserved on the 2nd and 3rd floor of the New St. Pat's Bar and Grill on 46th and 5th.  Doors open at 6pm for socializing then at 8pm you can stay on the 2nd floor to watch the METS and continue socializing or you can go to our private room on the 3rd floor to watch the debates.  The sound will  be on for the debates on the 3rd floor and the game on the 2nd floor.

There will be happy hour drink prices till 8pm. They also have a full menu!  You don't have to be a political person or a baseball fan to attend. Remember that this is an after work party first and foremost (it just so happens that there are 2 big events on the television that night)

For the debate party..

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Republican or a MET fan to  attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].
results.name: After Work Party + Presidential Debates & METS World Series 2 Floors 3 Parties

group.name: The Best NYC Singles Parties & Social Events

results.description:
Abstract


Functional programming languages have spearheaded groundbreaking innovations in programming language design and implementation. Garbage collection, type inference, higher-order functions, and polymorphic type abstractions are just some examples of innovative features that have emerged from research in these languages. Expert programmers cherish these features because they can significantly increase a programmer's productivity. However, these advanced language features are often difficult to master because they require a deep understanding of the inner workings of the compiler.

Type inference is a prime example of a language feature that can boost  productivity but can also be a usability nightmare. A type inference  algorithm infers the types of expressions in a program based on how  these expressions are used. The compiler can thus provide strong  static correctness guarantees about a program without requiring the programmer to annotate the program with type information. On the other hand, automated type inference can also be counterproductive. If a conflicting use of an expression (i.e. a type mismatch) is detected, the compiler reports the corresponding program location as the source
of the type error. However, the actual error source is often elsewhere in the program. This results in confusing error messages. The programmer needs to understand the basic workings of the inference algorithm to interpret the error message correctly and debug the program. This can often be a frustrating experience.

In this talk, I will explain how type inference algorithms work and why type error localization is so difficult in the presence of type inference. I will then present a new algorithm for localizing type errors that provides formal quality guarantees about the identified type error sources. The algorithm works efficiently in practice and has the potential to significantly improve the quality of type error reports produced by state-of-the-art compilers.


Bio

Thomas Wies is an Assistant Professor in the Computer Science Department of New York University. He received his doctorate in Computer Science from the University of Freiburg, Germany (2009). Before joining NYU, he held post-doctoral positions at École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne, Switzerland and at the Institute of Science and Technology Austria. His research focuses on programming languages and formal methods.

*note: the talk will start at 7:00 and there will be a reception with food and beer/wine sponsored by TekSystems before the talk starts.
results.how_to_find_us: We're hosting this at Snapple Theater in Times Square
results.name: Improving Type Error Localization for Languages with Type Inference

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
After meeting with @antirez, Redis Developers and users in London last week, we want to share what's new, what's coming and get your feedback! We'll also hear from Gabriel at Telepat.io about how they're using Redis at scale. And of course, there will be music, drinks, and food to keep us going!

Agenda

6:00 - 6:30 Eat, meet, and greet

6:30 - 6:45 Opening remarks + Recap of Redis Dev Day/UnConf London, Nikki Tirado

6:45 - 7:00 Break for open discussion

7:00 - 7:30 "How Telepat.io is building a scalable backend for data aggregation & synchronization", Gabriel Dobocan

7:30 - 8:00 "Intro to Redis: Your first line of Code" by Dave Nielsen

8:00 - 8:30 Mingling over drinks

Speakers:


Nikki Tirado, Community Managing Data Services at Rackspace

Nikki has spent the past four years training, educating, and advocating for new cloud and database technologies in the US and UK. She is best known for her infectious enthusiasm, energy, and commitment to empower visionaries. Becoming the first Cloud Savvy certified woman at Rackspace, Nikki organized Redis Developer Day and UnConf 2015 for developers and users to connect and grow. Nikki created Hack The Block, the outreach program designed to empower developers to build applications that will impact their local community.  She is passionate about volunteering in the Bronx/East Harlem and could never have enough Tres Leches cake. Feel free to say hola @nikkitirado


Gabriel Dobocan, Chief Software Architect of Telepat.io

Telepat.io is a NY startup building an open-source, data synchronization platform that powers real-time APIs, web and mobile apps. Before starting Telepat.io, Gabriel built Appscend, a company offering a Mobile Application Platform that's currently used by thousands of developers and Enterprise companies like: T-mobile, Vodafone, Gebruder Weiss, BMW Motor AG, JWT etc. In his free time Gabriel enjoys reading and spending time with his family.

Dave Nielsen, Developer Relations at Redis Labs


Dave works for Redis Labs organizing hackathons, workshops and other events to help developers learn when and how to use Redis. Prior to Redis Labs, Dave was the co-founder and lead organizer of CloudCamp, a community of Cloud Computing enthusiasts in over 100 cities around the world. Dave graduated from Cal Poly: San Luis Obispo and has worked in developer relations for 12 years at companies like PayPal, Strikeiron and Platform D. Dave gained modest notoriety when he proposed to his girlfriend in the book PayPal Hacks.

We would like to thank Rackspace and Redis Labs for your support!
results.name: The Future of Redis and How Telepat.io is Using it for Data Aggregation & Sync

results.description:
There's a lot of "content" out there, but much of it isn't worth much of anything to anyone. 

This talk will explore:

• Different types of (written) content and what they achieve
• What works and doesn't
• How to make sure you're representing your brand or personality appropriately
• Quick tips and tricks to make the most out of any individual piece of content.

Guest Speaker:

Amy Vernon, Prize-winning journalist, named 15th-most influential woman in tech on Twitter by Business Insider & Peer Index, cited as one of five women bloggers to follow by Craigslist founder Craig Newmark, and one of AGBeat's top 50 influencers of 2014

@AmyVernon

Published on The Next Web, VentureBeat, Slashdot's Business Intelligence and Network World, Amy has spent nearly 20 years as a professional daily newspaper journalist.

About Venue:

Thank you to our partner Wix.com for hosting us at the Wix Lounge. Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence.

So what are you waiting for? Sign up for a free Wix workshop today!

results.description:
Hello all!

Join us for a discussion of the following short stories and poems of Edgar Allan Poe

You may read the stories and poems by clicking on THIS LINK or the respective links below. 

"Never Bet the Devil Your Head" (1850) A comedy with a moral


"The Tell-Tale Heart" (1850) A murderer's guilt


"The Imp of the Perverse" (1850) Procrastination and confession


"The Cask of Amontillado" (1846) A story of revenge


"The Angel of the Odd" (1844) Comedy about being drunk


"The Raven" (1845) 


"Annabel Lee" (1849) 


***PLEASE NOTE THE FOLLOWING***

 ~Please be courteous by ordering food and/or drinks at the venue. 
~THERE IS A $2 FEE for this event; this goes towards the Meetup organizer fee. 
~RSVPs will be open until midnight the day before the event. I will also send out my cell number to those attending.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

~Hazel

results.description:
Award winning Director Sania Jhankar will introduce the world of Indie Film Directing, with dozens of indie filmmaking tips.

This information-packed session will give you the tools you need to establish yourself as a Director. This course starts at the very beginning with interpreting the screenplay and then explains the processes, tools and jobs of Directing and communicating your vision to the actors and crew on set.


WHO: Narrative and Documentary Filmmakers
FEE: $149 Includes Studio and Equipment

Schedule:
Wed., Oct. 28 from 6pm - 9pm

Use the "director" coupon code for a $50 discount.

LIMITED SEATING. Join us! Learn how to become a filmmaker.

This course is for anyone with an interest in the of how movies are directed. Writers, producers, actors, technicians, as well as directors – these are all people who need to get their visions and ideas across to their colleagues quickly and efficiently.

During the class, we will pass on key tips, work on a short scene and show how directing decisions are made.

Topics:

Developing Your Vision – Know your Story
Directing and Casting
Working with Actors
Directing The Camera
Keeping Your Eye On The Prize – Directing For the Edit

If you are looking for a informative and inspiring course on directing, this class is for you.

Instructor

Sania Jhankar graduated from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts with an honors degree in Film/TV and a minor in producing. Since, she has worked with Focus Features, Behind the Burner, MTV/VH1, USA Studios, IOM Production Company, News12 in The Bronx and Indiepix, for shows and films like Behind the Music, Milk and Taking Woodstock.

After releasing her directorial debut film, Butterflies of BIll Baker that starred Will Chase (Nashville) and Marin Hinkle (Two and a Half Men), Jhankar is currently working on the distribution of a NYC-based romantic comedy Get Happy.

Sign up at this link.
https://glassshackfilms.com/class-workshop/directing-workshop-wed-oct-28-6pm/

The class will be held at The Clemente located in the Lower East Side of Manhattan (LES). The Clemente
107 Suffolk Street
New York, NY 10002

Glass Shack Films Phone or Text
Ph: (917)[masked]

zoe (at) glassshackfilms (dot) com

results.description:
Actors are developing their own shows to develop a reel and call the shots.  This meetup will cover how to do just that.   


Any creator who wants to learn how to create their own web series, film or documentary.  Any genre and skill level. 

This meetup will give you the tools you need to establish yourself as a screenwriter, director, and web series maker. 


Divided into the critical paths to web series making, this is the first of a series of meetups that will cover the following.  

The Screenplay
There are a few things to take into account when you're writing your script so you don't create a monster or something this going to cost so much money that is not financially feasible to produce.  No matter where you are at with your script this section will give you helpful tips to move forward.

How to get help with your script

• Writers room

• Using Improv

• Hiring scriptwriters

Preparing for the Shoot
Pre-production is a very critical phase that includes script breakdown, shot list, hiring crew, casting, locations and equipment.  We'll go through each of these in detail using a webisode called Going Social. 


We tell you how movies are produced and will give dozens of shooting tips that will save you money and make it easier to get your movie made.

• Creating a budget

• Casting

• Choosing a camera

• Shooting on locations

• Guerilla filmmaking

So you want to direct?
Why is it that everyone want to direct, but no one ever takes the time to learn how?

This course will outline the principle basics of directing, and how to get the actors and crew to do what you want.

• Basics of film directing

• Crossing the line

• Camera placement and why it is important

• Communicating with your cast and crew

What happens when you step on set?
Once you step foot on the set there is an unseen beast called time that will haunt you if you don’t tame it.  This section will cover how to use the schedule and manage the crew so that you get all the shots needed for your film.  

• Production Schedule

• Shot list

• Assistant Director

• Director of Photography

• Sound
results.name: How to Create Your Own Show (Web, Film, Documentary)

results.description:
Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening from 6pm – 8pm at Countee Cullen/PS 194. located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. 

Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.

results.description:
This is the crash course where Glass Shack Film School instructors will introduce the world of indie web series making, with dozens of tips.

This powerful and information-packed workshop will give you the tools you need to establish yourself as a screenwriter, director, and web series maker. Divided into the critical paths to web series making, this course starts at the very beginning with Writing the Screenplay and then explains the processes, tools and jobs of actually Making the Web Series.

WHO: Web Series, Short, Feature Film, Documentary Filmmakers
FEE: $199 Includes Studio and Equipment

Schedule:
Wed., October 28, 6pm – 9pm
Thurs., October 29, 6pm – 9pm

Use the "web" coupon code for a $50 discount.

This workshop is for anyone wanting to get to know the industry, whether they have previous experience or not. This class is for:

- Passionate young newcomers looking for their for their voice to be heard
- Interested fans coming to see what it's all about
- Independent creators seeking inspiration and clarification
- Film Industry professionals looking for a new direction
- Other industry professionals hoping for a new career!

Every attendant is provided with a filmmakers handout containing web series making tips, tricks, resources and more. After the class each participant will have an opportunity to join a community of creators and realize your web making dreams.


The Screenplay

There are a few things to take into account when you're writing your script so you don't create a monster or something this going to cost so much money that is not financially feasible to produce. No matter where you are at with your script this section will give you helpful tips to move forward.

Script elements (locations, characters)
How to get help with your script
Writers room
Using Improv
Hiring scriptwriters


Preparing for the Shoot

Pre-production is a very critical phase that includes script breakdown, shot list, hiring crew, casting, locations and equipment. We'll go through each of these in detail using a webisode called Going Social. We tell you how movies are produced and will give dozens of shooting tips that will save you money and make it easier to get your movie made.

Creating a budget
Casting
Chosing a camera
Shooting on locations
Guerilla filmmaking


So you want to direct?

Why is it that everyone want to direct, but no one ever takes the time to learn how?

This course will outline the principle basics of directing, and how to get the actors and crew to do what you want.

Basics of film directing
Crossing the line
Camera placement and why it is important
Communicating with your cast and crew


What happens when you step on set?

Once you step foot on the set there is an unseen beast called time that will haunt you if you don’t tame it. This section will cover how to use the schedule and manage the crew so that you get all the shots needed for your film. Production Schedule
Shot list
Assistant Director
Director of Photography
Sound

Every participant is provided with a web series workbook containing filmmaking tips, tricks, resources and more. After the class each participant will have an opportunity to join a community of creators and realize your filmmaking dreams. Creators have new tools and techniques for production. Learn the latest techniques so that you can realize your ambition with a solid understanding and plan before you go into production or pursue this as a career.

Sign up at this link...

http://glassshackfilms.com/class-workshop/how-to-create-a-web-series-workshop-oct-28-29-6pm/

The Clemente
107 Suffolk Street
New York, NY 10002

Public Transit:

FMJZ to Delancey/Essex

Glass Shack Films Contact Info

Ph: (917)[masked]
zoe (at) glassshackfilms (dot) com

results.description:
Please note the change of time! We'll meet at the Main Street School parking lot for a loop run to Tarrytown and back. This is a lovely twilight run with Hudson River views. Total distance is just over 4 miles.

Details about the run

Route: As the sun is setting earlier now, we’ll leave promptly at 6 pm from the Main Street School parking lot. We'll head north on the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail, and turn left (west) at the Lyndhurst greenhouses to connect to the Riverwalk. At the Riverwalk we'll continue north to Van Wart Ave, before turning right (east) to return to Broadway for the run back to Irvington. A tentative route map is available here. 

Modifications for a shorter/slower-paced run: At various points runners can divert east toward Broadway and head back to Irvington.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.


Location: Main Street School parking lot (101 Main St)

Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Irvington to Tarrytown Loop

results.description:
About Us

This group is for all traders who want to join Investment Bank traders, the 5-10% of traders who are consistently profitable in trading the global markets. We will be discussing the Science behind the “Institutional or Banking Methodology” to trading and explaining why it's important to trade with the market, not against it! 

The Meetup Host Mr Brad Gilbert is originally from Sydney Australia and is a 25 year veteran of the foreign exchange market. He is a licensed trading professional (registered CTA with the NFA and ASIC), fund manager and specialist trading educator. With a career in foreign exchange trading (as a price maker not a salesman) spanning more than 25 years, he was Chief Dealer for Citibank in Sydney, London and New York as well as Commonwealth Bank of Australia and Toronto Dominion Bank. 

We are not Brokers parading as Traders who have "supposedly learned the secrets from bank traders".

We are investment bank traders!


Travelling widely throughout his career: Sydney, Singapore, HK, Tokyo, London, Frankfurt, Toronto & New York, Brad has managed huge bank Forex teams and assisted thousands of traders of all skill levels to become profitable in the markets and take up trading as their full time pursuit. He is the CEO of a Prop Trading Firm and is constantly on the lookout for new talent to join his firm.

Himself an active trader, Brad trades with a focus on FX, commodities and equity indices using methodologies he learned Trading on some of the biggest Bank Forex teams in the world! 


Meet Up Goals

We want everyone in our meet up to be making money. 

If not we want to know why: 

• Are you under capitalised?

• Are your stop losses unrealistic?

• Is your technical analysis working against you?


This is by far and away the most unique and interesting approach to forex trading you will find in New York. 

Come and meet traders that have worked on some of the biggest bank forex trading teams in the world. Focusing on most markets: forex, stock indices, commodities, and metals, this group has it all and can demonstrate profitability. 

Meet Up Agenda

Since there's been no readily available 'source' of experienced information in the market most traders bounce from one approach to another, waste a gazillion hours watching webinars from 'so-called experts' and continually experiment with 'miracle trade systems'. 

Trading is a journey that should always grow and develop as you learn more about the market and about yourself. But it's extremely important to have the 'Foundation' knowledge: understand how the market works, how the main players (the bankers) analyse and execute their trades. 

Once you have this foundation you can then apply all sorts of methods and tools to 'enhance' your performance. You'll find things that are a complete waste of time and others that are pure gold! 

Sharing Our Experience

This meet up is all about sharing the 'foundation' knowledge to get you on the path to success as a trader. We hope to meet fellow traders and share trading strategies and styles which can hopefully improve all of our performance. 

Whether you are interested in learning to trade or finding ways to invest your money in trading, a visit to this meetup is all you'll need to get started: beginner, intermediate and professional traders and investors are all welcome.

At the very least it's a great opportunity to meet like-minded people and share a few trading stories from the investment banking days whilst having a few drinks!

Come along and let's meet up.... I can assure you it'll definitely be worth your while!
results.name: My trading routine - hosted by former Citibank Head of FX  Brad Gilbert

results.description:
Technology is driving business at an unprecedented speed. But, on an almost daily business, cyber security breaches or hacks are taking place throughout the world. So, how do you protect your business, your family, your self? Join our distinguished panel of seasoned cybersecurity experts as they discuss cybersecurity in the real world and how it affects us personally and professionally. Light food and refreshments will be served.

Our Panelists:

Michael Dunner 
Senior Technical Account Manager 
Microsoft Corporation 

Michael has close to 20 years IT experience in the areas of software development, program management, project management, consulting, and service delivery management. He has worked at Microsoft for over 16 years and the majority of his experience has been in the area of cyber security, where he served as a Program Manager in both Window Security and Office Trustworthy Computing and as a Cyber Security Consultant. He has co-authored  two best-selling titles on writing secure code and holds degrees in Computer Science and Business Administration.

Anthony Dupree 
CIO and Chief Information Security Officer 
Novitex Enterprise Solutions

Prior to joining Novitex, Anthony served as the Senior Director of Technical Security Standards and Risk Assessment at McGraw-Hill Education, where he oversaw information security programs. He also held executive roles at Elizabeth Arden and Toys R Us, managing global enterprise IT security, network infrastructure and risk and compliance programs.

Anthony has served as an Army Reserve officer for over 25 years achieving the rank of Lieutenant Colonel; received the Bronze star for outstanding achievement while deployed during Operation Iraqi Freedom in 2003. 

Anthony holds certifications from the Information Systems Audit and Control Association and the International Council of E-Commerce Consultants. He received his Bachelor of Arts degree from the New York Institute of Technology and a Master’s degree in Technology from the Stevens Institute of Technology. He is currently enrolled in a PhD program in Information Assurance at Nova Southeastern University.

Robert L. Harper 
Senior Security Consultant 
BNY Mellon

Rob Harper is an Information Security and Risk professional with over 15 years Information Security experience and 28 years of IT experience. The majority of Rob’s experience comes from the Financial Industry.

Rob’s early work was in the Electrical Engineering, having earned a BE in Engineering Science. This provided him a firm technology background that proved useful in his work in IT. His IT work included architecting a Windows NT network and administrating the network and financial applications for a Japanese financial company. During that time, he earned his CCNA (Cisco Certified Network Associate).

In the Security space, Rob earned his Master’s in MIS, specializing in Information Security. He also has three security certifications - CISSP , CISM and CRISC .

His work in the Information Security field includes:

Information Security Awareness training and program development

Security Metrics program design and management

Information Security risk assessment

IT and Security Policy and Standard development and implementation

Omar McKenzie 
Chief Information Security Officer 
Gravitas

Omar has been a technology professional for over 15 years including 10 years designing, implementing and streamlining information security protection and assurance solutions in the financial services industry. He is experienced in managing programs for cyber security, information security, audit, and compliance with diverse requirements. Omar has a Master’s degree in Information Security from Nova Southeastern University and is also a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) since 2003 and a Certified Information System Security Architecture Professional (ISSAP) since 2005.  Omar is also a member of the Cloud Security Alliance. 

Court Graham 
Senior Director Information Security 
IT Planning and Compliance, Sirius - XM Radio

Court Graham is a Cyber Security professional with over 17 years of industry experience.  As a service member and recipient of the US Navy’s Advanced Electronic Computer Field training, Court was on the forefront of building and maintaining the network communications infrastructure which supports the Navy and Marine Corps tactical decision making today. Following a 6 year enlistment, Court worked as a government contractor performing security operations and incident response on the Naval Marine Corps Intranet (NMCI), the largest private network in the world. Later, Court would go on to use his acquired skills and ability to build, implement and maintain information security programs for organizations in industries including Financial Services, and Healthcare. Court now serves as the Sr. Director of Information Security at Sirius XM Satellite Radio.

Court has a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology and holds several industry certifications including the Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), Payment Card Industry Professional (PCIP), and others.

Moderator 

Sundiata Alaye 
Senior Director Information Risk and Compliance Management 
IT Planning and Compliance, Sirius - XM Radio 

Sundiata Alaye is the Senior Director, Information Risk and Compliance with over 15 Years Information Security, Compliance, and IT Audit experience. He started his career with SiriusXM in 2004.  Prior to that, he has worked in the Information Security Risk, Compliance field at both the American Red Cross and Federal Express. He is the former Executive Director of the Minority HIV and AIDS Coalition in Washington, D.C.  Sundiata is a graduate of Howard University in Washington, D.C, and resides in Washington, D.C.

Light food and refreshments will be served.

Wednesday October 28, 2015
6:00 P.M. - 9:00 P.M.
Sirius - XM Broadcast Headquarters
1290 Avenue of the Americas , 11th Floor
New York, NY 10020

Attendees MUST RSVP by October 26, 2015.

WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

You must register, which is free.  Do it here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/steven-pinker-and-robert-wright-discuss-science-and-the-search-for-meaning-tickets-18337608280


This event is part of “Contentions,” an interview and debate series hosted by Robert Wright, Visiting Professor of Science and Religion at Union Theological Seminary. Through conversations with prominent intellectuals, “Contentions” examines the relationship between science and spiritual questions.

Steven Pinker is an experimental psychologist and one of the world’s foremost writers on language, mind, and human nature. Currently Johnstone Family Professor of Psychology at Harvard University, Pinker has also taught at Stanford and MIT. His research on vision, language, and social relations has won prizes from the National Academy of Sciences, the Royal Institution of Great Britain, the Cognitive Neuroscience Society, and the American Psychological Association. He has also received eight honorary doctorates, several teaching awards at MIT and Harvard, and numerous prizes for his books The Language Instinct, How the Mind Works, The Blank Slate, and The Better Angels of Our Nature. He is Chair of the Usage Panel of the American Heritage Dictionary, and often writes for The New York Times, Time, and other publications. He has been named Humanist of the Year, Prospect magazine’s “The World’s Top 100 Public Intellectuals,” Foreign Policy’s “100 Global Thinkers,” and Time magazine’s “The 100 Most Influential People in the World Today.”


Robert Wright is the author, most recently, of The Evolution of God, which was a New York Times bestseller and a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize. His other books include The Moral Animal, which The New York Times Book Review named one of the ten best books of 1994, and Nonzero, which Bill Clinton called “astonishing” and instructed White House staff members to read. In 2009 Wright was named by Foreign Policy magazine as one of the top 100 global thinkers. Wright has written for The Atlantic, The New Yorker, The New York Times Magazine, Foreign Policy, and the op-ed pages of The New York Times, The Washington Post, and The Financial Times. His books have been translated into more than a dozen languages, and his awards include the National Magazine Award for Essay and Criticism. Wright is the Visiting Professor of Science and Religion at Union Theological Seminary in New York, and is editor-in-chief of the websites Bloggingheads.tv and MeaningofLife.tv.
results.how_to_find_us: Those interested will go out for a bite afterward at "Tom's Diner", the diner from "Seinfeld", 10 blocks away.  I look like my picture.

results.description:
Come join us for a night of board gaming fun. We play all sorts of board games and card games. We tend to play more euro games so please keep that in mind. Bringing a game is not necessary, but if you have one you want to play bring it along.

Valley Stream train station is very close about three blocks.

For those who drive:

• Street parking meters are until 6pm. If you come early, W. Jamaica Ave has a free parking lot, behind the pizzeria.


We have permission from the restaurant owner to play in the restaurant on the condition that everyone consumes something. At least a soda. The restaurant also has a bakery attached with treats.

We play in the restaurant; to get there, you enter the bakery walk to the back, then make a right. There you'll find the restaurant, we are located by the front windows.

• The bakery is located across the street from Mitchell's restaurant. There is a lighted OPEN sign on the window.

• Be aware this group has an age limit, those who come to game must be adults under 40**

**Due to popular demand we will now be having a 3 no show rule. If you RSVP but can't make it please take the time to take yourself off. Our group is small and we do plan our games on how many members will be showing up. Even if you unrsvp right before we start, one of us is always checking and we appreciate the info. I'll send you a warning after the 2nd no show, but after the third I'll have to take you out of our group.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be located inside the restaurant section by the windows
results.name: Wednesday board gaming in Valley Stream

Are you passionate about a career in Journalism, Broadcast & New Media?

Not sure how to get your “foot in the door” in this dynamic job market?

NY Career Meetup will answer these tough questions and much more!

This exclusive, limited space, info-packed event will feature experienced recruiters, industry professionals, a career coach, lots of experience and one agenda: How to get a job in Journalism, Broadcast & New Media.

Who Should Attend?

Those professionals looking for savvy, inside information on the NYC Journalism, Broadcast & New Media job market, including:

-‘Must-know’ facts before you apply: the current NYC Journalism, Broadcast & New Media job market/landscape

-Work-style/compensation/lifestyle/culture

-Up and coming /”hot” jobs

*What experience and skills recruiters are looking for

*Smart strategies/methodologies to find/search for jobs

*Freelancing/contract jobs and alternate job avenues

*Savvy ways to market yourself as a candidate

*How to develop a relationship with a recruiter/company

*How to enter Journalism, Broadcast & New Media as a fresh grad or a career changer

And more!

NOTE: This event provides targeted networking and learning opportunities with very seasoned and successful industry professionals, recruiters and career development professionals. Meet them in person, form partnerships, and learn the formula of finding a job in Journalism, Broadcast & New Media.

Click Here To Buy Tickets

*Complimentary light snacks will be served*

Early bird online registration- $15

Regular online registration - $20

At the door: $30

Purchase your ticket now here.

Guest Panelists:

Suvro Banerji, Associate Producer, CBS News


Suvro is an Associate Producer at CBS News in New York. His previous experience includes NBC News (News Digital/Social Media), Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN New York and CNN Atlanta), and KOMU-8 News (NBC affiliate in central Missouri), where he worked as a general assignment reporter/multimedia producer.  Suvro holds a Masters Degree in Broadcast Journalism from the Columbia University School of Journalism and a Bachelors Degree in Television News from the Missouri School of Journalism (dual-degree in Political Science).  @suvcbs

Delia Camasca, TV Producer & HR/Recruiting Professional

Is an Emmy Award winning Television Producer and Reporter and worked for major local TV stations and broadcast networks in New York City.  Her experience includes: news, public affairs and documentary production with companies such as Univision, Telemundo, WPIX-TV, PBS and WNET Channel 13.  She’s been a member of AFTRA and the WGA. After a successful career in TV she transitioned into Human Resources. For the last 10 years, she’s specialized in Talent Acquisition holding senior level & management roles with NBC Universal, Disney, ABC News, Lifetime, and Warner Brothers.  She teaches part-time for MediaBistro and is a Career Coach for media professionals for TVMediaCareers.com.  She holds a Bachelor of Science from St. John's University and received most of her HR training at Cornell University’s School of Industrial and Labor Relations.  She also holds a Certificate in Digital Media Marketing from New York University. You can follow her on LinkedIn, Facebook, Google+ and Twitter @tvmediacareers.

Kevin Betz,Senior Business Development Manager, Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network

Kevin Betz is currently Senior Business Development Manager for Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network, and heads up BD and publisher partnerships for Media.net’s NYC office. Media.net exclusively powers the Yahoo! Bing contextual ad program for publishers globally, and in simple terms, is Yahoo!’s version of Google’s AdSense for publishers. Throughout his new media career Kevin has gained extensive experience in new business acquisition and partner development for organizations ranging from global enterprises to early stage ad tech start-ups, and he has worked in a number of capacities including business development, account management, and sales and marketing.  He has keen ability and enjoys consultative Software-As-A-Service (SaaS) and platform sales, excited about innovative technologies, and has launched numerous advertising partnerships and campaigns from inception to execution for clients ranging from Conde Nast, New Orleans Jazz Fest, and many F500 brands. @kevbetz

Robin D. Schatz, Contributor at Forbes.com and Bisnow.com and Adjunct Professor at the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism

Robin is a versatile editor, writer and academic with cross-platform experience and a strong interest in business and technology, digital marketing, entrepreneurship, the future of food, health care policy and education. As an independent working journalist, Robin is currently a contributor to Forbes.com on their entrepreneurship vertical, and a contributor to Bisnow, a Commercial Real Estate News site. She has been published in the past few years in such media outlets as Fortune.com, Inc. Magazine, The MIT Technology Review Business Report, Fastcompany.com and various university magazines.

In addition to her journalism and consulting work, Robin is an adjunct associate professor at The Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism,

Moderator:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career consultant, speaker and author based in New York City who helps passion-driven professionals to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents, and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner herself, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at several university business schools.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer

 https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickiaubin

Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner herself, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at several university business schools.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer

 https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickiaubin

Guest Panelists:

Suvro Banerji, Associate Producer, CBS News


Suvro is an Associate Producer at CBS News in New York. His previous experience includes NBC News (News Digital/Social Media), Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN New York and CNN Atlanta), and KOMU-8 News (NBC affiliate in central Missouri), where he worked as a general assignment reporter/multimedia producer.  Suvro holds a Masters Degree in Broadcast Journalism from the Columbia University School of Journalism and a Bachelors Degree in Television News from the Missouri School of Journalism (dual-degree in Political Science).  @suvcbs 

Delia Camasca, TV Producer & HR/Recruiting Professional

Is an Emmy Award winning Television Producer and Reporter and worked for major local TV stations and broadcast networks in New York City.  Her experience includes: news, public affairs and documentary production with companies such as Univision, Telemundo, WPIX-TV, PBS and WNET Channel 13.  She’s been a member of AFTRA and the WGA. After a successful career in TV she transitioned into Human Resources. For the last 10 years, she’s specialized in Talent Acquisition holding senior level & management roles with NBC Universal, Disney, ABC News, Lifetime, and Warner Brothers.  She teaches part-time for MediaBistro and is a Career Coach for media professionals for TVMediaCareers.com.  She holds a Bachelor of Science from St. John's University and received most of her HR training at Cornell University’s School of Industrial and Labor Relations.  She also holds a Certificate in Digital Media Marketing from New York University. You can follow her on LinkedIn, Facebook, Google+ and Twitter @tvmediacareers.

Kevin Betz,Senior Business Development Manager, Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network

Kevin Betz is currently Senior Business Development Manager for Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network, and heads up BD and publisher partnerships for Media.net’s NYC office. Media.net exclusively powers the Yahoo! Bing contextual ad program for publishers globally, and in simple terms, is Yahoo!’s version of Google’s AdSense for publishers. Throughout his new media career Kevin has gained extensive experience in new business acquisition and partner development for organizations ranging from global enterprises to early stage ad tech start-ups, and he has worked in a number of capacities including business development, account management, and sales and marketing.  He has keen ability and enjoys consultative Software-As-A-Service (SaaS) and platform sales, excited about innovative technologies, and has launched numerous advertising partnerships and campaigns from inception to execution for clients ranging from Conde Nast, New Orleans Jazz Fest, and many F500 brands. @kevbetz

Robin D. Schatz, Contributor at Forbes.com and Bisnow.com and Adjunct Professor at the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism

Robin is a versatile editor, writer and academic with cross-platform experience and a strong interest in business and technology, digital marketing, entrepreneurship, the future of food, health care policy and education. As an independent working journalist, Robin is currently a contributor to Forbes.com on their entrepreneurship vertical, and a contributor to Bisnow, a Commercial Real Estate News site. She has been published in the past few years in such media outlets as Fortune.com, Inc. Magazine, The MIT Technology Review Business Report, Fastcompany.com and various university magazines.

In addition to her journalism and consulting work, Robin is an adjunct associate professor at The Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism,

Delia Camasca, TV Producer & HR/Recruiting Professional

His previous experience includes NBC News (News Digital/Social Media), Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN New York and CNN Atlanta), and KOMU-8 News (NBC affiliate in central Missouri), where he worked as a general assignment reporter/multimedia producer.  Suvro holds a Masters Degree in Broadcast Journalism from the Columbia University School of Journalism and a Bachelors Degree in Television News from the Missouri School of Journalism (dual-degree in Political Science).  @suvcbs

Delia Camasca, TV Producer & HR/Recruiting Professional

Is an Emmy Award winning Television Producer and Reporter and worked for major local TV stations and broadcast networks in New York City.  Her experience includes: news, public affairs and documentary production with companies such as Univision, Telemundo, WPIX-TV, PBS and WNET Channel 13.  She’s been a member of AFTRA and the WGA. After a successful career in TV she transitioned into Human Resources. For the last 10 years, she’s specialized in Talent Acquisition holding senior level & management roles with NBC Universal, Disney, ABC News, Lifetime, and Warner Brothers.  She teaches part-time for MediaBistro and is a Career Coach for media professionals for TVMediaCareers.com.  She holds a Bachelor of Science from St. John's University and received most of her HR training at Cornell University’s School of Industrial and Labor Relations.  She also holds a Certificate in Digital Media Marketing from New York University. You can follow her on LinkedIn, Facebook, Google+ and Twitter @tvmediacareers.

Kevin Betz,Senior Business Development Manager, Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network

Kevin Betz is currently Senior Business Development Manager for Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network, and heads up BD and publisher partnerships for Media.net’s NYC office. Media.net exclusively powers the Yahoo! Bing contextual ad program for publishers globally, and in simple terms, is Yahoo!’s version of Google’s AdSense for publishers. Throughout his new media career Kevin has gained extensive experience in new business acquisition and partner development for organizations ranging from global enterprises to early stage ad tech start-ups, and he has worked in a number of capacities including business development, account management, and sales and marketing.  He has keen ability and enjoys consultative Software-As-A-Service (SaaS) and platform sales, excited about innovative technologies, and has launched numerous advertising partnerships and campaigns from inception to execution for clients ranging from Conde Nast, New Orleans Jazz Fest, and many F500 brands. @kevbetz

Robin D. Schatz, Contributor at Forbes.com and Bisnow.com and Adjunct Professor at the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism

Robin is a versatile editor, writer and academic with cross-platform experience and a strong interest in business and technology, digital marketing, entrepreneurship, the future of food, health care policy and education. As an independent working journalist, Robin is currently a contributor to Forbes.com on their entrepreneurship vertical, and a contributor to Bisnow, a Commercial Real Estate News site. She has been published in the past few years in such media outlets as Fortune.com, Inc. Magazine, The MIT Technology Review Business Report, Fastcompany.com and various university magazines.

In addition to her journalism and consulting work, Robin is an adjunct associate professor at The Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism,

Moderator:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career consultant, speaker and author based in New York City who helps passion-driven professionals to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents, and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner herself, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at several university business schools.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer

results.name: Jobs in Journalism, Broadcast & New Media - A Career Roundtable for Job Seekers

results.description:
Synopsis:
The principles of professional software development extend to test engineering as well, so does that mean we test our tests? Our test harnesses are typically composed from test runners, assertion libraries, and test double frameworks written and tested by somebody else. Wouldn't further testing simply be duplication?

On a former project, my team was building machine-learning models to predict user behavior. In engineering a test harness to drive the MapReduce infrastructure behind those models, we discovered two uses for software testing in test harness development:

• Employing Acceptance-Test-Driven Development to engineer a system able to orchestrate our complex model-learning pipeline, and

• Testing custom assertions in cases where the test itself is necessarily long running and/or expensive.

One of these turns out to be a good idea and the other rather poor, but both produced many learning opportunities along the way.

Presenter:
Wesley Harris will be presentating.

Agenda:
• 6:15PM - Check-in
• 6:30PM - Introductions
• 6:40PM - Presentation starts
• 7:45PM - Presentation winds down + QnA
• 8:00PM - Wind down + Networking

Thanks to:
Animoto for sponsoring the venue and the snacks.

Additional notes:
• Do plan to get to the venue early enough so that we give our presenter, Wesley, uninterrupted presentation time 
• Please be respectful of our venue sponsors' work area
results.name: When to Test the Tests: Lessons Learned in the Land of Anti-Patterns
