Are you passionate about a career in Journalism, Broadcast & New Media?

Not sure how to get your “foot in the door” in this dynamic job market?

NY Career Meetup will answer these tough questions and much more!

This exclusive, limited space, info-packed event will feature experienced recruiters, industry professionals, a career coach, lots of experience and one agenda: How to get a job in Journalism, Broadcast & New Media.

Who Should Attend?

Those professionals looking for savvy, inside information on the NYC Journalism, Broadcast & New Media job market, including:

-‘Must-know’ facts before you apply: the current NYC Journalism, Broadcast & New Media job market/landscape

-Work-style/compensation/lifestyle/culture

-Up and coming /”hot” jobs

*What experience and skills recruiters are looking for

*Smart strategies/methodologies to find/search for jobs

*Freelancing/contract jobs and alternate job avenues

*Savvy ways to market yourself as a candidate

*How to develop a relationship with a recruiter/company

*How to enter Journalism, Broadcast & New Media as a fresh grad or a career changer

And more!

NOTE: This event provides targeted networking and learning opportunities with very seasoned and successful industry professionals, recruiters and career development professionals. Meet them in person, form partnerships, and learn the formula of finding a job in Journalism, Broadcast & New Media.

Click Here To Buy Tickets

*Complimentary light snacks will be served*

Early bird online registration- $15

Regular online registration - $20

At the door: $30

Purchase your ticket now here.

Guest Panelists:

Suvro Banerji, Associate Producer, CBS News


Suvro is an Associate Producer at CBS News in New York. His previous experience includes NBC News (News Digital/Social Media), Anderson Cooper 360 (CNN New York and CNN Atlanta), and KOMU-8 News (NBC affiliate in central Missouri), where he worked as a general assignment reporter/multimedia producer.  Suvro holds a Masters Degree in Broadcast Journalism from the Columbia University School of Journalism and a Bachelors Degree in Television News from the Missouri School of Journalism (dual-degree in Political Science).  @suvcbs

Delia Camasca, TV Producer & HR/Recruiting Professional

Is an Emmy Award winning Television Producer and Reporter and worked for major local TV stations and broadcast networks in New York City.  Her experience includes: news, public affairs and documentary production with companies such as Univision, Telemundo, WPIX-TV, PBS and WNET Channel 13.  She’s been a member of AFTRA and the WGA. After a successful career in TV she transitioned into Human Resources. For the last 10 years, she’s specialized in Talent Acquisition holding senior level & management roles with NBC Universal, Disney, ABC News, Lifetime, and Warner Brothers.  She teaches part-time for MediaBistro and is a Career Coach for media professionals for TVMediaCareers.com.  She holds a Bachelor of Science from St. John's University and received most of her HR training at Cornell University’s School of Industrial and Labor Relations.  She also holds a Certificate in Digital Media Marketing from New York University. You can follow her on LinkedIn, Facebook, Google+ and Twitter @tvmediacareers.

Kevin Betz,Senior Business Development Manager, Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network

Kevin Betz is currently Senior Business Development Manager for Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network, and heads up BD and publisher partnerships for Media.net’s NYC office. Media.net exclusively powers the Yahoo! Bing contextual ad program for publishers globally, and in simple terms, is Yahoo!’s version of Google’s AdSense for publishers. Throughout his new media career Kevin has gained extensive experience in new business acquisition and partner development for organizations ranging from global enterprises to early stage ad tech start-ups, and he has worked in a number of capacities including business development, account management, and sales and marketing.  He has keen ability and enjoys consultative Software-As-A-Service (SaaS) and platform sales, excited about innovative technologies, and has launched numerous advertising partnerships and campaigns from inception to execution for clients ranging from Conde Nast, New Orleans Jazz Fest, and many F500 brands. @kevbetz

Robin D. Schatz, Contributor at Forbes.com and Bisnow.com and Adjunct Professor at the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism

Robin is a versatile editor, writer and academic with cross-platform experience and a strong interest in business and technology, digital marketing, entrepreneurship, the future of food, health care policy and education. As an independent working journalist, Robin is currently a contributor to Forbes.com on their entrepreneurship vertical, and a contributor to Bisnow, a Commercial Real Estate News site. She has been published in the past few years in such media outlets as Fortune.com, Inc. Magazine, The MIT Technology Review Business Report, Fastcompany.com and various university magazines.

In addition to her journalism and consulting work, Robin is an adjunct associate professor at The Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism,

Moderator:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career consultant, speaker and author based in New York City who helps passion-driven professionals to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents, and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do. With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner herself, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at several university business schools.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer

 https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickiaubin

venue.name: Champions Dance Studio

results.description:
Club Dance Class

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

https://vimeo.com/90287327

https://vimeo.com/82163219

https://vimeo.com/87729077

https://vimeo.com/78107028

https://vimeo.com/77569204

https://vimeo.com/89375819

Cost:


Your first sample meetup is $15 (cash only please)

Regular single meetup is $20

Please note that I have a 24 hour cancellation policy for EVERY meetup - if I don't get your cancellation a day before class, I will have to charge you for the class you missed.

Please note that there is at least 4 guys/girls every meetup even though they don't RSVP'd here - join us!

Rewards Cards available - get your card and start earning free classes!

See you on the dance floor! :-)

Monika

Suvro Banerji, Associate Producer, CBS News

Delia Camasca, TV Producer & HR/Recruiting Professional

Is an Emmy Award winning Television Producer and Reporter and worked for major local TV stations and broadcast networks in New York City.  Her experience includes: news, public affairs and documentary production with companies such as Univision, Telemundo, WPIX-TV, PBS and WNET Channel 13.  She’s been a member of AFTRA and the WGA. After a successful career in TV she transitioned into Human Resources. For the last 10 years, she’s specialized in Talent Acquisition holding senior level & management roles with NBC Universal, Disney, ABC News, Lifetime, and Warner Brothers.  She teaches part-time for MediaBistro and is a Career Coach for media professionals for TVMediaCareers.com.  She holds a Bachelor of Science from St. John's University and received most of her HR training at Cornell University’s School of Industrial and Labor Relations.  She also holds a Certificate in Digital Media Marketing from New York University. You can follow her on LinkedIn, Facebook, Google+ and Twitter @tvmediacareers.

Kevin Betz,Senior Business Development Manager, Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network

Kevin Betz is currently Senior Business Development Manager for Media.net | Yahoo! Bing Network, and heads up BD and publisher partnerships for Media.net’s NYC office. Media.net exclusively powers the Yahoo! Bing contextual ad program for publishers globally, and in simple terms, is Yahoo!’s version of Google’s AdSense for publishers. Throughout his new media career Kevin has gained extensive experience in new business acquisition and partner development for organizations ranging from global enterprises to early stage ad tech start-ups, and he has worked in a number of capacities including business development, account management, and sales and marketing.  He has keen ability and enjoys consultative Software-As-A-Service (SaaS) and platform sales, excited about innovative technologies, and has launched numerous advertising partnerships and campaigns from inception to execution for clients ranging from Conde Nast, New Orleans Jazz Fest, and many F500 brands. @kevbetz

Robin D. Schatz, Contributor at Forbes.com and Bisnow.com and Adjunct Professor at the Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism

Robin is a versatile editor, writer and academic with cross-platform experience and a strong interest in business and technology, digital marketing, entrepreneurship, the future of food, health care policy and education. As an independent working journalist, Robin is currently a contributor to Forbes.com on their entrepreneurship vertical, and a contributor to Bisnow, a Commercial Real Estate News site. She has been published in the past few years in such media outlets as Fortune.com, Inc. Magazine, The MIT Technology Review Business Report, Fastcompany.com and various university magazines.

In addition to her journalism and consulting work, Robin is an adjunct associate professor at The Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism,

results.description:
Topic

QuantConnect is an open source, algorithmic trading infrastructure allowing engineers to test powerful flexible ideas in a professional caliber framework. Using the QuantConnect LEAN project engineers can skip the routine piping coding and focus on their models of the world and battle against the brightest in the markets.


Modelling of the markets is one of the most challenging problems the world has to offer. It is infinite in its complexity and never behaves the same way for long. 

Our talk will be about using .NET to design an extensible, cross platform, multi-language, desktop-cloud hybrid architecture for the open source community. We support C#, F#, Java, Python and Visual Basic all through the same C# Mono platform!


https://www.quantconnect.com

https://lean.quantconnect.com


About the Speaker

Jared Broad is the founder and CEO of QuantConnect, a web based algorithmic trading platform breaking down the barriers to quantitative trading. He studied Biomedical Engineering in New Zealand and worked on resonant inductive power transfer for medical technology.

Before QuantConnect he ran an algorithmic hedge-fund for 2 years, worked with international humanitarian organizations and circled the world twice.
results.how_to_find_us: Central Park East (6th Floor, Room 6501a)
results.name: Exploring the Architecture of QuantConnect

results.description:
Wednesday, October 28, 2015

6:30 PM Sharp! 

You must have an RSVP or be a guest to attend.  Due to security and capacity reasons.

RSVP's will close on Monday 10/26 at 5 PM.

Hulu NY


79 5th Ave, 15th Floor, New York, NY  

Once you enter the building, take the elevator to the 15th floor and check-in at the RSVP table located in the lobby.  

Thank you for expressing interest in The Future of TV Content Meetup! We hope to see as many of you as possible.

There was a lot of interesting activity taking place in New York City recently on the topic of television's future including #NYCTVWK and #nexttvsummit.

Our first topic of discussion, What is television today?


The Agenda Includes:

• 6:30 PM -  Networking

• Barbara Leflein, President of Leflein Associates, "The convergence of working in media and being an avid content consumer"  - It's all about serving the viewers!


• Justin Fromm, Director of Ad Sales Research at Hulu, "Purposeful Viewing"  - How Hulu Views TV 


• Group Activities:

1. Who's In The Room?  -  QUICK introductions!


2. What does TV mean to you?  -  A brief exercise



3. Content Call Out - Discovering further topics to explore.

The official hashtag for the meetup is #NYTVFuture


A very special thanks to our sponsor Hulu Insights, for the lovely space, general support, and mouth-watering refreshments (Taco Bar).

Extra special thanks to Sabrina Muldoon of Hulu!


We can't wait to see you!

results.name: Why -- NYC?

results.description:
Last group conversation on "To Be Married or Single" turned out to be a big success. So, let's continue!

( For folks unable to be at the site physically, please contact me. We can do Skype. So you can participate into the conversation digitally.  )

This time, we will address the questions related to NYC social life. Please come prepared with your personal answers to the following questions: 

-- When, why and how did you move here?

-- How would you describe your relationship with New York City?

-- What are the city's attractions? What are the disappointments?

-- Has New York changed you? How so?

-- New York and social relations (love) - what are the challenges? Why?How does NYC impact love?

-- What strategies do you use to cope with challenges?

...

I'll let the Danish Social Anthropologist Ciara to lead this discussion. 

We can socialize afterwards.

results.description:
Join us on October 28 for the NYC Nonprofit Technology Meetup #2.

Our speakers this month will include:


• David Fine, Product Manager at Placemeter 

David will discuss Placemeters' urban intelligence platform that quantifies the movement of modern cities, at scale.  Placemeter ingests any kind of video to analyze pedestrian and vehicular movement, revealing hidden patterns and strategic opportunities. Their mission is to help build stronger businesses, efficient cities, and innovative neighborhoods worldwide.

• Alexandra Barker, Data Dissemination at US Census Bureau

Alexandra will be discussing products developed by the US Census Bureau as part of the presidential initiative for an Open Government/Open Data. They are making all our demographic, socioeconomic, housing, business, and geospatial data available via the Census API. The CitySDK was created this past June to help developers access Census data via our API. Census data is a public asset, it's free to everyone. However, most people don't know the scope of the data available, and how to access it.

Event Timeline:

6:30pm - 7:30pm: Speakers and Q&A

7:30pm - 8:30pm: Drinks and networking
results.name: NYC Nonprofit Tech #2: Sensors and Open Data - Placemeter and US Census Bureau

results.description:
>>> PURCHASE TICKETS HERE <<<

PLEASE BYPASS the RSVP button at right and register directly above. If you are a dues-paying Member of Out Professionals, this assures you no-cost or low-cost admission to this event. (Nonmembers are always welcome, but nonmember rates apply if you are just part of our Meetup group.) For a full year of Member savings and other career benefits, join Out Professionals here.

BOSS WON’T LISTEN? CLIENT NEVER HAPPY? CO-WORKER WON’T COOPERATE? DIAN KILLIAN SHOWS YOU HOW TO COPE WITH THESE AND OTHER IMPOSSIBLE PEOPLE.

On Wednesday, October 28, Out Professionals presents “How to Get Great Results Out of Impossible People,” an interactive workshop with coach, trainer and consultant Dian Killian, PhD.

It can be hard to see the good in someone who comes across as uncooperative or demanding, pushy or passive-aggressive. Or who may fail to listen, to understand another’s point of view or to follow through.

Dealing with such people can be especially crucial at work, where time is at a premium and your performance depends upon support and collaboration.

This Out Professionals workshop is designed to give you the tools to transform any situation into one marked by greater insight, connection and trust.

Because, according to Killian, you can work with almost anybody when you know how to analyze what’s really going on between you.

This workshop aims to help you:

• Get clear about your objectives and what's really driving a situation

• Transform judgments, demands and blame into understanding and connection

• Make powerful requests that better satisfy your needs

• Find the "yes" behind the "no,” opening up new avenues to win/win solutions

Dian Killian, PhD is a certified professional Life Coach specializing in communication, team work and collaboration. The co-author of two books, “Connecting Across Differences: How to Find Common Ground with Anyone, Anywhere, Anytime” and “Urban Empathy: True Life Adventures of Compassion on the Streets of NY,” she is also a certified trainer with the international Center for Nonviolent Communication. Dian appears regularly at the 92nd Street Y and the Omega Institute, and works in-house with organizations ranging from start-ups to Fortune 100 companies.

WHERE

The LGBT Community Center, 208 West 13th Street, between 7th and 8th Avenues. For room number, see lobby posting. Subway: 1/2/3, A/C/E or F/M to 14th Street; L to 6th or 8th Avenue. Directions from where you are: <a>www.hopstop.com.</a>

WHAT'S UP


On Wednesday, Oct. 28, doors open at 6:30 p.m. for casual networking, advance seating. Workshop and Q&A, 7:00 to 8:30 p.m.

ADMISSION

Nonmember, $25. Dues-paying OP Member, just $15. OP Business Member, free with advance registration. Please print and pocket a copy of your online receipt. Advance ticketing ends at noon on Wednesday, Oct. 28. Walk-ins welcome; cash only at the door.

SPECIAL MEMBERSHIP OFFER

One-year individual OP Membership (new or renewal) PLUS one ticket to this information-packed workshop, just $75 total. Or join Out Professionals as a Business Member ($125) and by registering in advance, attend this and other OP seminars and workshops free! Click here.
results.name: Let's Meetup and Learn to Deal With Difficult People!

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description:
What does it take to break the cycle of poverty? There are 1.2 billion people worldwide living in extreme poverty, and although this number is declining, Sub-Saharan Africa is the only region in the world where the number of poor individuals has risen. (World Bank, 2013) Karina Weinstein, FXB USA Program Director, will share how the pioneering FXBVillage methodology is breaking the cycle of poverty in countries across Africa and worldwide. The FXBVillage methodology is a field-tested model that is now available online (https://fxb.org/toolkit/) in an open-source toolkit that was developed with input from experts at Harvard University. For over 25 years, the methodology has delivered extraordinary results in more than 150 FXBVillages and is currently active in seven developing countries. Over three years, the FXBVillage methodology brings the extreme poor to self-sufficiency by simultaneously tackling the five drivers of poverty: food, education, income, health and housing. Independent evaluations have shown that four years after the FXBVillage program’s end, 86 percent of FXBVillage families are able to maintain long-term self-sufficiency, and their children are able to stay in school and succeed.

Previously, Karina Weinstein was a Program Associate at the Association of Junior Leagues International, Inc. and Director at Beck Community Development Foundation. She holds a Bachelor of Arts in International Relations from Tufts University and a Master in Public Policy from Harvard University, Kennedy School of Government.
results.name: Communities of Hope, Opportunity and Prosperity – The FXB Village Model

group.name: Progress and Prosperity, Land and Liberty – New York City

results.description:
Turner Classic Movies presents a double feature of the classic Universal film Dracula starring Bela Lugosi and its Spanish-language twin starring Carlos Villarias.

See the legendary Bela Lugosi on the big screen in the role that made him world-famous and set the image of Count Dracula for many future incarnations -- and parodies.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gqr3yzr64V4

Don't worry about the lack of subtitles in this clip; the film will have subtitles:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qgDUuKCCeRc

These two films were shot on the same soundstage, with the Mexican cast using the studio at night after the US crew wrapped for the day.  The Spanish-language version was thought to be lost forever until a high-quality copy turned up in a private collection in Cuba in the early 90s.

These films will be shown in the original aspect ratio but have been digitally mastered for picture clarity.

Tickets are $12.50 for this double feature.  Purchase at this link, which is directly from the theatre.  If you are an AMC Stubs Member there is no transaction fee.

Three years ago TCM presented their Frankenstein double feature which sold out.  Do not wait to purchase tickets to this, which will be the first opportunity most of us will have to see these films on a big screen.

Please be sure your communication settings allow you to receive updates to this event.

Originally posted 8/11/15
results.how_to_find_us: Screening begins at 7; I will be in the screening room wearing a Meetup badge and a Dracula T-shirt.
results.name: Turner Classic Movies Presents:  Dracula Double Feature -- This will sell out!

results.description: The Intro talk is on What is Fear? and a Fearless Living tool called Stretch, Risk, Die (SRD) My hope is that you will learn something new about yourselves, connect and share a bit of who you are. It may sound cliché but life is a journey. Being Fearless isn't about not feeling fear. It is about feeling fear and not letting it stop you from moving forward. Many of us make decisions based on fear. 2016 is a chance for you to do something new. Guess what? 2015 is a chance for you to do something new as well. Join me in practicing Fearlessness! You will meet me in an office building in he conference room on the 10th floor, where I will be waiting to seat you. If you have any questions please message me.
results.name: What is Fear? Intro Talk

group.name: Learn to Live Fearlessly in 2016! Intro Talk with Lajuana

results.description:
We've had some laughs and so much head shaking during the first two Republican debates. After watching how adults handle a debate when the Democrats took their turn, now we get a chance to see if the Republicans took any cues from that one. 

Based on the Benghazi hearings, we can safely say no. It's very rare that the third of movies are as good as the first two. Is that true of Republican debates? So please join us once again at Pacific Standard to see if the GOP can either become more adult like or turn up the crazy. Something tells me it will be the latter. We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: GOP Debate Watch Party: Brooklyn Edition

We'll also explore the beginning aspects of making a beat in both Ableton as well as Logic. 

Questions and great discussion are sure to follow. 

As always the finest coffee and pastries will be served, we know no other way.

See you there!

results.description:
Join us for the next Wearable Wednesday NYC event. We'll have an exciting discussion on Wearable & the Connected Home.

Evening Agenda 

Arrive: 6:30

Welcome Remarks: 6:30-6:45p

Panel: 6:45-7:30p

Networking 7:30-8:30p

Leadership Panel: 

Paul Farkas, moderator, Accessory2, Wearable Wednesday NYC

David Berkowitz, CMO, MRY

Shaun Springer, Founder, CEO, Twist (Astro)

Will McLeod, CoFounder, Chief Product Officer, Keen Home

Kimmie Smith, CoFounder, Creative Director, Accessory2, Mens Athleisure


More about the speakers 

David Berkowitz, CMO, MRY 

David Berkowitz is Chief Marketing Officer at agency MRY, where he spearheads marketing operations, directs the agency's communication strategy. Previously, he spent seven years at agency 360i, ultimately serving as Vice President of Emerging Media, having co-founded the agency’s social media practice in 2006 and led the Startup Outlook initiative.

He has spoken at more than 250 events around the world, including South by Southwest (SXSW) in Texas, Digital Age 2.0 in Brazil, Crowdsourcing Week in Singapore, and the keynote at Interactive Marketing Summit 2013 in Turkey. He has also been the featured speaker at corporate summits at the headquarters of Google, Coca-Cola, Cox Communications, and About.com.

David has written more than 500 bylines for outlets such as Advertising Age, The Economist, Mashable, and Mediapost. He has authored his own MarketersStudio blog since 2005. He has spoken at more than 200 events globally. While working as an editor at research firm eMarketer, he interviewed 175 executives and authors about technology and business. He is frequently quoted online and in print, having appeared in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, Reuters, the New York Post, the Associated Press, and USA Today. Ad Age, Ad Week, and PR Week have all named him among the most influential advertising and marketing professionals on Twitter.

Shaun Springer, CEO, Founder, Astro (featuring Twist)

Astro is the first smart home platform for apartments. It has launched its first product, Twist the first LED light bulb with an AirPlay seaker built in. No bulbs, no wires, no installation. Now you can put the beautful lighting and seamless audio anywhere you can screw in a light bulb. .www.HelloTwist.com.

Kimmie Smith, Creative Director, CoFounder, Mens Athleisure, Accessory2

Kimmie Smith is a celebrity statement stylist, designer and TV personality, based in NYC. @AccessoryExpert. 

Kimmie cofounded fashion and lifestyle tech creative styling house and consultancy, Accessory2 and Mens Athleisure. She also created Accessory Agenda discovery platform. 

Her roots were working with the Chairmen and creative C-Suite leadership at heritage brands Abercrombie & Fitch, Anthropologie and Lacoste. Kimmie is a stylist contributor to DJ Mag, Hello Mimi, Vogue Italia, and Luxury Daily. She appears on a range of style segments, including ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX, HSN, Arise 360 Entertainment and more. She is also a spokesperson for a range of brands within fashion, accessories, beauty and technology, including Crest 3D White, Intel, Microsoft and Smirnoff. 

She designed the Kimmie Smith x Sebago artisan shoe collection and regularly appeared as a brand personality on HSN. Kimmie’s been in campaigns for Coach, Monet, Palladium and Ralph Lauren. She is a Vogue, Cosmopolitan, Lucky and People Style Watch influencer.


----------

Wearable Wednesday NYC was CoFounded by Paul Farkas, CEOCo-Founder,Accessory2, a fashion and wearable lifestyle creative house and consultany based in NYC.http://Accessory2.com/ Twitter: @Accessory_2 | @WearableMedia

In association with, Wearable World. Wearable World connects businesses to the social fabric of the Internet of Wearable Things. Through news content, incubator and accelerator programs, and events, Wearable World acts as the catalyst for future Wearable Technology innovation.  The Wearable World platform addresses the need for entrepreneurs to connect, learn, and engage the wider Wearable Technology global ecosystem. http://wearableworld.co

WeWork is the platform for creators.  We provide the workspace, community, and services you need to make a life, not just a living.  To learn more about the WeWork locations in New York City, click here to book a tour or send an email to [masked]. Make sure to let them know Accessory2 sent you.

This month we will have Tom Breloff talking about visualization and machine learning in Julia. Pizza from 6:30-7:00. Tom starts at 7:00. By 8:30 we will head to a local bar for a drink.

About the talk: We will discuss the plotting ecosystem in Julia, and a new plotting interface and toolset, Plots.jl.  We will walk through sample data analysis workflows using Julia packages, and interactively visualize machine learning algorithms using Plots. 

Bio: Tom worked on Wall St for 10 years as a quant and trader, building high speed trading systems and models, and managing algorithmic trading portfolios. He is currently consulting and working on Julia development full time. 

https://github.com/tbreloff

https://www.linkedin.com/pub/thomas-breloff/b9/910/99

results.description:
Welcome Back, HCx3DP Synergist!

Looking forward to hosting you for our October Meetup for Wednesday, 28 October, at 6:30 PM. At this event (as before), we are continuing to report on, evolve and advance our ambitious "Health Maker Lab" (HML) Program---with this October informal Workshop #6.

Please take a moment and scroll-down to review our latest HML Mission Statement (short and long forms)!

+++

AND, we're pleased that CityScience is Venue-Hosting us---for the second (generous) time in a row!---at their offices (68 Jay St., Suite 403) in DUMBO, Brooklyn. (CitySci's innovative approach to K-8 STEM/STEAM education complements some of the HC-tech teaching/learning---for adults and children---we hope to include within HML's "Big Tent" curriculum.) 

+++

We're delighted to announce that we continue to drive our HML Community interests forward with brio! Right now, we're working hard---with a Brooklyn Law School, grad-student team from its CUBE Community Development Clinic---to prep our positioning and docs for our New York State Not-for-Profit application. (This is the important milestone at which can begin to solicit and accept donor contributions---Huzzah!) BTW, "CUBE" stands for "Center for Urban Business Entrepreneurship."


+++

As promised above, here is Rev 2.0 of our Health Maker Lab "Mission Statement(s)." 

(As remarked prior, this is probably the most important "public positioning" we make. Everything else really stems from this memorialized "action concept"---of what we will do as NfP Health Maker Lab:) 

+++

Our Mission (Short Form); aka “Positioning Statement”:

Health Maker Lab Empowers Citizen-Scientists To Create Healthcare Solutions At The Community MakerRoots

Our Health Maker Lab Mission:

Our Health Maker Lab (HML) is designed to help inspire, develop and support novel Healthcare (HC) solutions for the betterment of patient outcomes. These improved HC results---in both lower cost and higher quality---will include the generation of new Healthcare-related Middle-Class jobs in New York City’s ultra-urban communities.

Compared to other industrialized nations, our United States Healthcare system delivers care that costs twice as much as the next most-expensive country. At the same time, our overall patient outcomes rank below the average of all other advanced nations.

Our burgeoning HML Community is appropriately rooted in New York City. Because: this is the Nation’s “Healthcare Capital,” the HQ of American 3D Printing and the locus of the second largest tech-business population in the country. Thus, we believe that our NYC-based HML is uniquely positioned to respond to our countrywide, on-going, Healthcare crisis.

Hence, we are creating a New York State, Not-for-Profit (NfP) organization that is designed to empower Citizen-Scientists to create Healthcare solutions.

HML will take maximum advantage of today’s and tomorrow’s worldwide “change engines.” We will house and integrated these “engines” in each of our stand-alone, neighborhood-based, multi-discipline Labs. As we add new HMLs, each will join our evolving and cross-supporting Network of Labs in NYC.

Our HMLs will become experiential destinations---venues of excitement, edutainment and entrepreneurship---for HealthTech tourism, Community education and inspiration for Life-Science startups.

Our HML solution drivers will include: (1) the new Maker Movement ethos; (2) technology disruption and democratization (“DisDem”); (3) community confabs (“ComCon”) through physical and online proximity; and (4) new modes of tech education. These last embrace Project-Based Learning, hands-on/minds-on neo-apprenticeships, online knowledge repositories, MOOCs (massive open online courses), just-in-time education, on-demand training and specific-need/job-generation "bootcamps."

Our Health Maker Lab (HML) Community believes that our national Healthcare system---with its out-of-control costs delivering mediocre results---does NOT accord with our citizenries’ faith in American “exceptionalism.” We believe empowering today’s MakerRoots Citizen-Scientists is a key solution to our national Healthcare (HC) problem---a set of systemic “ills” that represents THE paramount political, financial and societal problem in the U.S. today.

To begin, HML will be take the conceptual, organizational and physical form of a “Maker Space.” However, the activities in our Health Maker Lab will be focused on a new domain of “making.” This literal and figurative “space” will be designed to help participants---such as Citizen LifeScientists, BioMakers, MedTechies, HealthTinkers, MakerNurses and more---tech-play, experiment, construct hardware, develop software and subsequently create novel Healthcare synergies and solutions.

We are planning to open our archetypal HML in Brooklyn, NY in mid-2016. This new-concept Lab will serve as the precursor to a network of NYC HMLs. In future and from the start, each added Lab “node” will be designed for ongoing collaboration, digital interaction and continual co-evolution within our eventual HML network.

Each local Lab will empower our various “Bio/Med” Makers---and their Healthcare solution-making---at the neighborhood MakerRoots. With co-located---yet diverse---disciplines, each HML will foster the success synergies of cross-pollinated solutions in-house. Each “networked” HML Community, its various “Action Centers” and individual Teams/Members will---separately and as a group---help “cure” our national HC dysfunction.

Our goal is HML’s successful solution-provisioning around Healthcare Making, Bio/Med Tech, HC Entrepreneurship and Health-Job Generation at the ultra-urban, neighborhood level in New York City. 

[End: Mission Statement] 

+++

Rounding out these Mission Statements, we have also created a Vision Statement and a Values Statement.

+++

As showcased before here, I'm continuing my "field research." This means my personal "tours" of complementary Maker Spaces, Bio Labs, design firms and HC-Player events in NYC. Nothing like learning directly from---and recruiting among---the folks who have already created successful "making/lab'ing" environments. Or, have coalesced a community we'd like to know. 

In approximately the last 30 days, I've engaged with 19 different events that promised to address our HML success needs.

On Wednesday, 28 October---as part of our "slide deck"---I'll review these engagements. And, what the players---with whom I interacted---at these events might add to our HML-creation plans and implementations. 

(Another reason to join-in our next Meetup!)


Best!


LAND, Organizer    
HCx3DP Meetup NY


PS. At our 28 October event, we'll also be welcoming back our expanding HML "informal advisory team" to help us plan and advance our innovative initiative.


So, come join-in with topic leaders in health tech, HCx3DP, DigiFab, DIY bio, neuro-tech, STEAM education, HC 'preneurship, supporting professions and more---RSVP and support our Meetup via payment here and come participate:


David Solomonoff, President, New York Chapter, Internet Society (Invited.); 

Jon Luongo, MS, CCLS, Child Life Specialist, Maimonides Infants & Children's Hospital (Joining-in.);

Matt Lipschutz, Meetup Co-Organizer, Hack Manhattan (Joining-in.);

Victor Ty, Pediatric Radiation Oncology RN at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center; Health Maker in LEGO Medical & LEGO 3D Medical Designs (Invited.);   

Oliver Medvedik, PhD., Co-Founder; Director, Scientific Programs, Genspace (Invited.);

Jonathan Askin, Technology Law Professor, Founder/Director, Brooklyn Law Incubator & Policy (BLIP) Clinic, Brooklyn Law School. Innovation Catalyst for the Brooklyn Law Center (CUBE) for Urban Business Entrepreneurship (Invited.);

Andrew O'Shaughnessy, Project Manager, Health Tech, Center for Economic Transformation, New York City Economic Development Corporation (Invited.);

Aaron Roy, Head of Operations & Strategy, 3DPrinterOS, innovators in 3DP education & enterprise via the most powerful, open source, 3D Printing management platform in the world (Unavailable.);

Conor Russomanno, Co-F & CEO of OpenBCI & Organizer of the new NeuroTechNYC Meetup (Joining-in.);

Matt Patrick, Community Director, CityScience: committed to raising the quality of science education and supporting environmental stewardship using the natural and built environments as laboratories for active learning (Joining-in.);

results.description: We've had some laughs and so much head shaking during the first two Republican debates. After watching how adults handle a debate when the Democrats took their turn, now we get a chance to see if the Republicans took any cues from that one. Based on the Benghazi hearings, we can safely say no. It's very rare that the third of movies are as good as the first two. Is that true of Republican debates? So please join us once again at Pacific Standard to see if the GOP can either become more adult like or turn up the crazy. Something tells me it will be the latter. We look forward to seeing you there!

results.description:
Many operations teams feel the need to gain Docker experience, but are struggling to conceptualize how this can be done in a low risk way. Further, they must do this in an often hectic work environment that is not conducive to learning a completely new operational paradigm.

The talk first covers the identification of a low risk, high value "sandbox" where an application can be deployed to production in Docker containers. Key points will be around identifying metrics for measuring success and learning. This will be about 15 minutes.

We will then move on to what a _minimum_ viable production environment might look like. This will include log aggregation, monitoring, a private registry, service discovery and scheduling. In the end, a small python/redis app will run in production. Time permitting a Docker Dev Environment will be demonstrated.

Slides for the talk are hosted here:

http://www.slideshare.net/BoydHemphill/keep-calms-and-docker-on-innotech

Speaker Bio:

Boyd Hemphill


Boyd Hemphill is a DevOps raconteur and thought leader in the silicon hills of Austin Texas. Boyd founded Austin DevOps when he learned the thing he was doing had a name. Boyd organizes the Docker Austin meet up and the first ever Container Days is Austin Texas. In his professional life, Boyd has been a developer (PL/SQL, PHP), DBA (Oracle and MySQL), and system administrator. He sees Docker as containers for mere mortals in the same way Slicehost was virtualization for mere mortals in 2009.

Fee Note:

We charge the $1 RSVP fee to help make sure that folks will actually attend when they RSVP. We do this so we can plan accordingly with the space. We refund you the fee in cash when you arrive at the event. If you do not attend, we do not refund the fee. Thanks!
results.name: Come learn! Running Docker in production with StackEngine's Boyd Hemphill

Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Spiritual Laws That Govern Humanity and the Universe by Lonnie C. Edwards, M.D.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 4: Creating Peace and Unconditional Love.

You can download the e-book FREE here!

About the Book

God has created laws by which the universe is governed. Humanity has continued to set these laws into creative motion through thoughts, prayers, motives, intentions, voices, and beliefs. These are the right tools. In this book the student will learn how to use them always for the good.

Human beings are responsible for creating the good, the beautiful, and the true- all of which we desire to experience. But humans are also responsible for creating that which we do not desire to experience. However, being co-creators with God, the quality of our thoughts, beliefs, and intentions will determine and manifest our world. There is work to do, and those who are on the path with knowledge of God’s attributes and God’s laws, and with love and good will in their hearts, will do that work. This is your guide to put these concepts into practice in our troubled world today!

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry: Creating Peace &  Unconditional Love

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! This Wednesday, October 28th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment - also a great opportunity to practice your Spanish!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The November session of Cuban Salsa begins on Wednesday, 10/28!

Wednesdays (October 28th - November 18th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 1
This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner safety in an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 classes: ONLY $60 - That's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.


*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video links of our group doing Rueda de Casino:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class on Wednesdays at 8:30pm, immediately following the beginner class.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (October 28th - November 18th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (starting October 27th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:


Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

results.description:
Our own Jocko Selberg will be giving an introductory talk on Cynefin and Complex Adaptive Systems, followed either by a lean coffee or a group exercise.


Presenter: Jocko Selberg is a Project Manager for The Nielsen Company with over 15 years experience in the interactive industry. He is a non-sectarian agilist and does not own a TV.

Description: 

How many times have you been on a project with an overly-detailed Project Plan that you know will be thrown out once you actually start the work? We take comfort in deterministic plans, but often our path forward is non-deterministic; full of "unknowable unknowns". We need a different set of tools to move forward in a world of less certainty.

Cynefin is a framework developed by Dave Snowden and Cognitive Edge which seeks to helps us "make sense of the world, such that we can act in it". By understanding the fundamental differences between directed (ordered) systems and emergent (un-ordered) systems, we can modify our approach to match the context of the problem we are facing. The Cynefin framework takes a science-based approach to dealing with critical business issues,  drawing from anthropology, neuroscience and complex adaptive systems theory to improve decision making.

Cynefin and Complexity Theory have an undeserved reputation for being difficult to grasp. In this introductory talk we will break down these approaches so that we can effectively use them to help us to better act under conditions of uncertainty.


Location: Spotify is on 45 W. 18th Street. That's between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. They're up on the 7th floor.
results.how_to_find_us: Between 6th and 5th avenues, above the Bed Bath and Beyond. Spotify is up on the 7th floor.
results.name: Cynefin & Complexity: A Gentle Introduction

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Adreanna Limbach

Adreanna's first encounter with Buddhism was in a high school philosophy class where the discourses on The Heart Sutra rocked her worldview in an uncomfortable and exhilarating way.

Following a subsequent decade of flirtation with meditation, she found her home at The Interdependence Project in NYC, where she completed their year-long teacher training immersion, and continues to study, practice and teach alongside those who inspire her path. 

She’s taught meditation as a practical tool for clarity and resilience to corporate offices, middle school students, and served as a lead coordinator of the Meditation Working Group at Occupy Wall Street, bringing daily practice to the volunteers at Zuccotti Park in 2011. 

When she's not on the cushion, she serves as an Executive Coach at The Institute for Compassionate Leadership, a Student Coach at The Institute for Integrative Nutrition, and catalyzes women to rally their resources so that they can find more freedom in business + life in her private practice. Come say Hello to her at www.AdreannaLimbach.com.

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!

results.description:
“2010 will go down as one of the great all-time vintages in Tuscany.”  (Antonio Galloni)

“Excitement for the 2010 harvest has been building for some time, and as a single group the wines are indeed exceptional.”  (Wine Advocate)

“2010 Is THE Vintage from Tuscany!”  (Zachy’s, Scarsdale)

The wine world is full of hype—every year seems to be declared the “vintage of the century!” somewhere—but the critics seem to be gushing more than usual over the 2010 vintage in Tuscany.  It’s a vintage that didn’t seem promising at first (cool and wet spring resulting in late, irregular flowering), but a warm, dry September seemed to make all the difference.  The wines from the vintage have earned unprecedented high scores—of 543 Tuscan red wines reviewed in the Wine Advocate, more than 60 percent were given scores of 90 or higher. 

So let’s see what the excitement is all about.  I recently attended a tasting of 2010 Brunello di Montalcino, considered the world’s best expression of the Sangiovese grape, and selected three to include in a wine dinner.  I chose three that had distinctly different styles, came from three different areas within the Montalcino region, and represented three different price categories.  We’ll compare them to Sangiovese wines from the same vintage but from different areas of Tuscany: Chianti Classico, Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, and the catch-all category IGT Toscana.

THE APPELLATIONS

Brunello di Montalcino:  One of Italy’s great red wines, it has only existed as an appellation since the 1880s, and was limited to a single producer (Biondi-Santi) until after World War II.  Now there are almost 200 producers of Brunello, who must adhere to some strict regulations to qualify for the DOCG.  Wines must be made entirely from the Sangiovese Grosso grape in a district surrounding the hilltop village of Montalcino.  This is one of the warmest, driest microclimates in Tuscany, which ensures consistent ripening.  Vineyards must be planted on hillsides with favorable exposures (preferably south or southwest) at an altitude not exceeding 600 meters, and wines must be aged four years prior to release, at least two of these years in barrel. 

An article on jancisrobinson.com makes this observation about the 2010 Brunello vintage:  “This vintage has resulted in roughly two styles: a fragrant, elegant, Burgundian style; and solid, concentrated wines that are firmly tannic yet seldom rough or alcoholic.”  Of the three Brunellos we’re trying, I think the Pieve Santa Restituta, made by the superstar winemaker Gaja, fits the first category—incredibly elegant and complex.  The San Filippo falls into the second category—more robust and tannic, with interesting spice notes.  I’d add a third category, into which the third Brunello, the Val di Suga, falls—a friendly, accessible style, easy to drink, ready now.

Chianti Classico:  Chianti has come a long way from those clichéd straw-wrapped flask bottles.  The original DOC regulations from 1967 preserved archaic practices (such as requiring the inclusion of some white grapes in the blend) and set no limits on yield or production, which resulted in huge quantities of indifferent Chianti wine.  But the rules are more stringent now—the blend must be at least 80 percent Sangiovese (with no white grapes used), there are limits on production and vine density, and vineyards must be on favorable hillside sites within a historic zone to qualify as “Classico.”  Chianti Classico requires 12 months of aging before release, 24 months for Riserva wines. 

We’ll be trying the Chianti Classico made by Fontodi, one of the stars of the appellation, famous for their Vigna del Sorbo Riserva wine as well as their “Supertuscan” Flaccianello.  But even their entry-level Classico is a highly respected wine. 

Vino Nobile di Montepulciano:  East of Montalcino and southeast of the Chianti region is Montepulciano, one of the most historic wine regions of Tuscany—its wines were favored by 15th and 16th century aristocracy.  DOCG rules require that it be made from at least 70 percent Sangiovese (although in practice most winemakers use 100 percent Sangiovese), followed by two years of aging, one year in oak (usually large oak casks that minimally influence the flavor of the wine).  Advocates of Vino Nobile claim that the wine combines the best qualities of Chianti Classico Riserva (perfumed aromatics) and Brunello (rich texture and tannins), but it has never quite regained the prestige it enjoyed in previous centuries.  Our Vino Nobile was made by Canneto, a reliable producer on a historic property.

IGT Toscana:  IGT stands for Indicazione Geografica Tipica, and is the equivalent of France’s Vin de Pays category.  IGT Toscana wines can be made in any area of Tuscany and are free of the restrictive regulations of the DOCs and DOCGs.  Far from being an indicator of lesser quality, some of Italy’s most prestigious wines, the so-called “Supertuscans,” are labeled IGT because they are made from unconventional grape blends that do not conform to DOC rules, or are made from grapes grown in unauthorized areas.  We’ll be trying the Viticcio Prunaio, an IGT Toscana made from 100 percent Brunello clone Sangiovese.

To get us started, we’ll begin with a Tuscan white, a Vermentino made by Antinori.  As usual, we’ll be tasting the reds blind—let’s see if we can pick out the Brunellos!

We’ll be heading up to the Upper East Side this time, to the Italian restaurant 83½, which allows BYOB on Wednesdays.

http://www.eighty-threeandahalf.com/

2014 Antinori Guado al Tasso Vermentino  $21

Jancis Robinson 16/20 – Impressive fruit weight with a slightly reductive whiff. Excellent balance and more serious than many Vermentinos. 

2010 Fontodi Chianti Classico  $33

Wine Advocate 92 – The 2010 Chianti Classico is a stunning wine that epitomizes the Conca d’Oro amphitheater of vines that distinguishes Panzano in Chianti. The wine shows seamless integration with bright fruit pitted against warmer tones of leather and tobacco. It’s like a perfectly balanced scale with rich intensity on one side and elegant fruit on the other. Anticipated maturity: 2014-2025.

2010 Canneto Vino Nobile di Montepulciano  $24

Wine Spectator 91 – Presents an intriguing hint of smoke and sandalwood in the aroma, with flavors of black cherry, blackberry, spice, and burning vine cuttings, matched to a fine-grained structure. Fine length. Drink now through 2020.

2010 Viticcio Prunaio Toscana IGT  $36

Wine Advocate 92 – The darkly concentrated 2010 Prunaio flexes its considerable muscle, imparting bold tones of black cherry, blackberry preserves, baking spice, espresso bean, pencil shavings, licorice, and dark cola. The enormity [sic] of the bouquet is uplifted by bright rose and balsamic background tones. Warm, textured, and tightly woven tannins mark the finish and give the wine enormous momentum. Anticipated maturity: 2015-2025.

2010 Val di Suga Brunello di Montalcino  $30

Wine Advocate 93 – Val di Suga's 2010 Brunello di Montalcino is a full-bodied expression with opulent tones of dark fruit, spice, leather, tobacco, and licorice. Much of the intensity comes from oak use with pretty layers of cinnamon and nutmeg that add to the overall concentration and density of the wine. Smooth and velvety in the mouth, the wine lasts long and delivers generous fruit flavors that add weight and importance to the finish. The wine adopts a plush and modern style, but it does so impeccably. This may be the best base Brunello ever made by Val di Suga.

2010 San Filippo Brunello di Montalcino  $50 

Wine Advocate 93 – The 2010 Brunello di Montalcino is a dense and voluptuous expression with opulent fruit tones and equally intense oak nuances. The wine ages in botte grande for 26 months and the slow oxidation has done much to increase the aromatic intensity of the wine. Bold and chewy with thick lines, this wine also shows tight wood astringency that should soften, to a good extent, with time. There are sweet tones of baking spice and sweet cherry syrup on the close. The style is appropriate for lovers of big Brunello.

2010 Gaja Pieve Santa Restituta Brunello di Montalcino  $60  (sale price; reg. $100)

James Suckling 97 – Fabulous aromas of plums, prunes, Christmas pudding, and berries. Full body, ultra-fine tannins and a long and intense finish. Polished and refined. Give this wine two or three years to soften.

results.description:
Structure Editing Combinators
by Jason Priestley

Jason Priestley will talk about Structure Editing Combinators. A Structure Editor is an editor that operates directly on the abstract tree structure of a program, instead of textual code. Structure Editing Combinators are Parsec-style combinators, which resemble a high-level specification of the grammar of a language; instead of producing a parser for that langauge, they produce a Structure Editor, with pretty-printing, mouse-based selection, and autocompleting text input.

Jason Priestley has been programming since 2007, writing web UIs for companies like Fitbit and Birst. He has been writing Haskell since 2009, and is the author of the new Sneath Lane web UI library, as well as the defunct Haskell on a Horse web framework.

Lightning Talks 
by Everyone (including You?)

The lightning talks went so well last time we did them that we decided to do another round.  We would like to open the floor for a round of short 5-10 minute talks on whatever strikes your fancy -- projects you have been working on, obstacles you have encountered, neat tools you have discovered.  These talks will not be recorded (unless you want us to), so it's a nice low pressure way to start contributing to the community.  If you would like to present slides, please have them either online or in a standard format (pdf, html) on a usb.  There will be a signup sheet onsite, but people are encouraged to contact the event organizers via meetup to reserve a slot beforehand (click the "contact" link at http://www.meetup.com/NY-Haskell/).  All vaguely Haskell topics and all levels of expertise welcome.  If you don't have much speaking experience, this is a great way to just dip your toe in the water.
results.name: Structure Editing Combinators *and* More Lightning Talks

results.description:
Rebel Mechanics: All Is Fair in Love and Revolution by Shanna Swendson

It's 1888, and seventeen-year-old Verity Newton lands a job in New York as a governess to a wealthy leading family--but she quickly learns that the family has big secrets. Magisters have always ruled the colonies, but now an underground society of mechanics and engineers are developing non-magical sources of power via steam engines that they hope will help them gain freedom from British rule. The family Verity works for is magister--but it seems like the children's young guardian uncle is sympathetic to the rebel cause. As Verity falls for a charming rebel inventor and agrees to become a spy, she also becomes more and more enmeshed in the magister family's life. She soon realizes she's uniquely positioned to advance the cause--but to do so, she'll have to reveal her own dangerous secret.
results.name: Let's Read Rebel Mechanics by Shanna Swendson!

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, October 28th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The November  session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (October 28 - November 18):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (October 28 - November 18):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (October 27) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

results.description:
Over the 20th and 21st centuries, the rise of our civilization has seemed unstoppable.  but could our modern, industrialized civilization fall apart like great ancient ones before us? Two hundred years from now, will scientists find evidence that we followed a recipe for disaster similar to that of the Maya or the Romans?  To understand a collapse, imagine it has already happened. National Geographic reveals a vivid look into the future to our descendants in the year 2210 as they set out on a scientific expedition to figure out what brought us down.  A water crisis? Lack of energy sources? Dust storms? Global warming?

Diamond’s talk – an eye-opening conjecture about our societal future based on our current downward spiral – is based on his book of the same name, a follow-up to his prize-winning Guns, Germs, and Steel, which chronicled the rise of human civilizations since the Ice Age. Here Diamond turns his attention to how some once-productive societies such as the Easter Islanders and Greenland Norse died, and applies the lessons learned to our own time and place. Fascinating stuff.

Great Lectures on DVD is FREE.

(But put something on the bar besides your elbow.)
results.name: GREAT LECTURES ON DVD: COLLAPSE, by Jared Diamond

I have several copies of the text and it is available online. There will also be food and drink provided by Handy.

We will be covering all sections from Chapter 5 with a focus on Breadth-First search and Depth-First search graph traversal algorithms.

Please read Chapter 5 prior to the meet up and be prepared to solve the problems from the end of the chapter.
results.name: Algorithm Club: Chapter 5 “Graph Traversal" (5.1-5.10)

Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10 for this session. 

Payment must be made in advance to receive "credits" in order to RSVP. For more information as to how to do this, please contact us through Meetup.com

If you RSVP and have no credits left, you will not be on the list w/ the security guard, and therefore will not be let into the building.

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

All skill levels are encouraged to attend. Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).

results.description:
Moderated by:
Laura Brounstein (Cosmopolitan + Seventeen) In discussion with:
Rebecca Traister (New York Magazine)
Jazmine Hughes (NY Times)
Jessica Grose (Lenny)
Jia Tolentino (Jezebel). 

“Self-empowerment and feminism have become branded pop-cultural trends and clickable keywords" – the word on the street as written by music critic Lindsay Zoladz in a recent issue of New York Mag. Sure, her statement is in response to the recent rift-heard-round-the-web between pop-icons Taylor Swift and Nicki Minaj, but the sentiment also rings true beyond celebrity culture – some serious girl power messages are on the uprise in women's media outlets too. When cracking open an issue of a women’s mag or logging onto sites that lead with ladies’ issues, this current moment of female empowerment in the media is undeniable. How are these outlets shaping the conversation of feminism in the 21st century? Is feminism alive in an earnest way in women’s media, or is it a strategy to sell more issues and garner more clicks?

Lady Boss, an initiative for women in creative industries to kick more ass at work, invites you to join an exciting conversation with leading women's media outlets about our current moment of female empowerment in the media and how they are shaping the future state of feminism and feminist ideals.


It's free to attend, but just in case rsvp to get in: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/lady-boss-female-empowerment-in-the-media-tickets-18179732068?aff=es2
results.name: Lady Boss- Female Empowerment in the Media

results.description:
Join ArtsTech at FiftyThree's beautiful office space in Tribeca on October 28th for an evening consisting of creative demos and a mixer.

We are thrilled to have two creative communities coming together to learn from Emoji designer Julia Heffernan, STEM From Dance founder Yamilée Toussaint, and ProductionPro founder Alexander Libby, all featured in FiftyThree’s 53 Creative New Yorkers series highlighting New York’s finest in the creative industry. 

*Due to building security protocol, there will be NO WALK-INS allowed at this event. Please make sure to RSVP so that you’re added to the list!*

Schedule:

7:00pm – Doors

7:30-8:00pm – Lightning Demos followed by Q&A

8:00-9:00pm – Conversation continues over drinks & snacks

Presenters:

Yamilée Toussaint is the founder of STEM From Dance. She has personally experienced the extraordinary benefits of a STEM education and dance. After studying mechanical engineering at MIT and being an avid dancer for 21 years, she switched gears to teach high school algebra in an underserved community in East New York, Brooklyn through Teach For America. As a teacher, her eyes were opened to the multitude of opportunities her students didn't have access to. Therefore, she set out to provide students with something greater than what the school system could provide. She started STEM From Dance with the hope that a strong dance and STEM supplemental education would help to increase the number of underrepresented minority girls across the nation who pursue a STEM college education.

Julia Heffernan is a freelance illustrator/emoji designer. She started making emojis two years ago for the app GroupMe and has since made custom sets for Washington Post, Comedy Central, Entertainment Weekly, Bark Box and more. When not drawing emojis she does water color paintings and short comics. She lives in Brooklyn with her pet rabbit, Napoleon Bunnyparte, and eats a lot of nachos in her free time. 

Alexander Libby is the founder and CEO of ProductionPro. He developed the concept for ProductionPro while working closely with director Stephen Daldry during the production of Warner Bros.’ Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close in 2011. Since then, Alex has further utilized the prototype on various productions including live and theatrical events.

His other favorite credits include: Wicked, Billy Elliot The Musical, In The Heights, 13 The Musical, Legally Blonde, Is He Dead?, High Fidelity The Musical, La Cage Aux Folles, The Woman in White, and The 2012 London Olympic Ceremonies.

About FiftyThree:

FiftyThree builds tools that make ideas better. They are the makers of Paper, the fast and beautiful productivity app for every kind of idea, and Pencil, the award-winning Bluetooth stylus. Internationally recognized for design excellence and innovation, they’ve received awards from Apple, IDSA, Communication Arts, The Edison Awards, and IxDA. FiftyThree is based in New York and Seattle, and brings together the craft of software, hardware, and service design. Founded in 2011, FiftyThree products reach more than 15 Million creative thinkers worldwide. 

53 Creative New Yorkers: 

53 Creative New Yorkers is an interview series by FiftyThree that profiles the habits and methods of creative thinkers from art, science, business, and more.
results.name: ArtsTech & FiftyThree Creative Demos and Mixer

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons
