results.description:
To secure your spot, please make sure to register on Eventbrite! https://www.eventbrite.com/e/igda-nyc-game-audio-roundtable-tickets-19028064453


Join us on Wednesday, October 28th for the next IGDA NYC roundtable event! This month, we’ll discuss game audio, a hugely important part of games that is often overlooked.


We’ll discuss questions like...


-How can designers and developers best work with their musicians and sound designers?

-What are the best practices for game audio?

-What are some great tips and tricks for creating a great auditory experience?

-And anything else that comes to mind!


We’ll start with a brief introductory panel discussion moderated by sound designer and composer Stephen Harwood Jr. and featuring guests from the Interactive Audio Special Interest Group (IASIG), game audio professionals, and local game developers. Afterwards, we’ll open it up to the crowd and the bulk of the evening will be dedicated to a participatory roundtable discussion among peers. 


Developers of all disciplines are welcome! Capacity will be strictly limited, so make sure to reserve your seat on Eventbrite. Have a burning question, a brilliant solution, a sticky situation, or an issue you’ve been wrestling with? Come talk shop with other game devs, share knowledge, and gain insight.


We will also have pizza and soda courtesy of the Game Audio Institute ( http://www.gameaudioinstitute.com/ ), so arrive early to enjoy the refreshments!

And don’t miss out on this great offer:


SPECIAL DISCOUNT for the GAME AUDIO INTENSIVE WORKSHOP on Nov. 1st @ the Institute of Audio Research


USE THIS CODE:

gai-vipdiscount-2015

for an extra 10 percent off the already low early bird special on the site!


Plus, as an extra bonus, attendees of the roundtable will receive an additional discount code worth 20% off the Game Audio Intensive Workshop presented by the Institute of Audio Research on Sunday, November 1st, 12-7pm.


In this one day intensive hands on Workshop, Game Audio gurus Steve Horowitz and Scott Looney will prepare you to deal with this new world of game audio featuring the Unity3D Game engine. Supercharge your understanding of how sound works in games with the latest from FMOD studio, Wwise, Master Audio and more....


For more info and to register for the workshop, visit: http://gameaudioinstitute.com/workshop-at-institute-of-audio-research/
results.name: IGDA NYC Game Audio Roundtable

Due to the unavailability of tickets for the tour on the 23rd, I had to move the event to the 28th, the tickets are more expensive for that particular tour but if you already rsvpd and made a payment, I will assume the difference, but for those who rsvp now until wednesday, there will be a price difference of US $5.00.

 Let's start our yearly Halloween Celebrations by taking a candlelight tour of the Merchant's house museum. Eight family members died in the house; their funerals were held in the front parlor hung with black crepe. We invite you to venture into the dark and ghostly shadows of history by flickering candlelight to hear chilling tales of restless phantoms, voices calling into the night, and otherworldly occurrences form the people who actually experienced them.

This is a 50 minute tour that reveals the dark and haunted past of this old structure, as well as it's spooky present. Join us in celebrating this day as it should be, by taking a stroll through part of this city's history.

Tickets must be purchased for this event, if you rsvp please note that there is a charge for this meetup and that includes the ticket for the event and a service charge. RSVP and prepay responsibly, meaning only if you know you will make this event.

Here you may find more details about this event and others held in the month of October.

This place was recommended as a comfortable and relaxing place to have our meetup. 

I thought we would change up the format of our meetups to a less structured format of allowing for deep and meaningful conversations around specific conversation starters that are meant to challenge your current thinking and awareness.  Every time you truly connect with someone in conversation, your consciousness expands.  This simpler format will be easier to do with the many members of this meetup.

In the past, I tried to structure our meetups more like a mastermind group of meeting on a regular basis and setting goals with accountability.  This was difficult to accomplish at times with a mix of older and newer members each month.  Masterminds are usually a very small group of highly committed individuals, all working together to challenge and support. Next month, I will be sharing more information about our exclusive mastermind group (limited to 5 committed women) for those who want to use the power of accountability to make major changes in their life such as starting a new business, switching careers for one that honors your values, putting smart systems in place to allow for a richer life experience, scaling back to allow for more of what you really want to be doing, etc. 

Hope to see old and new faces on the 28th.

Much love,

Amarilis Reynoso

results.description:
This is not a self-improvement course - it's a series intended to help you develop your inherent nature by recognizing your kindness, connection, and wisdom. Everything you're looking for is already here, let us help you discover it.

This six-week course, 10/28-12/9, incorporates western psychological techniques with traditional contemplative practices to help you develop a healthy relationship to yourself and others. 

Though compassion is often regarded as a weak and cowardly response to difficult people and situations, traditional practices and modern psychological research suggest that compassion is the most effective and courageous quality for creating respectful and loving relationships.  With this unique offering, we’ll learn how to use discernment to create healthy boundaries, how to work with guilt and shame, and how to work with judgement and criticism with understanding and patience. 


You can drop in to any class for $20.  Brainiacs can register for the entire six week series at a discounted price of $80 by selecting the "Basic member" option at the below link. 


More details and registration:

http://theidproject.org/events/2015/10/28/compassionate-relationships

We are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building.  There is no elevator.  Cushions and chairs will be provided.
results.name: Developing Compassionate Relationships

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Wednesday Runs in Central Park!

On hump day, we own the pavement. Going forward, we'll meet on Wednesdays at 7:30PM at the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll start with a brief stretch and share, and then we'll embark on either the 3-mile or 6-mile loop.

This running group is for everyone in the innovation/startup community, but we don't discriminate. We're open to all runners and professions. Please RSVP when you know you'll be able to meet.

After our runs we'll relax at a nice nearby pub to discuss how we're going to fix the world's problems.

Clarification on the meeting spot: We'll meet at the northeast corner of Columbus Circle. This is the same as the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll meet right next to the big statue that is next to the entrance to the park trail. Just be precise, we'll meet at the immediate west of said big statue.

See you soon!

Alex

results.description:
We are so very honored and excited to have our beloved Ishtar, and the Ascended Masters back at The Light Within Us for an evening of high frequency wisdom teachings, activations and healing. 


LIVING CONSCIOUSLY

Each of us is a divine spiritual being on the Earth. This is our divine truth yet the challenge for most of us is how to live this as our truth every day in our busy world.

In’Easa mabu Ishtar is an embodied channel for the Ascended Masters of light and for more than 13 years she has worked with the Masters to assist humanity to remember who they are and to honor this divine truth in their lives.

In'Easa mabu Ishtar and the Ascended Masters offer you an evening of Divine Wisdom Teaching and tools that you can use in your life, so you can begin and continue to live your divine truth.

Time will also be provided at the end for questions and answers with guidance offered by the Masters. 

All are welcome to join in this very special evening that offers you the opportunity to find the support and guidance you need and to open your hearts to your DIVINE TRUTH! 

Bio:  In'Easa mabu Ishtar is an international spiritual teacher and counselor from Australia. An embodied Ascended Master Channel, she has worked with the Masters of Light for the past 13 years, regularly channeling high frequency wisdom teachings, activations and healing for groups and individuals. Ishtar's greatest gift is to guide all souls to ground and anchor their spiritual wisdom and light into their lives and to begin to live this as their divine truth on the Earth. An accredited teacher of the Divine University, she has authored two on-line teaching programs and a healing program in co-creation with the Ascended Masters- The Master's Way, Open to Channel and the Universal Rays Healing Program. Ishtar is also trained in a variety of spiritual and energetic healing modalities.

Please visit Ishtar's website for more information: Ascended Master Channel - Ishtar

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)

results.description:
Join us for a special Open Rehearsal at our regular location, the Music Conservatory of Westchester! NO section limits at this rehearsal only, so flutes, trumpets, clarinets are all welcome to come.

We will be coming off of Sunday's concert so everyone will be reading new music. No need to prepare, just show up with your instrument and get ready to play. We have around 40 people at most rehearsals (most members are not on the Meetup page) so don't worry, you will have a full orchestra to play with.

RSVP on Meetup to let us know you're coming, or email [masked]. If you want the music in advance, go to our website, www.newsymphony.org, to see the rehearsal schedule and to print the music from the Dropbox on our Members page. Otherwise, it's OK to just show up and share.

Parking: The Conservatory asks that orchestra musicians *not* park in the Conservatory parking lot unless you are a tuition paying student of either the Conservatory of the Steffi Nossen School of Dance. Street parking is free after 6pm, and there is a large municipal lot across Central Ave from City Limits (24hr meters in the lot).
results.how_to_find_us: Northern end of Central Ave, just south of City Limits Diner and across rt. 119 from the County Center
results.name: OPEN REHEARSAL!

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $10.25 Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

</a>

<a href="http://bookeo.com/climbrockclub?type=2126XUFJR1387C98D3A8">

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.


For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON NYC

results.description:
This online class is $19.95 to join. Register here.


This is a 5-part online channeling series in which participants may attend via computer, tablet, or smartphone, or may dial-in via phone.

Award-winning author, channel & psychic Paul Selig, will lead a live, interactive video webinar where he will explain his work, deliver a channeled lecture and allow participants to ask questions directly to his Guides. Paul’s Guides have been delivering new, groundbreaking teachings on Mastery. Paul’s 4th channeled text, The Book of Mastery will be released in January 2016 from Tarcher/Penguin, so this is a unique opportunity to experience this new work in advance of the book’s release. Paul and his Guides will lead you on a journey of self-development, at once building awareness of your own life purpose and building your ability to improve life for others.

A video recording of each session will be made available to all registered attendees at no additional charge so that if you miss the session or simply want to review it again, you can do so at your leisure.

Register here for this livestream, or sign up for multiple sessions at a discount. The series will take place on five consecutive Wednesday evenings at 8 pm Eastern Time: October 7, 14, 21, 28 and November 4. Participation in a prior session or series is not a prerequisite. For questions, please email [masked] or call 212.941.9390.

For those who haven’t registered for previous sessions, you are welcome to download those videos from Paul’s website at the AV page.

ABOUT PAUL SELIG

Paul Selig had a spiritual experience in 1987 that left him clairvoyant. He studied a form of energy healing, working at Marianne Williamson’s Manhattan Center for Living and in private practice. Paul began to “hear” for his clients, and much of his work now is as a clairaudient, clairvoyant, channel, and empath. He has led channeled energy groups for many years and, in 2009, he was invited to channel at the Esalen Institute’s Superpowers symposium, where he was filmed for the documentary Authors of the Impossible. He was also featured on the documentary series The uneXplained on the A&E/BIO channel. His books include I Am the Word, The Book of Love and Creation, and The Book of Knowing and Worth. His fourth book, The Book of Mastery, will be published in January 2016 by Tarcher/Penguin.

REGISTER HERE
results.name: Channeled Livestream with Paul Selig: "Being the Infinite Self"

group.name: Channeled Workshops with Medium Paul Selig

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session:
Sept 30, 2015- Nov 4, 2015
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125407<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=625347764"></a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
Prepare for an hour of insane fun, team building, and laughter - as you are about to be trapped in a room with a zombie! (Please arrive 10-15min early. You will spend 60 min in room, with a 10 minute wrap up afterward. So budget 80-90 minutes!)

You and 11 other adventurers will enter a room and are challenged to find the clues, solve the riddles, and get the key to escape.... or get eaten. As the clock dwindles down from 60 to 0, every 5 minutes the hungry zombie's chain gets longer and the danger zone increases. Communication and teamwork are musts if you want to make it out alive.


Location: It's in Manhattan, the exact address is on Tickets

Tickets are sold here: https://goo.gl/PgR58a

The event concludes with a comedically insightful analysis of the group's dynamics and of individuals' contributions.

We ask that you please order tickets for a show time at least 8 HOURS PRIOR to that show time.

*Please note that the available dates listed are tentative. If the date you've selected is available, you will be signed up and your spot will be reserved (two confirmations will be emailed to you - one from Verlocal and another from our website). If it isn't, you will be contacted to choose another date!
results.name: Trapped In a Room with a ZOMBIE - Room Escape Adventures!

results.description:
It's another seminar, ON US! Join us for a special class on Studio & Lighting! 

This the perfect first step to becoming acquainted with Studio Photography. This workshop will be a full hands-on photo shooting using professional studio equipment. Students will be introduced to the use Studio Strobes, Accessories such as softbox, barn doors, snoots and umbrellas, Flash-meter AND basic portrait lighting techniques using up to 3 strobes. Requirements: Good understanding of aperture and shutter speed is recommended but not required. Digital SLR or Point & shoot camera with flash mount and manual controls for aperture & shutterspeed. You are welcome to bring your flash-meter if you own one! Limited seats: 6 Students.


NOTE: There is a number of limited seats available for this seminar. Please only RSVP if you are certain you can make the event. Please cancel as soon as know you cannot make it to free up your place. Thank you!
results.name: Seminar Studio & Lighting Workshop - FREE!

results.description:
We partnered up with the Biometric Match team to announce the roll out of a new Kickstarter campaign to help speed up development of this groundbreaking social experience. See more from the founder below and at http://kck.st/1Gfwl8P

We’ve taken Biometric feedback out of the lab and put it in the hands of anyone with a computer and a webcam. Why ... to help people find more fulfilling relationships and friendships through science. Introducing Biometric Match.

Biometric Match is the world's first Biometric social network. It uses an emotion-based facial cue system (powered by Affectiva) which maps users emotions, physical reactions and perceptions to specific visual stimuli. This stimuli, in the form of short video clips, helps us create a true portrait of self - far more accurate than a list of random questions. Now you can find out what a person feels and get to know their true personality before you ever meet up. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me directly.

Sincerely,

Dal Ellington

Founder / Biometric

[masked]

[masked]

http://www.biometricmatch.com
results.name: Last Day to be a part of the Biometric Match Team!

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

results.description:
We partnered up with the Biometric Match team to announce the roll out of a new Kickstarter campaign to help speed up development of this groundbreaking social experience. See more from the founder below and at http://kck.st/1Gfwl8P

We’ve taken Biometric feedback out of the lab and put it in the hands of anyone with a computer and a webcam. Why ... to help people find more fulfilling relationships and friendships through science. Introducing Biometric Match.

Biometric Match is the world's first Biometric social network. It uses an emotion-based facial cue system (powered by Affectiva) which maps users emotions, physical reactions and perceptions to specific visual stimuli. This stimuli, in the form of short video clips, helps us create a true portrait of self - far more accurate than a list of random questions. Now you can find out what a person feels and get to know their true personality before you ever meet up. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me directly.

Sincerely,

Dal Ellington

Founder / Biometric

results.description:
LEADER: Fred Hodde ([masked] or[masked] (C) or[masked] (H))

RATING: B 5.5 B

Meet at the Lake Skannatati Parking Area at 9:30 AM. The planned route will use the Long Path, Lichen, RD and Dunning (back) to Long Path Trails. Registration by e-mail preferred. Call cell before 9:00 AM if the weather is questionable. TC Northern Harriman map 119.


*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.

results.description:
Field Trip - Brooklyn Botanic Garden & Isamu Noguchi Sculpture Exhibit

Join NY Photo Safari and PWCC member Paul Grebanier who will be leading a  field trip at the Brooklyn Botanic GardenThursday, October 29th at 1:00 PM. 

In collaboration with The Noguchi Museum, Brooklyn Botanic Garden is pleased to present a Garden-wide installation of sculptures by the renowned Japanese-American artist Isamu Noguchi. Curated by the Museum's senior curator, Dakin Hart, the show features 18 works from the Museum's permanent collection that have been specifically chosen for various settings at BBG. The centerpiece of the installation is a selection of eight works in the Japanese Hill-and-Pond Garden that interact subtly with the setting’s rolling hills, rocks, pond, and plantings.  RSVP at right.


For more info see: http://www.bbg.org/discover/gallery/isamu_noguchi_at_brooklyn_botanic_garden

The foliage should peak in the last week of October and first week of November according to the website,  Sara's Guide to NY Fall Foliage: http://www.nyfallfoliage.com/ 


We'll meet at the Washington Avenue entrance (near parking lot).   Take the 2 or 3 train to Eastern Parkway—Brooklyn Museum station and walk to the entrance at 990 Washington Avenue.  For those who wish to travel as a group, meet Ed Lee at the front of 14th Street (7th Avenue) IRT platform, #2 and 3 train station at 12:15 PM.  By car, you can use  the parking lot near the Washington Avenue entrance. 

Admission is $6 for seniors and $12 for others; students with ID's $6

The cost of this event is admission to the gardens.

We'll grab a bit to eat after the trip.

                     .

I'm so excited to be introducing our second free webinar for Bibliocrunch members. You must register at the link below to attend. You can attend from your computer at home in  your pajamas :). 

I’ve helped numerous authors get reviews, so I thought I’d package all the information into one webinar. I’ll be teaching you tips and techniques on getting reviews and getting press for your book. 

Overview of the course: How to get reviews and press for your book

REGISTER FOR THE WEBINAR

Launching your marketing plan should always include reaching out to potential reviewers and press for your book. 

This webinar will focus on: 

1) Where to find book reviewers 
2) How to reach out to book reviewers 
3) How to identify press for your book 
4) How to pitch a story to press 
5) How to get featured by bloggers and media 
6) We’ll cover specific case studies as example

The webinar is free for all Bibliocrunch members.

Players of all skill levels are welcome. Westchester FC is about playing the beautiful game in a fun environment where everyone can get a good workout and improve their skills. It doesn't matter if you are the Messi of White Plains or you have never kicked a ball before, all you need are shoes.

While we will spend most of the time playing pick-up games, we will start with some warm-up to get the blood flowing. SPREAD THE WORD and get your friends to sign up!

I can't stress enough that fun is the top priority, because of this, no rough play (slide tackling is prohibited) or rude language. Violators will be warned, sent off, suspended or banned from Westchester FC games. We want everyone to feel comfortable so that we can really grow this club.
results.how_to_find_us: Don't worry if you are going to be late, we play until it is too dark.
results.name: Friendly Soccer in White Plains

results.description: Hey everyone! We are over 200 members! Join me and other fellow group members as we meet up for Happy Hour at Chef Yu! They have an extensive drink menu and you can get Chinese food if you're hungry. I really hope a lot of you can make it! I always enjoy meeting the members!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the host for the "party of 10: meetup". I'll be wearing a bright green sweater and glasses.
results.name: Networking Event #4

results.description:
Serge Kreiker, Co-Founder, TradeIt and Antonio Reyes, Head of Development, will speak to Byte Students and a limited number of community members. TradeIt is a patent pending technology that enables consumers to trade securities with their existing brokerage accounts on any app, ad unit or social media platform. TradeIt is live with 15 apps & sites in the US with a trial in HongKong.  TradeIt has created an SDK and suite of APIs that developers can work with to tailor the design and integrate with TouchID for one touch trading.  TradeIt will be introducing an in app mobile account opening, share transfer and aggregation service in October 2015.  Built by a team of seasoned FinTech experts with backgrounds building Yahoo! Finance, DowJones and Bloomberg, TradeIt is backed by Citi Ventures and Peter Thiel's Valar Fund.

Mr. Kreiker also co-founded FinTech company Kapitall and was previously a software engineer at Bloomberg.  Based in NYC, the Trade It team also includes serial FinTech veterans with backgrounds at Yahoo! Finance and Dow Jones.
results.how_to_find_us: Entrance on 41st btw Park & Mad
results.name: FinTech Guest Speaker: Trade It -  Serge Kreiker & Antonio Reyes

results.description: Mayor de Blasio is holding his first fundraiser for his re-election campaign. venue.name: Ramapo Mountain State Forest Lower Parking Lot

results.description:
The park is finally open again and we can  enjoy the Thursday evening hikes.

 We will be hiking in the dark  for half of the hike so bring your headlamp and will be moving at a steady pace. 

We're not calling this a Sunset Hike technically because the sun setting early makes it very challenging to get in a good hike and still make it to a look out.


[masked], [masked] are the exact GPS Coordinates for the trail head.  The lower lot is technically right across the street from 64 Skyline Drive address.

5 - 7 ish miles, with about a 900 ft elevation gain

We will meet at the LOWER lot of skyline drive in Oakland at 530pm on Thursday evening. This will be approximately a 2 - 3 hour hike.

We will take the blue trail to Ramapo Lake and left on Lake Shore Drive Carriage Road around the lake to a brief meetup with the Cannonball trail but headed to orange.  Once on orange we will cross over the pipeline and head to overlook view points and then follow the orange on a beautiful loop back to the pipeline.  We'll then head up the pipeline to the top and make a right on the white trail that leads us to some nice views of a perhaps fading sunset and NYC skyline.


We will walk through the Van Slyke Castle. http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/">http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/</a>;  and descend down most likely we'll take the white back to lake shore road with a probable detour through an unmarked shortcut.  Once on lake shore we can run, jog or walk back to the dam where we'll get some pics and hang out a bit before descending blue back to the parking lot.


This route may change from week to week depending on group so please have a map or gps.

http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf"></a>" class="linkified">http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf;

Bring headlamps, maps and water. Have fun!

FYI...Very good information about ticks available from the website link below. Helps to take away some of the mystery and scare tactics.

http://www.tickencounter.org

--------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers. 

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.
results.name: Skyline Drive Evening Hike - Moderate Pace (NJ)

results.description:
Suddenly you wake up in the midnight, you find yourselves trapped in space warps. The space seems to be inter-crossed by two different rooms in different times. There must be a reason you were sent here. If you are able to find out the secret in the rooms, you might be able to escape from the space.

Room X holds between 4-10 people; Suggested 6-8 players

Game duration is 70 mins

Please arrive at least 15 minutes before game starts. Participants arriving after the starting time will not be admitted since this would spoil the fun for others. 

Location is disclosed on Tickets once you purchase 
Click here to book your tickets: https://goo.gl/5WiyfB

results.description: Our next cigar event is for Oct 29 & we will be back at SoHo Cigar Bar. Many of our members are aware of my recent medical issues & this venue is ideal for me to get too. So bear with me. If you need the facts about this venue, just check our last cigar event. One of the great reasons why this group has done very well is the true loyalty of the members themselves. They like what they see & whether it's a stormy night or an ice chill evening they manage to attend the events. They know what they are getting & have a great night out. So I am greatful for all of you that made my dream group a reality. Without you there's no me. But so many of our members we haven't seen for awhile. Whether it's a busy work schedule, family issues or just plain laziness we like to see your faces again. So for this event we sure like to see those members return . So let's give a shoutout for all those members. So if you know any of these members, why not send them an email & tell them we miss you & try to come to our next event. Of course we like to see our first time members attend who are our backbone of the group. You took the time to signup so why not make the time to attend the an event. Who's knows, you may like it. As always we encourage you to bring your friends & guests. Hope to see you at this one!

Zumba involves dance and aerobic elements. Zumba's choreography incorporates hip-hop, soca, samba, salsa, merengue, mambo, martial arts, and some Bollywood and belly dance moves. Squats and lunges are also included. Approximately 14 million people take weekly Zumba classes in over 141,000 locations across more than 151 countries.

XQ: The Super School Project is a National Movement To Re-Imagine High School.  

In the last hundred years our public high schools have stayed frozen in time.

This Is A Problem...
This is Our Challenge...

https://youtu.be/JGBkqkorwxw

We believe American ingenuity can and must move education forward.  This is a challenge, open to all, to build the Super Schools that will lead the way!  

To Share Your Idea Online:  https://my.xqsuperschool.org/users/sign_up

NOTE: Our meetup is an independent initiative to assist potential participants register for the XQ Super School Challenge.

results.description:
Join DM Kyle Wagenblast as he recreates the classic D&D 2E module "Adam's Wrath" by Lisa Smedman. This is an adventure in the Ravenloft setting, updated to D&D 5E, and is for characters of 5th level.

In the domain of Lamordia, Doctor Victor Mordenheim created Adam, cobbling the creature together from parts of human corpses. Now, years later, Adam wants revenge. Adam wants Elise, Victor's wife. Adam wants Victor dead.

The players' ship founders on the coast of the domain of Lamordia. A vicious storm leaves them washed ashore, cold and hungry on the ice-bound Isle of Agony... then, the terror begins.
results.name: D&D 5E: Ravenloft - Adam's Wrath

Mastermind Discussion Topic:


Let's Get Social! (Social Media Marketing That Is)

What's faster than a speeding bullet? More powerful than a locomotive? Look -- up in the sky .. it's Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, HootSuite, Pinterest ... Don't you just wish it was Superman? While social media can be a great vehicle to market your business, the myriad of choices can cause it to be overwhelming and frustrating and at worst a waste of your time and energy. Join us for this month's targeted mastermind workshop where you'll have the opportunity to:

- Examine the various social media sites as it pertains to your target market
- Express and conquer your social media challenges and frustrations masterminding with experts and WPN sisters who've been there and conquered them
- Exhale as you find the right path and structure to invest your time and energy into the right social media avenues for you

Treat yourself and join us for a time of Brilliance, Brainstorming & Breakthroughs. Mastermind with Extraordinary Women with WPN's Signature Formula that Creates Amazing Results! Make Lasting & Meaningful Connections That Move Your Business and Your Life Forward!

Questions? Call Team WPN Global at[masked] or email [masked]

results.description:
GERMAN OCTOBERFEST CULTURAL EVENING!

Being the home of famous artists, musicians, philosophers, scientists and inventors, Germany is a country with rich culture history. Feel the history of the world’s oldest brewery in Bavaria. Try the authentic sauerbraten, beers of all types and flavors of good quality, potatoes and dumplings,native cakes and pastries. Watch the romantic and unforgettable Rhine in Flames celebration. Dance a waltz in Neuschwanstein castle with Beethoven’s music. Learn the most widely spoken first language in the European Union.

Come and join Eton Institute’s Free German Octoberfest Cultural Evening as we introduce you about the German culture and enjoy the music,food and beverages.

CLICK HERE to register! 

The schedule of the free event is as follows:

Date: October 29th, 2015 (Thursday)
Time: 6:00 – 8:00 pm
Venue: Eton Institute New York
results.name: Octoberfest Is Here!

group.name: Eton Institute NYC - Free Language Courses & Events

results.description:
This page has images of the openings we will be attending, so if you dont see them and you are........ 


1) viewing this page on the Meetup app click the description tab to view the list of galley openings.  

2) using an Android mobile browser open your browser's settings menu and click ''Request Desktop Site". 

3) using  Apple IOS then click the desktop site button at the bottom of the page. 

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

Just a little more business...


Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone.    


THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE   


That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required. 

And now the openings...

We are very excited to be launching our CrowdFunding campaign. We believe the power of the crowd is what will helps us achieve our goal of empowering all kids, including the most underserved, to improve their lives through learning. We believe everyone has an equal right to education.


Please join us in this virtual event to announce the official launch of our campaign. We will provide a quick update of where we are, discuss where we are going next and provide suggestions on how you can help us and spread awareness.

This virtual event will be hosted through Hangouts on Air, click here to start: https://plus.google.com/u/0/b/103727334690372328781/events/c62grrt8jbap0jlsogbpdlvt5rs


Our CrowdFunding page will be live just prior to the event, here is the link to it once it becomes available: http://igg.me/at/dev4x
results.name: CrowdFunding Campaign Launch Event

results.description:
Visitor's welcome!  Potential members welcome!


The emergent BNI chapter, High Performance, is having a Meetup.

This is a great opportunity to enter a newly forming chapter from the ground up, in the busiest city in the world—prime location; Downtown Brooklyn. Minutes from Manhattan. Accessible via the 2, 3, 4, 5, A, C, F, G, N & R trains.

Many professionals wait a long time time for openings in local chapters. Others often take what's available to them, having to travel great distances to reach their meetings. This may be your opportunity to secure your spot in a great locale.

Bring others: business owners, freelancers, commission based agents, any professional who benefits from giving and gaining quality referrals.


For more information contact Jason or Dean

"Local Business - Global Network ®
With over 180,000 members worldwide, BNI is the largest business networking organization in the world. Last year alone, BNI generated 6.6 million referrals resulting in $8.6 billion dollars' worth of business for its members. We offer members the opportunity to share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals."  Learn more...

results.description:
This is an exclusive, special invite only Masquerade Party at one of NYC's hottest lounges! Don’t worry about a costume as we will be providing masks for everyone!

Upon arrival, you will be treated to the VIP celebrity experience. Walk the red carpet and feel the flash of the paparazzi. 

Enjoy complimentary Hors d’oeuvres & a 2 for 1 drink special of the designer cocktail, the Crimson. Then be captivated by the sounds of our special guest DJ. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT HERE - http://bit.ly/1YDkFYR

What to expect:

• Complimentary Hors d'oeuvres (6-7pm)

•  2 For 1 Designer Drink Special (The Crimson) 

• Red Carpet/Step & Repeat 

• DJ & Dancing 

• Free Masquerade Masks

• 200+ members attending 

*First 5 Members save $5 on tickets ($20) using discount code "VIP" at checkout (*price will go up as event gets closer and if any tickets are left will be $95 at the door)

GET TICKETS AT THIS LINK - http://bit.ly/1YDkFYR

Pics from recent parties - 

Can I come alone? Yes, most come on their own. Come alone or bring friends, either way you'll have a great time.  

Why does your RSVP say +99 ? We are partnering up with many our Meetup groups so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion attending. 200+ will be in attendance.

Is this age or ethnic specific? No. General age range will be 25-55. It is not meant to be ethnic specific. 

What do I wear? Dress to impress. No sneakers, sweats, hats. Jeans ok. 

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. GET TICKETS HERE - http://bit.ly/1YDkFYR
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

venue.name: Pulse Karaoke Lounge and Suites

results.description:
Hello Stellar Singers,

Putting an end to your karaoke deprivation...(it's been too long, I know, I know).

Excited to announce a costumed get-together at our karaoke homestead - Pulse Karaoke Lounge.

Come as a caped-comic-book-crusader, notorious celebrity, or any out of the box character that strikes your fancy!

Happy hour 2-for-1 well drinks from 6-8 PM.

I encourage you all to try to arrive by, or a little before 6 PM to make the most of our time.

See you all there!

- Alpha

results.description:
As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising.

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups.

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.

Bitcoin Center NYC

25 Cleveland Place

New York, NY 10012

Find Bitcoin Center NYC on Facebook, LinkedIn, Meetup, and Twitter.

All guests of Bitcoin Center NYC are required to sign in.  Media must RSVP using [masked].

results.description:
Training to run a marathon, learning the guitar, surf lessons on vacation, re-learning chemistry to help with your teenager’s homework… at this event we rummage through the attic of our personal hobbies, projects, and past experiences to find hidden learning treasures we can bring back with us to our professional L&D world. 

Expect lots of small group conversation and peer-to-peer learning as we unpack old ideas, reappraise them, and share them back with the community to help us all make a better impact on the learners we serve. This is not a "sit 'n get" training. Socialization is built into the process so you’re guaranteed to meet new people and come away with personally relevant insights. 

Apologies for the change in theme as we pull together this first event in partnership with our ATD colleagues. We will revisit the topic of aligning learning with company strategy at a future event. 

Also please note there is a limit on attendance due to the size of the venue, so please RSVP soon if you want to join us.
results.name: L&D Roadshow: Discover your hidden learning treasures

results.description:
StoryForward NYC Presents:  An Evening of Gothic Storytelling

As the nights grow colder and darkness circles through the shadowy alleyways of Gotham, join us for a story-focused celebration of the arcane, the spooky, the spine-tingling, and the mysterious!

Doors will open at 6pm, with an hour of cocktails, tarot, magic, and more!  Beginning at 7:00, we will feature a selection of dramatic readings and original works, with some film and theatrical performances mixed in!


We will also have Open Mic sessions—bring us your dark and foreboding tale (250 words or less, please) to share!

Tickets will be $5, and as a courtesy to our hosts we are requesting a two-drink minimum.

What to bring:  Your costume!  Your original short work!  You!

What to expect:  Have fun, meet fellow story-tellers, and have a brush with the dark side.

What’s next:  Space is limited!  RSVP now!

Technical equipment provided for this evening's event provided by Adorama.

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

Level 4 Spanish class encourages students to use idiomatic Spanish when speaking and writing and to conduct discussions on complicated issues of current events.  Due to the fact that students in this level students are already familiar with the fundamental structures of Spanish grammar, needs and problems of students will determine the components of the grammar lessons for each class. The class will be conducted in a fun environment.  Each student will enjoy the support of his instructor and classmates, along with the opportunity to express themselves in Spanish with confidence.

La clase de Nivel 4 de español animará a los estudiantes a utilizar español idiomático al hablar y escribir para llevar a cabo discusiones sobre temas complicados de acontecimientos actuales. Debido a que los estudiantes de este nivel ya están familiarizados con las estructuras fundamentales de la gramática en español, las necesidades y los problemas de los alumnos determinarán el componente de las lecciones de gramática en cada clase.  La clase será dirigida en un ambiente divertido.  Cada estudiante disfrutara el apoyo de su instructor(a) y compañeros de clase, junto con la oportunidad de expresarse en español con confianza.

results.description:
At this event, you will be given insight on how 2 talented entrepreneurs took their startups from Concepts to Creations. Scott Barnett has started several new companies and been named CEO of a few others. Ryan Shearman graduated from TechLaunch and recently closed on a 1.1 million dollar capital raise.

Both have made mistakes, learned a ton and pivoted. On the 29th, you get to draw from their experiences. As always you can expect a highly interactive format... check out the agenda below.   



Agenda:

6:30-7:00 - Open Networking and Pizza

7:00-7:15 - Launch NJ Overview, Asks, Event Overview

7:15-7:30 - Event begins, introductions, business summaries

7:30-7:45 - Validation Moderated Discussion

7:45-8:00 - Validation Q&A

8:00-8:15 - Launching Moderated Discussion

8:15-8:30 - Launching Q&A

8:30-8:45 - Pivot Moderated Discussion

8:45-9:00 - Pivot Q&A  


Panelists:

Ryan Shearman:

http://www.fusar.com/

Ryan is a mechanical engineer by training and a consumer product development engineer by profession. He honed the skills necessary to take a product to market from nothing more than a rough concept while working for internationally renowned jewelry company, David Yurman. He was responsible for developing several highly successful lines of men's jewelry produced using manufacturing processes and materials not traditionally used in the jewelry industry. Over the last five years, Ryan has managed the development of luxury consumer goods with total retail sales of over $80 million. Ryan is a passionate technologist and inventor - having designed and built a number of unique electromechanical products including a fully autonomous robotic lawn mower and a number of electric motorcycles. He is also a lifelong motorcyclist and action sports enthusiasts with a background in motocross, snowboarding, skydiving, and over ten years' experience riding motorcycles around NYC.


Scott Barnett:

https://www.bizyhood.com/

Scott Barnett is a serial entrepreneur who has contributed to the growth and expansion of startup and established companies by leveraging leadership skills, technical expertise, teamwork and passion. Huge fan/user of Customer Development and Lean Startup methodologies. Trusted client advocate who proactively promotes customer needs and aligns them to the goals of the business. Utilizes strong written and spoken communications skills to support advertising, tradeshows, promotions, and sales.

Specialties: Startup specialist, strong technical and business acumen, Enterprise/Web/Mobile/Open Source/Cloud Software, Cleantech

Location:


The event will be held in room LC28 on the Drew University campus. The room is located on the lower level of the University Library.

Attendees should park in the Visitor's lot and take the path by Dorothy Young, past Mead Hall to the front of the Learning Center. LC28 is down the ramp before you get to the front door of the library.

A link to the Drew University campus, and parking is below:

https://www.drew.edu/map/

results.description:
Free beer, T-shirts/swag, junk-food, drinks and more!

Thierry Delprat, Chief Technical Officer, Nuxeo

RSVP NOW at http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/226088622/

A Database Month event: http://www.DBMonth.com/database/content-repository

Content repository technologies have evolved over the years and have migrated from Object Databases to SQL and then have begun to leverage NoSQL technologies. NoSQL enables a full range of new solutions, including hybrid SQL + NoSQL architecture.

This presentation explains the technical and design choices required to keep a content repository up-to-date and able to address the challenges of today's projects.

We will cover:

• Brief introduction on content repositories, their unique goals and challenges as well as their main use cases in the field

• Limitations when faced with traditional SQL databases, including problematic use-cases

• Integration of Elasticsearch and MongoDB as part of the storage infrastructure, including the challenges and motivations for selecting this type of architecture.

• Hybrid storage architecture benchmark results and real life feedback

Thierry Delprat, Chief Technical Officer, Nuxeo

Thierry Delprat joined Nuxeo in 2005, just in time to handle the migration of the platform from Python to Java. Now as CTO, he guides the architectural development of the Nuxeo Platform.

Prior to joining Nuxeo, Thierry worked for over 7 years at Unilog/Logica, with progressively senior experience across different branches of the consulting company with a focus on Collaboration, Content Management and open source solutions.

He was also a technical architect at Cryo-Networks (infrastructure for online games). Thierry graduated from the Ecole Centrale de Nantes and holds a Master of Telecommunications.

Swag giveaway + food/drinks at 6:30pm 
Power-Networking at 6:35pm 
Presentation starts at 6:40pm

RSVP at http://www.NYCSQL.com/events/226088622/

You can prevent a child in New York City from becoming homeless!
Please donate to Techie Youth - your generosity will save the life of an at-risk youth by teaching them tech & placing them in an IT job, right here in NYC!
Make your donation now at http://www.TechieYouth.org
(saving a child's life is very easy!)

results.description:
BOOK: Godless Grace: How Non-Believers are Making the World Safer, Richer and Kinder, 

OCTOBER 29, 2015 (THURSDAY) 6:30PM


NYC ATHEISTS MONTHLY MEETING


AUTHORS: DAVID ORENSTEIN PhD & LINDA BLAIKIE LCSW

BOOK: Godless Grace: How Non-Believers are Making the World Safer, Richer and Kinder, 


“Atheists and other nonbelievers are per se immoral. … Since god is the source of all morality, it’s impossible for a nonbeliever to be a good person.”

That’s the conventional wisdom, especially among fundamentalist Christians. And it’s utterly false. Authors David Orenstein and Linda Ford Blaikie disprove the smear in the most persuasive possible way: by telling the stories of dozens of real-life nonbelievers who devote their lives to doing good for others.

Orenstein and Blaikie’s new book, Godless Grace: How Nonbelievers Are Making the World Safer, Richer and Kinder, portrays nonbelievers both from America and around the world. Some examples:

The nonbeliever soldier, who joined the army to fight religious fanaticism at age 40, right after September 11;

The crusader against sexual harassment in Panama;

The Filipino nurse practitioner who builds bridges between her humanist organization and religious groups to fight violence against LGBTQ individuals;

The former Lutheran who took a pay cut to work as a paramedic so he could help others;

The British survivor of priest sex abuse who now devotes her time to aiding other victims;

The Hungarian who fights against the billion-dollar illegal wildlife trade in southeast Asia;

The Argentine mechanical engineer who develops joint replacements in his day job, and organizes nonbelievers – in the land of Pope Francis – in his spare time;

The Canadian who developed an alternative to Alcoholics Anonymous for fellow nonbelievers.

Orenstein and Blaikie describe not only what these folks do, but why. Hint: fear of hell has nothing to do with it!

Going beyond the individual profiles, Godless Grace presents a comprehensive picture of nonbelief around the world and predicts where the movement is heading. With a forward by prominent secular professor Dr. Phil Zuckerman and an afterward by President of American Atheists David Silverman, it is a must-read for anyone looking for definitive proof that people can be "good without a god."

Godless Grace: How Nonbelievers Are Making the World Safer, Richer and Kinder will be available from Humanist Press in October 2015.

-----------------------


LOCATION: SLC Conference Center, 15 West 39th St. (3rd Floor)

COST: $10 Donation covers room rental.

=====================================
results.name: BOOK: Godless Grace: - ORENSTEIN/BLAIKIE - OCTOBER 29, 2015 (THURSDAY) 6:30PM

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners).  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: 18 west 18th street (between 5th & 6th Ave), Floor 6, Studio 4
results.name: Improv NOW! - Thursday Improv Scenework Class 6:30-8:30pm ($10)

results.description:
Why Options?

Equity options are the most versatile of the major trading asset classes. They can:

•  be used as a proxy for trading stocks and ETFs

•  generate short- and long-term income

•  protect existing positions and mitigate risk

•  allow use of significantly less capital to achieve a goal

•  permit you to be profitable without being 100% correct

Learn all about this from 25-year options veteran Frank Kneipher, a true options guru. Frank's history includes:

•  years as a hedge fund risk manager

•  major contributor to thestreet.com

•  presenter at the New York City Traders Expo and Las Vegas Money Show

•  highly-regarded educator for pristine.com, where he formulated and taught its options curriculum

A much sought-after options mentor the last several years, Frank will be with us to talk about fitting options into:

•  a long-term investment strategy

•  shorter term trading

•  income production

•  wealth protection and managing risk

Frank's love of options is based on their versatility and adaptability for every personal income and wealth objective, risk appetite, market environment and trading situation. They enable structuring positions that are flexible, instantly adjustable when needed, and forgiving since you have wiggle room about how right you need to be in establishing the trade parameters. Frank refers to this as “Trading with an Edge.”

Join us at the PTL traderoom on Thursday Oct 29th at 6:30pm and hear about all-things-options from a pro's pro! Snacks and refreshments will be available, and there will be a free flash-drive given to all attendees containing useful options information written by Frank.

Seating is limited and there's a $10 fee for this special presentation, so please sign up now. Learn from the best how you, too, can “trade with an edge.”

We look forward to seeing you.

• with Jonathan Talat Phillips & Will Asher Morgan 

• 8-Week Online Divine Initiation Ceremonies & “F-Yeah! Frequency” Training 

• Oct. 29 – Dec. 22  (Winter Solstice) 

Have you secretly always sensed that you were a Rock Star but didn't know how to fully step into that power?

results.description:
Why Options?!

Equity options are the most versatile of the major trading asset classes. They can:

·  be used as a proxy for trading stocks and ETFs

·  generate short- and long-term income

·  protect existing positions and mitigate risk

·  allow use of significantly less capital to achieve a goal

·  permit you to be profitable without being 100% correct

Learn all about this from 25-year options veteran Frank Kneipher, a true options guru. Frank's history includes:

·  years as a hedge fund risk manager

·  major contributor to thestreet.com

·  presenter at the New York City Traders Expo and Las Vegas Money Show

·  highly-regarded educator for pristine.com, where he formulated and taught its options curriculum

A much sought-after options mentor the last several years, Frank will be with us to talk about fitting options into:

·  a long-term investment strategy

·  shorter term trading

·  income production

·  wealth protection and managing risk

Frank's love of options is based on their versatility and adaptability for every personal income and wealth objective, risk appetite, market environment and trading situation. They enable  structuring positions that are flexible, instantly adjustable when needed, and forgiving since you have wiggle room about how right you need to be in establishing the trade parameters. Frank refers to this as “Trading with an Edge.”

Join us at the PTL traderoom on Thursday Oct 29th at 6:30pm and hear about all-things-options from a pro's pro! Snacks and refreshments will be available, and there will be a free flash-drive given to all attendees containing useful options information written by Frank.

Seating is limited and there's a $10 fee for this special presentation, so please sign up now. Learn from the best how you, too, can “trade with an edge.”
results.name: Why Options ? !
