Are you in Pain?

Are you suffering in some way or many ways?

Are you looking for help or support to feel better?

It is time of the month to come back together with like-minded people and help us to continue our discussions on how to take control of our lives with the most positive uplifting teaching around the Law of Attraction and other Spiritual laws.

This month our topic is all around

A Way Out of Pain and Still Raise Your Vibration!

Do you know what pain is really an indicator of?

Do you want to see how pain serves us?

Are you ready to find more ways to deal with the pain and still move forward in your life?

Then come on out for our next Apply the Law of Attraction meeting as we delve deep into why pain is our friend and how it actually serves our greatest good.

The pain may be physical. mental, emotional or deep in your soul. We will touch upon all of it, and how we can use pain to help us in our lives, in our health, and our relationships.

In preparation for this co-creative experience, please watch the following video on this topic from Matt Kahn: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B3zKwZqfWrY

So let's learn how we can shift our attitudes around pain, and how that shifts how we feel, how we act and how we show up in our lives. In fact, the very act of doing so is raising our vibration in the process! Share your pain and lets all contribute to the learning and the growth we all desire.

This event is by donation only, so everyone is welcome so please bring your friends! Our recommended donation is $15, but please do not let that keep you away, after all, you are a masterful creator are you not?

Please come out and tell your friends and let's make this a truly wonderful experience!

We look forward to seeing you on Thursday evening the 29th, from 6:30pm - 8:30pm at 151 West 25th Street, 4th Floor.

Joyfully,

Sam

It's the Halloween Edition of the NY Video Meetup - but there's nothing scary about this month's presenters!  (Costumes Optional - But Invited!)

PRESENTERS  

GLIDE - Sarah Snow

Glide is the live video messaging app for people who want more personality and expression when communicating with those who know them best. If you're feeling that text can't say enough, you're ready for Glide. Glide works on Apple's iPhone, iPad and even the Apple Watch, as well as Android smartphones and tablets. Sarah Snow, Glide’s Community Manager who is visiting from Israel, will present.

ZENTRICK - Pieter Mees

Pieter is convinced video has only scratched the surface of its potential. He’s a man on a mission to transform video into a more active, personal dialog between consumers and brands. Pieter’s extensive software architecture and engineering expertise enabled him to start a successful European IT technology consultancy prior to graduating magna cum laude from uGhent, and co-founding Zentrick. A hands-on CEO, he’s the keeper of Zentrick’s big picture. Pieter exists in a steady state of transatlantic flights, Belgian chocolate, and Nespresso.

SPORTS GURU  - Ken Zamkow

SportsGuru is the place where fans talk about sports - via short videos. They are launching their private beta in November, and you'll get to see it at NYTM first!


EEVO -  Alejandro Dinsmore

We are a creator-focused platform for high quality VR content, offering streaming and download functionality across all hardware devices. We deliver VR experiences to the widest audience, with the highest quality, at the fastest speeds. EEVO is creating a carefully curated distribution ecosystem for the best virtual reality content. A platform where a select set of visionary creators can share their work with viewers looking to experience the new world of VR storytelling.

results.description:
Have you ever dreamed about starting your own gluten-free business but didn't have the funds to start? 

Do you want to write a gluten-free cookbook but need some extra money to help publish it?

Did you ever want to help back a gluten-free start-up but didn't know how? 

Attend this free workshop to learn how your gluten-free business can benefit from Kiva Zip!


Accessing Capital with Kiva Zip: How to get a 0% interest loan for your gluten-free business! 

Most people think of Kiva.org as an international nonprofit via which you can make a loan to an entrepreneur in a developing country. What most don’t know is that Kiva now operates in the US as well, offering 0% interest loans of up to $10,000 to entrepreneurs here in New York City! 

The Kiva Zip US program is working to revolutionize the way small, socially impactful business access capital. Unlike banks who underwrite loans based on credit score, collateral or cash flow, Kiva Zip uses “social underwriting,” determining a borrower’s creditworthiness based on their character and network of trust.  Loans are crowd-funded on the Kiva Zip website by individuals around the world who invest as little as $25 each. They have a network of thousands of lenders and have a funding success rate over 90%.

While speaking with Lauryn Drainie, of the Kiva Zip Program, I learned that food businesses are the most popular with Kiva Zip’s global community of lenders. In fact, many of their most popular loans have been for gluten-free businesses. 


Meet the borrower: 8 Bit Bakeshop

8 Bit Bakeshop is a video game and comic book inspired baked goods company founded by Hannah and Matthew and based out of a kitchen in Long Island City, NY. 

Inspired by their type 1 diabetic daughter, the 8 Bit Bakeshop launched Little Luna Cookies, a line of 8 Bit goodies aims to cater to those with food allergies and special dietary needs. 

8 Bit says, "Sufferers of nut, gluten, dairy, and even more food allergies are often forgotten in the world of specialty pastries. Though there are tons of yummy options on your supermarket shelves, there is nothing quite like a fresh handmade pastry made just for you on your special day. Or any day really!

But what makes us the best place to go to? Not only do we make these pastries in a separate kitchen from other businesses in our incubator, we take the time to use dedicated tools just for you. AND! Your cookie order comes with a complete nutrition facts label (as applicable) and the listing of ingredients. ....All for no extra charge. "

Come meet the 8 Bit Bakeshop team, learn how a 0% interest Kiva Zip loan helped launch these gluten-free cookies. Stay to sample and buy Little Luna cookies! 


Interested in learning more about Kiva Zip but cannot attend the event, click here.

results.name: Accessing capital as a Gluten-Free Entrepreneur with Kiva Zip (Workshop)

results.description:
Announcing our panelists!

Not all funding sources are created equal. Whether you’re looking for start-up capital to get a venture going or need cash to sustain your business once you’ve started to grow, the financing options for startups and small businesses can be an overwhelming labyrinth of difficult decisions, hurdles, and compromises. But with the right advice and understanding of the funding ecosystem, it doesn’t have to be such a difficult process.

Join ITAC and NYDesigns for a conversation about some widely known and lesser-known funding options for your business -- and find out which ones are right for you. You’ll hear from representatives from several funding agencies as well as a couple of startups who will share their fundraising success stories.

Panelists:


Jun Shimada, ThinkEco, Founder and CEO

John Abrashkin, Honeybee Robotics, Director of Business Development

John Sinnott, Cornell Center for Materials Research (CCMR), Industrial Partnerships Manager

Sumeet Shah, Brand Foundry, Venture Associate

Bryan Doxford, New York Business Development Corporation (NYBDC), SVP & Program Manager – Community Lending

Format:

6:30 - 7:00pm | Networking and light fare

7:00 - 7:10pm | Introductions

7:10 - 8:00pm | Rapid-fire panelist presentations - 7 minutes per panelist followed by 3 minutes of Q&A

8:00 - 8:30pm | More networking

Light refreshments will be provided.

results.description:
Bring: A yoga mat (we also have some loaners)
Wear: Comfortable clothing
What to expect: Accelerate your practice; renewed feelings of happiness, peace, kindness and grounding
Pricing: First class – FREE
$18.00 / class (pay as you go)
$150.00 for 10 class card (must be used within 6 months)
(Cash/Check/Credit Card/PayPal Accepted)


Teacher: Nancie Celini

Dr. Nancie Celini is our founding teacher. She is a Registered Yoga Teacher (RYT, Yoga Alliance) and holds a masters and doctorate in public health. With years of fitness training and a black belt in martial arts her strong teaching background and love of yoga has inspired her to craft a program for everyone. Nancie developed Just Breathe while studying Karate. The simple act of breathing, correctly, can make a vast difference in being able to flow through the events of life or feeling stuck and frustrated. When you feel anxious, sad or frustrated, Just Breathe!

results.description:
This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com

All are Welcome!

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description:
Running in a dynamic environment like AWS poses numerous challenges, and these only increase when the need to protect sensitive data is added. The usual approach of using TLS/SSL is pretty unwieldy, and usually leaves some concerns. During this presentation I will present an alternative approach, along with a demonstration and will then open for feedback and questions at the end.

Food will be on-hand (pizza and salad from one of our favorite nearby spots) as well as wine, beer, and non-alcoholic beverages.

About the speaker:

Andrew Mulholland is Senior Systems Engineer for Aetion Inc, a NYC based startup providing essential evidence for healthcare. Previously, he held a similar position at Sum Inc, a Janus Friis backed startup in preventative healthcare. Prior roles also include Operations Architect for Expedia, Performance and Automation manager for Betfair and Senior Manager of Technical Operations for Joost.

At work, he strives to break down the barriers between development and operations, with a healthy mix of security on the side. His continual goal is to attempt to automate himself out of having to do work, a challenge upon which he is not yet successful.

When not working Andrew is an avid photographer, having been a published and professional motorsport photographer before moving to the US. These days most of his photographs seem to be of Logo, his + his fiancée’s dog.

results.description:
Our first meetup will be held in Wall Street Share’s offices on 16 East 40th Street (Suite 802) on Thursday, 10/29 at 7:00 PM.  For more information on Wall Street Share, please visit our website at www.wallstreetshare.com. 

The meetup will be a bit more structured than other meetups we have attended, though attendees will have complete autonomy in determining the degree to which they want to participate.  The following contains a tentative overview of the itinerary:

7:00 PM – 7:30 PM: Meet & Greet - Attendees will have an opportunity to meet and socialize with one another and swap business cards

7:30 PM – 8:30 PM: Formal Business Discussion – We will congregate in small groups and each company will have an opportunity to discuss their businesses, talk about challenges they’re facing, opportunities they see, etc…  We plan on rotating groups so that everyone has an opportunity to meet one another.

8:30 PM – 9:00 PM: Informal Discussions – After learning about other attendees during the Formal Business Discussion portion of the meetup, we expect attendees to gravitate to those with whom they may have synergies or ideas to explore.  We will also be in the crowd talking to attendees and exploring opportunities to assist and work with some of them.

We're proud to be hosting our next Meetup during the grand opening of the brand new flagship Microsoft Store on 5th Avenue! We'll hear two amazing talks on the topic of: "Using Augmented & Virtual Reality To Learn More About Outer Space".


Please come for pizza, soda, and snacks and hear our two awesome speakers:

John Oquist, of Dialogue Theory, will present his 2014 Space Apps Challenge project "A-ROV - Augmented-Reality-for-remotely-Operated-Vehicles," which won Best Use of Hardware at Space Apps NYC.


and

Carter Emmart, Director of Astrovisualization at the Hayden Planetarium at the American Museum of Natural History, will be coming to discuss the use of simulation software for immersive exploration of outer space (as most recently demonstrated by the New Horizons flyby of Pluto).

Doors open at 7:00 p.m. The talks will be presented, each followed by a short Q&A, and pizza & soda will be provided after [paid for by your cost to RSVP - no money will be accepted at the door or during the event, you MUST RSVP & pay at this site via Meetup to get refreshments] and we'll meet & greet with each other and our speakers.


(speakers and talks may be subject to change without notice)

results.description:
Last year, a group of us got together to design awesome posters for our NYC Marathon viewing outing. Some of our posters made the rounds of social media, thanks to photo-taking by race participants. Let’s repeat this while enjoying happy hour!

******NOTE: This event is only open to those of us who are NOT planning to run the NYC Marathon on November 1st. If you are planning to run, please enjoy yourself elsewhere - go eat some veggies, put your feet up, go to bed early, drink some water, and do pre-race type things!*****

We will provide poster board and basic art supplies. You need to come equipped with ideas - the more the better. To give you an idea, some popular content we’ve developed in the past has included: 

“Brooklyn is so .3 miles ago. Welcome to Queens!”
“Welcome to the best 2.3 miles of the race. Welcome to Queens!”

In other words, we are welcoming all runners to the best borough of the race. We will also want to include our group name (Woodside-Sunnyside Runners) on the poster for promotional value. If you have artistic skills, you are even more welcome to join us. 

Think of some great poster ideas - we’ll brainstorm some more, enjoy some beverages, and make posters for November 1st. 

Again, if you are running the NYC Marathon, please don’t join us. You’ll see our creativity on November 1st, just past the half-marathon point in LIC. 

- - - - - - 
Please see our full calendar of events

like us on Facebook

results.description:
Come join us Thursday, October 29th, for the next #HackGotham meetup!

The First 24 Hours After a Breach byPaul Kubler, CISSP, SEC+, CCNA, ACE

A major company has been hacked, suffering a data breach. How do companies the size of Sony handle such situations?

Various departments, including legal, tech, and PR come together to meet with the management and work out a plan on how to handle the crisis. The presentation will focus on both, companies with a data breach response plan, as well as without. This presentation will shed some light on what the first 24 hours post-breach looks like for a major company.

About the presenter:

Paul Kubler is a Cyber Security and Digital Forensics Examiner at LIFARS LLC, an international cybersecurity and digital forensics firm. He’s a former employee at Boeing, in the Global Network Architecture division, the nation’s largest private cyberattack target. He previously worked at the Flushing Bank, in Network and Systems Infrastructure, protecting valuable financial data at various levels within the network and system. Paul has also performed forensic investigations into mobile devices aiding in the prosecution of criminals.

Router Vulnerabilities by Mark Shilshtut

Routers are an essential part of todays digital world. In many ways a router is a gateway into a network, and onto the devices connected to a network.

Being able to find and exploit router vulnerabilities is a powerful tool in a hackers toolkit. Mark will go over a number of different classifications of router vulnerabilities and share some recommendations on how to avoid being a victim of having your router p0wn'd.

About the presenter:

Mark Shilshtut has dual Bachelor degree from Stony Brook University in Computer Science and Economics. Aquired master degree from Columbia University in Technology Management.  Worked for major financial companies - Merrill Lynch (Market data), Bear Sterns(OATS&OTS compliance), Goldman Sachs(GSAM).  Worked for 2 startups before joining SecurityScorecard (SamosAnalytics-retail, Socure-KYC Social).
results.name: HackGotham: The First 24 Hours After a Breach & Router Vulnerabilities

results.description:
More info to follow...



www.RomanoArt.com

www.shishigami.com/srfa/Jel_Ena/indexannouncemagica.html

www.zeroequalstwo.net/magica-sexualis-exhibit-opens-october-29-in-brooklyn-ny

Stephen Romano Gallery is pleased to announce the next group exhibition following in the series of "In Missa Interfectionis", "Opus Hypnagogia" (at Morbid Anatomy Museum) and the inaugural exhibition at Stephen Romano Gallery's new Bushwick location "Lexicon Infernali", all of which examine the interection of the esoteric, vernacual, visionary, outsider, vintage and contemporary art practices. "Magica Sexualis" is the title of a book from 1934 which fascinates as a power object, and the work presented will examine sexual energy manifest through magic practice, or the reverse, magic energy manifest though sexual themes.

Sexual magic refers to an ancient science that has been known and protected by the purest, most spiritually advanced human beings, whose purpose and goal is the harnessing and perfection of our sexual forces. A more accurate translation of sexual magic would be "sexual priesthood."

In ancient times, the priest was always accompanied by a priestess, for they represent the divine forces at the base of all creation: the masculine and feminine, the Yab-Yum, Ying-Yang, Father-Mother: the Elohim.

Sex magic (sometimes spelled sex magick) is any type of sexual activity used in magical, ritualistic or otherwise religious and spiritual pursuits. One practice of sex magic is using the energy of sexual arousal or orgasm with visualization of a desired result. A premise of sex magic is the concept that sexual energy is a potent force that can be harnessed to transcend one's normally perceived reality.

The earliest known practical teachings of sex magic in the Western world come from 19th-century American occultist Paschal Beverly Randolph,"If a man has an intelligent and loving wife, with whom he is in complete accord, he can work out the problems [of how to achieve magical results] by her aid. They are a radical soul-sexive series of energies...The rite is a prayer in all cases, and the most powerful [that] earthly beings can employ...it is best for both man and wife to act together for the attainment of the mysterious objects sought. Success in any case requires the adjuvancy of a superior woman. THIS IS THE LAW!"

In the latter part of the 19th century, sexual reformer Ida Craddock published several works dealing with sacred sexuality, most notably Heavenly Bridegrooms and Psychic Wedlock. Aleister Crowley reviewed Heavenly Bridegroomsin the pages of his journal The Equinox, stating that it was: "..one of the most remarkable human documents ever produced, and it should certainly find a regular publisher in book form. The authoress of the MS. claims that she was the wife of an angel. She expounds at the greatest length the philosophy connected with this thesis. Her learning is enormous. ...This book is of incalculable value to every student of occult matters. No Magick library is complete without it."

Carl Kellner, the founder of Ordo Templi Orientis, (O.T.O.), claimed to have learned the techniques of sex magic from three adepts in this art. Aleister Crowley became involved with Theodor Reuss and Ordo Templi Orientis following the publication of The Book of Lies between 1912 and 1913. According to Crowley's account, Reuss approached him and accused him of having revealed the innermost (sexual) secret of O.T.O. in one of the cryptic chapters of this book. When it became clear to Reuss that Crowley had done so unintentionally, he initiated Crowley into the IX° (ninth degree) of O.T.O. and appointed him "Sovereign Grand Master General of Ireland, Iona and all the Britains.

The exhibition will also feature an installation by Barry William Hale that will be visibile from the street and will change depending on outside light conditions.
results.name: Grand Opening of “Magica Sexualis” (Sexual Magic!) Exhibition!!

results.description:
"Purchasing and the Working-out of Notes"

Thursday, October 29, 2015
7:00 PM to 9:00 PM
AFG
31 West 34th Street, Between 5th and 6th Ave. 7th Floor, New York, NY 

Cathy and Cathie (aka “The Cathy’s”) are, by trade, HRIS Software Designers and worked together for over 12 years. Cathy as a Director and Cathie as a Manager, together developed 5 enterprise software systems from conception to annual maintenance. 

When the company was purchased in 2009 and they were downsized, they began looking for investments that would provide monthly income as well as future security. The original plan was to go into the Fix n’ Flip business, but in pursuing that, they stumbled upon notes. The distressed mortgage business seemed to fit into their plans perfectly. They went on a fact finding mission and discovered the endless possibilities of borrower solutions and exit strategies. 

Since 2012 they have been involved with 3 business ventures and have personally purchased over 40 notes.
They have also ‘worked out’ over 30 notes for other investors. Their goal is to keep the homeowners in their homes. 

Limited space available, please confirm here on meetup! 

-BUSINESS ATTIRE ONLY- Brought to you by Ricky Brava and www.MortgageFloat.com

Admission:
- FREE - First 25 People that RSVP
- $20 for everyone there after ("No Exceptions")
results.name: "Purchasing and the Working-out of Notes"

results.description:
It seems obvious that inline documentation would be inherently superior to separately-maintained documentation, but making things happen isn't always so simple.

We'll examine many dev-time and ops-time documentation techniques to maintain cadence without incurring technical debt:

- Commenting in source, in configuration, and in the operational  environment itself

- Native tools for a number of popular languages

- Build-time generation of documentation

- Coverage of the latest formats, techniques, and tools

- Specific recommendations applicable to a variety of devops environments

- When and what you shouldn't document

- The reasons why documentation doesn't happen and approaches for  remediation.

Matt Jones has been working at web scale since the last century. Of course, the web was smaller then. His background includes service provider as well as end-user organizations, both academic and commercial, from traditional enterprises to today's startups.

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Live Model Drawing - Union Square

Discover the power of your breath through Pranayama (ancient breathing techniques). Learn how the breath can help you manage your emotions, have a say over your state of mind and live a happy-stress free life. 


The workshop also offers a preview of a longer workshop called The Happiness program.

The Happiness Program teaches practical and powerful tools to help you discover your unlimited power and freedom - not as a concept, but as a direct experience. You learn a powerful breathing technique called Sudarshan Kriya which eliminates stress from our system and brings clarity and energy.

Through Happiness Program you will discover that you can be happy, whatever the situation, and live a deeply fulfilling life

More @ Behappymc.org
results.name: Discover the Power of Breath!

results.description:
China Hands NYC is having another meetup! Come join us!

China Hands are invited to meetup at WeWork Charging Bull on the 10th floor, in New York City's financial district, at 7pm on Thursday October 29th. 

Composer-ethnomusicologist Juliane Jones writes hybrid popular music that blends traditional Chinese concepts and timbres with Western popular music.  She will discuss the process and concepts behind her new songwriting project, Ragged Silk,  that integrates traditional Chinese music genres of guqin, pipa and xiao music, Chinese opera, and Buddhist chant into Western popular music idioms.

https://youtu.be/AlZmS6iil3w

We'll be providing good beers, drinks, and snacks, and we're thankful for your $10 meetup contribution towards the costs of staging New York's best China Hand networking community. 

Due to strict building security, PLEASE RSVP before the event to have your name placed on the guest list. Security will not grant access to names not listed on the guest list. 

China Hands NYC is grateful for the support of our foundation sponsors: 
Allegravita 
Strategic Communications and Public Relations 
Allegravita is an award-winning, multi-disciplinary public relations and strategic communications agency focused on the China region. 

China Luxury Advisors  
China Luxury Advisors counsels luxury brands and retailers on their China consumer strategy, ranging from market entry to digital to attracting, converting, and retaining affluent Chinese customers worldwide. Thanks also to our generous venue sponsor...

WeWork 
WeWork is the platform for creators. We provide the space, community and services you need to create your life’s work. To learn more about WeWork's 12 locations in New York City, send an email to [masked] and let them know you were referred by China Hands NYC. 

Please RSVP today and join an amazing community of fellow China experts in New York City!
results.how_to_find_us: Present ID to lobby security and come up to the 10th Floor!

Hey ladies, I've been traveling the globe, speaking with our #PrettySisters about beauty standards and their relationship with their appearance. And I've been documenting their stories in our series "Pretty" (http://un-ruly.com/pretty/). Now we'd like to hear YOUR stories in NY. 

Hairfinity and Un-ruly are joining forces to bring you an intimate screening of select episodes of "Pretty," (including one that's yet to be released). The screening will be followed by an open forum, where we’ll discuss some of the themes brought up in the series, share experiences and connect with our NY #PrettySisters.

We're hosting the screening at Brooklyn Swirl, so the first 20 people to arrive will receive a free fro-yo. Refreshments will also be served. And other goodies, courtesy of Hairfinity will be given out!

Come to watch, chat, listen…and for the free stuff ;-)!

results.description:
Hello everyone, 

I am happy to announce our first meetup. To get the group started, I have chosen our first text: Melissa Buzzeo's The Devastation published by NY based Nightboat Books. Nightboat has published experimental/hybrid texts along with works of translation since 2003 and always put out prescient and important work (more info here).

The Devastation was published earlier this year. It is a text that drifts and sinks into love and disaster, memory as wreckage, connection, performance and the ocean floor. I am really excited to discuss the book!

Please feel free to bring any additional accompanying materials that you want to offer to the group, from concepts, theory, other media, affinities/associations to current affairs, memories and experiences, as ways to orient and track what we as readers bring to the text.

A friend has kindly offered us the wonderful used bookstore Book Thug Nation in Williamsburg as our meetup location! As a result, I had to change the date to the 29th instead of the 27th. I hope this works for everyone.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

I look forward to meeting you all,

Indigo

http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1937658252/ref=ox_sc_act_title_6?ie=UTF8&psc=1&smid=ATVPDKIKX0DER


http://www.nightboat.org/title/devastation

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
"Purchasing and the Working-out of Notes"


Cathy and Cathie (aka “The Cathy’s”) are, by trade, HRIS Software Designers and worked together for over 12 years. Cathy as a Director and Cathie as a Manager, together developed 5 enterprise software systems from conception to annual maintenance. 

When the company was purchased in 2009 and they were downsized, they began looking for investments that would provide monthly income as well as future security. 

The original plan was to go into the Fix n’ Flip business, but in pursuing that, they stumbled upon notes. The distressed mortgage business seemed to fit into their plans perfectly. They went on a fact finding mission and discovered the endless possibilities of borrower solutions and exit strategies. 


Since 2012 they have been involved with 3 business ventures and have personally purchased over 40 notes.
They have also ‘worked out’ over 30 notes for other investors. Their goal is to keep the homeowners in their homes. 

Limited space available, please confirm here on meetup! 

-BUSINESS ATTIRE ONLY- Brought to you by Ricky Brava and www.MortgageFloat.com

Admission:
- FREE - First 25 People that RSVP
- $20 for everyone there after ("No Exceptions")

results.description:
Basket Case director Frank Henenlotter explores another bizarre symbiotic human-monster relationship in this surreal horror comedy about a young man named Brian (Rick Herbst) who emerges from a night of bizarre hallucinations to find a jovial talking slug attached to his body. The creature, a brain-eating parasite called an "Aylmer" (but who prefers the simpler handle "Elmer") came calling after abandoning his former companions -- a European couple who tried to wean him from human brains by supplying him with sheep brains from the local butcher. Preferring prey of the bipedal variety (and a younger, more mobile host), Elmer hitches a ride with Brian, administering doses of a highly addictive psychedelic drug to keep him under control, and sends him out in search of human gray matter. Understandably, this drives a wedge in the relationship between Brian and his girlfriend, Barbara (Jennifer Lowry), who doesn't buy the monster story but nevertheless begins to recognize Brian's junkie behavior patterns. Fighting a losing battle against Elmer's magic juice (and trying to keep Elmer from munching down on Barbara's skull), Brian is forced into a hideous showdown for possession of his own mind. Clever highlights include horror host John Zacherle as the Bing Crosby-esque voice of Elmer and a cute cameo from Basket boy Kevin Van Hentenryck.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ub0QVniKTmg

To purchase your tickets in advance and to reserve your seat, follow this link:

https://drafthouse.com/nyc-area/show/brain-damage-with-frank-henenlotter-in-person?_m_utk=7f216b88ad613f003effd2ebb2bd95d1

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life

Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.

Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?

Now You Can!”

Come to  West Side Talkers  and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday October 29th,  2015  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required!

In this introductory workshop of Clearing Karmic Imprints, we will learn how to access The Soul (Akashic) Records through understanding and researching the subconscious mind and soul records to quickly find and release discordant, limiting beliefs and ideas. The system does not only clear, but replaces these sabotaging blocks with loving, supportive ideas and beliefs. Spiritual Response Technique is a painless and accurate way of changing the internal as well as external landscape of our lives.


The system involves the use of a pendulum, a set of charts, and a specific series of questions to complete the research and clear discordant programming which was formed in past lives.

Student/healers will be taught how to use a pendulum and charts to direct them in finding answers about karmic patterns and how to clear sabotaging karmic imprints.

Workshop schedule 

1. What is the Mind Net and the Nature of the Subconscious Mind


2. The Higher Self - The Divinity Inside

3.The Pendulum and Establishing Yes and No Response

4. Using Spiritual Clearing Charts

4. Spiritual Blocks/ Programs and when they are Established

5. Discorded Energies/ Hooks, Entities, and other Dark forces.

6. The Clearing Process

The price for this workshop is 20.00 in advance and 25.00 at the door. If you would like to attend without paying on line please text or call me to reserve your spot in advance[masked]-0588. I look forward to meeting you in this karmic Clearing Workshop.

results.description:
Meditation:

To discover deep internal Peace…

To wake up by connecting with your vital Force…

To live with profound Joy and a sense of Well Being…

To experience the Sacred in yourself and those around you.

……

In these times of rapid change and growing fragmentation we feel it’s important to find internal calm and meaning in life. This group offers simple down-to-earth guided meditations designed to connect with deeper parts of oneself and one’s own experience of the sacred.

We use the book “Silo’s Message” to guide our meetings. Silo is a spiritual guide who is also well-known for developing Universalist Humanism.

Our purpose is to create an environment that will nurture and foster deep experiences and help us notice them and live them in our daily life.

Our meetings are small so that everyone can interact easily and comfortably. And they are always open – no commitment or experience is required. Complete beginners are welcome

This is not a religious organization and we welcome and respect people of all backgrounds and beliefs. We work entirely on a volunteer basis. There are no costs for the meeting.

Occasionally we have day long seminars at the Hudson Valley Park of Study and Reflection. This is a beautiful retreat center located 2 hours from New York City which is part of the world-wide network of parks inspired by Silo’s work. http://www.hudsonvalleypark.org/

For information about Silo and his life:

Biography: http://silosmessage.net/about_silo.asp?LANG=EN

Description of Silo’s life work: http://newhumanist.us/?p=1211

An Open Invitation from party Host, Jerry D.

I want to invite you to our Annual Halloween Dinner Dance Party, which has been our biggest and best event every year !! As usual, we will award at least 7 prizes for the best or most creative costumes !! However, feel free to come as you are or with just a little Halloween flavor.

We have done a couple of things differently this year, to keep the cost down and to enable people who don't drink alcohol to attend without paying for the people who do drink. In other words, we will have a "cash bar" rather than the "open bar" that has been part of our Halloween celebrations of the past. Also, in order for people to attend a variety of events during the Halloween weekend, we are having our party on Thursday. In order to achieve the lower price structure, we will have a "House Party Away From Home".

As usual, my sister and her family will cook and serve an authentic, home-made Italian dinner from 7:45 - 8:45 !! Coffee and dessert will also be served at approximately 10 PM.

The Paramus Elks Club is located on Route 17 North in the back parking lot, behind Paramus Chevrolet and Raymoor and Flanagan. (after the giant American flag) If you are driving north on Route 17, once you pass Century Road, Paramus Chevrolet is about a 1/2 mile on your right.

Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

VIDEO LINK : http://www.youtube.com/user/sbsdancefusion/videos?shelf_id=1&view=0&sort=p

What is Kizomba – The Origin

Kizomba is a breath whose rhythm is a beating heart, and where the perfect connection between two dancers gives birth to harmony, exaltation of senses and sensuality" D. Campos

Kizomba (a word meaning "Party" in angola ) takes its origin from the Angolan dance Semba, which is also the origin of the Brazilian Samba.
It appeared at the end of 70’s – 80’s, while the young Angolans, although very attached to their traditional dance,sought a new musical identity, and finally found their inspiration and new voice at a concert given by Kassav, a famous French Caribbean Zouk band. Kizomba was born out of this new generation’s desire to bring a touch of sensuality and sweetness to their national Semba.
The influence of the Angolan Kizomba soon spread to all the African Lusophone countries such as Guinea Bisau, Cape Verde, Mozambique. From there the dance quickly found its ticket to Europe via Portugal, where it further developed, by all these Artists, teachers, choregraphers coming from these Luso-African countries.
As it rapidly gained popularity, Portugal exported Kizomba to various countries in Europe such as France, Spain, Poland, Belgium, Danemark and England. 
Today it is rare to find a Latin dance party without Kizomba represented, as well as salsa or bachata.
This "African Tango Zouk", also called "Tango Lusophone" continues to conquer a growing audience of passionate dancers, eager for beauty of gesture and sensuality, but also the indispensable complexity of exchange and trust present in each motions of Kizomba.
This young dance of barely thirty years is booming today, and constantly evolving.
"Kizomba is a tribute to sensuality, an ode to love and sharing. A moment when the woman's beauty, enhanced by her partner, must embody all its essence. " D. Campos
Be the pioneers here in the U.S. of a dance that will become soon a must for your dancing nightlife !!

results.description:
Apologies for taking this long to announce the next selection.  I had planned out the next several months, carefully ordering the picks.  And then I lost the paper I wrote it on.

That said, we have one for October if members would still like to meet.  THE GIRL IN THE ROAD tells the story of two women from different time periods who set out on quests across forbidding landscapes. In India in the latter half of the twenty-first century, Meena survives what she believes is an assassination attempt after discovering a snake in her bed. Fleeing this threat to her life, she decides to track down the woman responsible for the death of her parents more than a quarter-of-a-century ago in Ethiopia. Meena knows her journey won’t be an easy one. She intends to travel along the Trail, a bridge used to harness energy that runs across the Arabian Sea. Years before Meena sets out on her journey, ten-year-old Mariama smuggles herself aboard a truck bound for Ethiopia. The drivers take pity on her and allow her to accompany them, but it is Yemaya, a mysterious, beautiful passenger they pick up along the way, who captures Mariama’s attention and heart. More than a few surprises await Meena and Mariama and the reader as story lines converge in a surprising, gratifying climax.

“It’s transfixing to watch Monica Byrne become a major player in sci-fi with her debut novel: so sharp, so focused and so human. Beautifully drawn people in a future that feels so close you can touch it, blended with the lush language and concerns of myth. It builds a bridge from past to future, from East to West. Glorious stuff.”  —Neil Gaiman, author of The Ocean at the End of the Lane

results.description:
Dear holistic friend:

There are now over 1800 members in my two Meet Ups, Holistic Living on LI and Wellness and Entrepreneurs Exchange! Imagine if each of you were assisting the others and vice versa, to grow strong, prosperous practices/businesses through referrals and support.

This is my dream. Let's make this a reality!!

How? Join us at our LIVE events!


I am very excited to present the final course outline for our Oct and Nov. Port Washington Adult Ed course,

How to Keep Body, Mind and Spirit Optimally Healthy! Our presenters and topics are truly wonderful!

Please make sure to register by this Friday, October 23rd! Simply click on this link: https://portwashingto...­


Then click on Adult Enrichment, then Health and Wellness! Contact me at [masked]­ with any questions. Bring friends and relatives!

Great networking opportunity and great way to explore career options in this truly fascinating and cutting-edge field of health. Only 60 dollars plus nominal fee if not a Port Washington resident!!

COURSE DESCRIPTION:How to Keep Body, Mind and Spirit Optimally Healthy

Thursdays, October 29, Nov. 5, Nov. 12 and Nov. 19

Erika Stroh, Parent Life Coach, Educational Consultant, Speaker,

Founder of Parent From The Heart

“How to Engage in Healthy and Conscious Communication”

Did you know that even the briefest interactions affect your relationships, productivity, health and longevity?  These interactions can either be positive or negative. I'll be sharing various ways to communicate in order to create more positive interactions at home and at work.  This will include the impact of verbal and nonverbal language, tone, eye contact, directness, consciousness and more.  We'll also discuss the importance of becoming more aware of our own emotions and the triggers that sometimes cause us to overreact or communicate ineffectively.  This course will leave you feeling more empowered, enlightened and encouraged to communicate with consciousness, compassion and care.  Ideal for parents and leaders in business!
======================================­=====================
Susan Dembo, M.A., M.S., L.Ac., Dipl. (NCCAOM)

Board Certified and Licensed Acupuncturist

“Acupuncture is for Everyone!!”

Come and learn about acupuncture and have your questions answered.  I will explain the benefits of acupuncture and the numerous conditions that it can treat.  I'll talk about Qi (energy), balance, yin and yang, and the pivotal role that emotions play in Chinese Medicine.  Learn what happens during a treatment and see a a demonstration of a short treatment.  Acupuncture involves more than just needles and I'll talk about cupping, gua sha, and moxa.

======================================­­=====================

John Maniec, M.P.A. (Health concentration)
Green, Health & Wellness Entrepreneur

“Learn How to Detoxify Your Home for Optimal Wellness”

Green is no longer just a color but in today’s “information-filled” world,

Green has become more of a life style and a goal of Americans who want to live

longer, healthier lives.

There are natural alternatives to the toxic, synthetic chemicals that we

inhale and absorb each and every day. To safeguard the health of your loved

ones, this evening’s wealth of information will open your eyes and help you

make better informed purchasing decisions in the years to come.

Those attending this course on “detoxing their homes” will leave at the

end of the evening with a wealth of practical and useful knowledge that they

can immediately put to use in improving the lives and health of their families.
======================================­­========­================
Irina Gubenko, Certified Aromatherapy Consultant

"Living A Life of Vibrancy and,Purity with Essential Oils"

Vibrant Living With Young Living Essential Oil- In this class we will explore many therapeutic benefits of Young Living Essential oils and how they interact with our health and emotions. We will sample some most popular aromas while discovering easy ways of integrating these nature's wonders into their daily lifestyles for better health, vitality, and joy. Participants will walk away with simple hands-on Do Your Own recipes for natural household products which promise to improve their physical, mental, emotional and spiritual well-being.

======================================­===========================

Robin Schnee, Graduate of the Institute of Integrative Nutrition, NYC, Certified Health Coach

“Roadmap to Wellness!”

By learning simple, mindful changes, we can take control of our health, become educated consumers and achieve more balance in our lives.

Robin will discuss: important lifestyle changes to improve health, GMO's, the dangers of fast food, which foods to eat to increase energy (hint: whole foods), hidden sugars, deceptive advertising, eating seasonally, etc.

======================================­============================

Sakina Hajee, Certified Holistic Nutritionist, Registered Holistic Allergist, Pilates Instructor, BioEnergetics Energy Healing

“Finding Balance In All The Stress!”

How often do you feel overwhelmed by stress? Did you know that the stress you take on has a way of manifesting itself as a physical and emotional imbalance in your body. This session we will discuss a variety of techniques such as diet, meditation, crystals and BioEnergetics (a non-invasive modality which helps  to alleviate and restore balance by looking at vitamin/mineral absorption, hormones, food intolerances, emotions and much more) that can help you keep your balance.

======================================­===========================

Dawn Riccardi Morris, Certified Health Coach & Educator

“How to Decode Food Labels Quickly & Easily”

Are you frustrated by conflicting nutrition information and confusing food labels? Do you need to avoid common food additives and/or allergens, for health reasons?

Join us, as we take a close look at some popular products, and decide which ones to add to your shopping cart, and which ones to put back on the shelf. Once you know exactly what to look for on any food label, making healthy choices as easy as 1-2-3! You will leave confident in your ability to navigate any supermarket shelf with ease.


Dawn Riccardi Morris is a CPA turned Health Coach. She went from auditing balance sheets to scrutinizing food labels when her daughter was diagnosed with a severe food allergy, gluten sensitivity, and an autoimmune disease. While she's seen food allergen labeling improve over the past 20 years, Dawn's also seen a significant deterioration in the quality of ingredients used by food manufacturers. As a result, her mission is to empower individuals and families to make informed food & lifestyle choices so they can support a healthier Self, family, and planet. You can find out more about Dawn at her web site, www.TransformedByFood.com­.

======================================­===========================

Lynn Goldstein, LCSW-R, BKP, R.HY

Marianne LiBretto, B.S., M.A., L.M.H.C.

“Havening: "Getting Past Your Past"

-Learn about this unique Psychosensory technique that helps individuals release traumatic memories, fears, phobias, and anxiety.

-This technique is also beneficial for overcoming sabotaging behaviors and for performance enhancement.

-In some cases, clients have reported reduction of pain, anger, cravings, emotional eating, and PTSD.

-This presentation will explain the neuroscience behind this amazing technique.

-This is a technique that individuals can learn to do on themselves, and is a great complementary technique that healthcare professionals and wellness practitioners can integrate into their practice (This presentation is for information purposes only).

======================================­=============================

Join us to become much more enlightened on the referenced  holistic health topics/modalities, to expore career opportunities in this fascinating and important field, to network amoungst peers, to find new like-minded friends, to enjoy!

Feel free to contact me, Carol with any questions at [masked]­­ or at [masked] 8270[/url]. Let me know if you wish to present in future holistic courses.


Thanks very much for registering by this Friday, October 23 to assure your spot in this comprehensive, great course!

All the best,

Carol Leitner

results.description:
Introducing our new Meetup! No need to prep for this one. Just bring up to 1,500 words of writing—a flash piece or an excerpt from a longer piece you are working on or the outline of an idea that you need help with. People are encouraged to bring work generated through Writing Room exercises.

The format works like this:

Each writer gets a total of up to 30 minutes, which begins when they read their piece aloud or give a pitch of their idea in five minutes or less. We will be able to do 4 or 5 pieces/ideas per meeting. Names will be drawn at random. (Anyone whose work is not chosen will get priority at the next meeting.) You don’t need to bring work to attend and no advance preparation is required.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

Are you frustrated by conflicting nutrition information and confusing food labels? Do you need to avoid common food additives and/or allergens, for health reasons?

Join us, as we take a close look at some popular products, and decide which ones to add to your shopping cart, and which ones to put back on the shelf. Once you know exactly what to look for on any food label, making healthy choices as easy as 1-2-3! You will leave confident in your ability to navigate any supermarket shelf with ease.


Dawn Riccardi Morris is a CPA turned Health Coach. She went from auditing balance sheets to scrutinizing food labels when her daughter was diagnosed with a severe food allergy, gluten sensitivity, and an autoimmune disease. While she's seen food allergen labeling improve over the past 20 years, Dawn's also seen a significant deterioration in the quality of ingredients used by food manufacturers. As a result, her mission is to empower individuals and families to make informed food & lifestyle choices so they can support a healthier Self, family, and planet. You can find out more about Dawn at her web site, www.TransformedByFood.com­.

======================================­===========================

Lynn Goldstein, LCSW-R, BKP, R.HY

Marianne LiBretto, B.S., M.A., L.M.H.C.

“Havening: "Getting Past Your Past"

-Learn about this unique Psychosensory technique that helps individuals release traumatic memories, fears, phobias, and anxiety.

-This technique is also beneficial for overcoming sabotaging behaviors and for performance enhancement.

-In some cases, clients have reported reduction of pain, anger, cravings, emotional eating, and PTSD.

-This presentation will explain the neuroscience behind this amazing technique.

-This is a technique that individuals can learn to do on themselves, and is a great complementary technique that healthcare professionals and wellness practitioners can integrate into their practice (This presentation is for information purposes only).

======================================­=============================

Join us to become much more enlightened on the referenced  holistic health topics/modalities, to expore career opportunities in this fascinating and important field, to network amoungst peers, to find new like-minded friends, to enjoy!

Feel free to contact me, Carol with any questions at [masked]­­ or at [masked] 8270[/url]. Let me know if you wish to present in future holistic courses.


Thanks very much for registering by this Friday, October 23 to assure your spot in this comprehensive, great course!

All the best,

Carol Leitner

An Open Invitation from party Host, Jerry D.

I want to invite you to our Annual Halloween Dinner Dance Party, which has been our biggest and best event every year !! As usual, we will award at least 7 prizes for the best or most creative costumes !! However, feel free to come as you are or with just a little Halloween flavor.

We have done a couple of things differently this year, to keep the cost down and to enable people who don't drink alcohol to attend without paying for the people who do drink. In other words, we will have a "cash bar" rather than the "open bar" that has been part of our Halloween celebrations of the past. Also, in order for people to attend a variety of events during the Halloween weekend, we are having our party on Thursday. In order to achieve the lower price structure, we will have a "House Party Away From Home".

As usual, my sister and her family will cook and serve an authentic, home-made Italian dinner from 7:45 - 8:45 !! Coffee and dessert will also be served at approximately 10 PM.

 Admission at the door ... $ 20. 

The Paramus Elks Club is located on Route 17 North in the back parking lot, behind Paramus Chevrolet and Raymoor and Flanagan. (after the giant American flag) If you are driving north on Route 17, once you pass Century Road, Paramus Chevrolet is about a 1/2 mile on your right.

More information, call Ralph[masked]

results.description:
You've joined our group because you've discovered you are an Empath, or because you know you're a highly sensitive person (HSP), or because you are an extremely caring and helpful person with no one who will do the same for you.

Let's talk about what it means to be an Empath or a highly sensitive person (HSP), what your gifts and talents may be, and how to use them. There's also a dark side... let's talk about our struggles as Empaths and HSPs.

Please arrive on time at 7:30 PM so we can order our food and begin our discussion at 8:30 PM. We will wrap it up at around 9:30 PM so everyone can get home by 10 PM.

Please be prepared to pay for dinner and drinks. We would also like to ask that you donate $2 to help pay for our costs. We appreciate any contribution you can make... but it's not required.

We look forward to seeing you there!
results.name: Let's Talk About the Gifts of Being an Empath

results.description:
Welcome to Speak and Lead's 4th Annual All Hallows Speak! It's a Halloween themed meeting! We encourage you to attend in costume! Come and have a good time and see the ultra fun side of Toastmasters. From spooky presentations to hilarious memories, this will be evening you don't want to miss! Please inquire for the address, as the meeting will be taking place at one of our member's home.

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation (OM) community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. The event is free! The door will open at 7:30 sharp and we will go until about 9:30. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time! If you have any questions please contact Marissa Ward -[masked] / [masked]
results.name: OM Community Potluck! Open For All!

results.description:
Featuring:
Glendaliz Camacho
Stephanie Rudolph
Michael Carroll
Liana Segan

How To Build A Fire is a storytelling series set within the visually surprising, kinetic, and energized space of Open Source Gallery. The series is the brainchild of the poet Terence Degnan, who for a year, curated and hosted countless storytellers from all walks of life while inviting guest curators along the way to help to diversify the voices. He has passed on the curatorial and hosting duties to his friends and colleagues Kate Hill Cantrill and Dennis Norris and they intend to maintain the spontaneous mix of characters, themes, ideas, while opening up the series to include musical, visual, and other creative ways of enhancing the art of telling a story. This month, storytellers have been invited to interpret the theme "The Art of Losing" however they choose.
results.name: How to Build a Fire: The Art of Losing

Halloween Party -  Please come in costume. We'll have prizes for scariest and most creative costumes.  

Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots besides myself for this meetup.

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. I am trying sign ups this way so everyone has a chance to attend events. I know I tend to post things late at night and want morning people to also get to come to events.

The Place:

Oiji, a new restaurant in Manhattan’s East Village, is creating a new category for Korean cuisine in New York City: Refined Authentic Korean. Exploring traditional flavors and dishes while utilizing modern cooking techniques and ingredients, artful plating and portion sizes, Oiji offers a Korean dining experience that is at once familiar and surprising, in a modern downtown setting. The intimate but stylish restaurant is accented with an open kitchen, reclaimed wood, exposed brick and ambient lighting with factory sash windows that open out to the bustling streets of downtown Manhattan.

4.5 stars on Yelp and a very good review from the NY Times.



 RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Oiji - Korean

results.description:
“Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counselors there is safety." (Proverbs 11:14, KJV)

Please join us for the Christian Party of America’s Leadership Training Conference Call to discuss issues related to developing leadership abilities and coordinating effective strategies and tactics. The conference call is the fifth Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central).  A fifth Thursday only happens a few times a year so you won’t want to miss it. The Leadership Training call is open to anyone who would like to learn how to improve their leadership skills to help build the Christian Party of America. No commitment is necessary and you do not have to be a member of the Christian Party of America to attend.  The call will be led by two of our outstanding leaders: Clell Drumheller (TX), National Chairman of the Christian Party of America and Don Watson (NC), National Vice Chairman of the Christian Party of America.  Both of them are also the State Chairmen in their respective states, so they'll have a lot of helpful information on reaching out at the local level. So if you would like to learn how to lead in your state, county, city or even your neighborhood or church group, this call should give you useful ideas. Even if you are not sure you are ready to start leading, this is a good way to check out if you might become interested.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

The conference call will last for about an hour and a half, but staying for the entire call is optional. From your home or cell phone dial the number and then at the prompt enter the access code to participate. If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can even listen in to the conference call while at other events...just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once!
results.name: Christian Party of America’s Leadership Training Conference Call

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias
