results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

results.description:
PLEASE CLICK HERE TO RSVP ON THE EVENT SITE. 


Join us for Pilot Projects' Wood at Work: Elegant Strategies for Architecture, City-Building, and Forest Conservation! 

The Conference
This international, interdisciplinary, and intimate event in New York City will explore the most advanced ideas, theories, and practices around wood use and forest conservation and management, and investigate the role of wood in construction, the global environment, and climate discourse. 


Why Wood?
As tension mounts between our global population and natural environment, nothing is more important to our future than how we use our material and energy resources. Decision makers have a choice between business as usual, or innovative solutions that look to synergies between humans and nature. Wood is claimed to be the only truly renewable building material, simultaneously capturing carbon and conserving biodiversity as it grows. Its potential is enormous, but it is often misunderstood.
So: is wood good? What are the environmental, social, and cultural benefits—or pitfalls—of using wood for public and private construction projects? How can we maximize its potential as construction material, conservation tool, and cultural building block? 


Speakers + Participants
Wood at Work will feature a lineup of 20 influential conservationists, foresters, industry innovators, policymakers, architects, and urban planners, including Robin Chazdon, author of Second Growth: The Promise of Tropical Forest Regeneration in an Age of Deforestation; renowned architectural historian Kenneth Frampton; World Resources Institute’s Lars Laestadius; and award-winning writer John Vaillant, as well as a lineup of artists, musicians, and craftsmen. All 120 conference participants will be invited to join in discussions as well as in hands-on breakout activities such as urban tree identification, Japanese sawing demonstrations, and literary talks celebrating trees and wood. 


The Venue
The conference will be held at the Wildlife Conservation Society’s world-famous Bronx Zoo, in the Schiff Family Great Hall. The Bronx Zoo is the largest metropolitan zoo in the nation, covering 265 acres of park land and naturalistic habitats through which the Bronx River flows. Manhattan events will include an urban natural areas tour and cocktail reception on Thursday evening for all participants, and dinner on Friday evening for speakers and VIPs.

Ticket Costs:
Conference Ticket: $100
Student Ticket: $50

Please email [masked] if you have any questions.
results.name: Wood at Work 2015

results.description:
Hello Friend
This week we are delighted to have Logan Cohen of Küdzoo.

Logan is a co-founder and co-CEO to Küdzoo, a free mobile application that rewards students for their academic achievements.  Küdzoo has amassed over 275k users since its official launch in August 2015. Logan focuses on balancing fundraising along with user acquisition and company growth.

In addition to the corporate responsibilities of  Küdzoo, Logan has focused on what inspired her to initially start  Küdzoo – a passion for business and innovation. She teaches high school freshman and sophomores a course on entrepreneurship at Science Leadership Academy in West Philadelphia.  

Logan was named a fellow of Camelback Ventures, an organization that selects a handful of entrepreneurs from across the nation who are making a societal impact. Logan sits on the board of The Foundation at Great Valley, the nonprofit of her alma mater high school and is a contributor for the Huffington Post, Purpose + Profit division.

Logan received dual degrees in Finance (Beta Alpha Psi Honors) and International Business and a certificate in international bank management from Florida International University

We'll get a chance to hear about her journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!

In Good Company

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!

results.description:
Dear Friends,
JOIN OUR DIVESTMENT RALLY!
What's scarier than Halloween? Climate change. What can we do about it? Keep fossil fuels in the ground. Please join 350NYC and 350Brooklyn's pre-Halloween rally in front of the offices of City Comptroller Scott Stringer -
One Center Street, NYC -at noon on Friday, October 30. Mayor de Blasio has come out in favor of divesting coal stocks from the $160 billion city pension funds, and for studying the divestment of oil and gas. Stringer's response has been lukewarm. But as we know, the planet just keeps heating up. We need to raise the heat on all of the trustees of the city pension funds, including the mayor and the comptroller. We'll do that with banners, songs, signs, and a short skit. We hope you'll join us and also help spread the word about our pre-Halloween event. And please wear black or a Halloween costume.
Help us keep fossil fuels in the ground!
#FossilFreeNYC Marilyn Vasta
350NYC
[masked]

Mimi Bluestone
350Brooklyn
[masked]
results.name: What's scarier than Halloween? Climate change!

results.description:
On behalf of Mortgage Unlimited and Kean University, I would like to cordially invite you to join us at the “Latinos Moving Forward In America” event at Kean University’s STEM Building, 1075 Morris Avenue, in Union, NJ on Friday, October 30th,[masked]:30AM to 4:30PM

I will be Hosting a Workshop at 1:00 PM Sharp so Please make sure to be on time!  You can attend all other Workshops for Free as well.


This daylong event will be a fantastic and memorable way to build awareness of the past, seeing the present, and visioning the empowerment of future generations of Latino leaders through activism! As we look forward to making this a learning opportunity for all, we do hope that you will be able to accept our invitation.

If you are a Real Estate Professional looking to meet potential buyers, investors and new business connections this is the event for you. Contact me for more information!

This is a FREE Event - Food will be served

I have the honor of Hosting a Workshop during this event “The Home Ownership Empowerment Work Shop” which will feature key points in purchasing a home, qualifying for the purchase and the potential within the mortgage industry. We will be coaching Home Buyers and Investors on what is needed to purchase their home and how to work with Real Estate Agents in finding and selling a home.

Here are just a few of the featured activities at the event:

- Home Ownership - Selling and Buying a Home. How to qualify to buy a home! How to properly market your home for sale and how to find the best real estate agent for the job. Meet Real Estate Agents Ready to Help You Sell or Buy Your Home!
- Influential Latino leaders will come together — seeking dignity and hope for future generations — in an effort to continue this commitment to social justice and empowerment of Latinos throughout America.
- A major panel discussion, led by Latino leaders and elected officials, two dynamic keynote speakers, and workshops consisting of economic empowerment/opportunities, civil/human rights, and political/social activism.

Key Speakers:

- Senator Raymond J. Lesniak
- Mortgage Unlimited, Hector J Alvarez
- President of Garcorp International, Gus Garcia
- Publisher & CEO of El Especialito, Tony Ibarria
- Mayor of Passaic, Alex D. Blanco
- Republican Chairman, Jose Arango
- Union County Freeholder, Angel G. Estrada
- Hudson County Freeholder, Junior E. Maldonado
- Former NJ Gubernatorial Candidate, Dr. Hector Castillo Altogether, this event will serve to energize future generations and thank those who had the vision 40 years ago in advocating for Latinos through advocacy, empowerment and community.

To RSVP please feel free to email me at [masked]

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

We look forward in seeing you there!
results.name: Today is The Day! Home Ownership Workshop at Kean University!

results.description:
We'll be kicking off the Hoboken Pluralsight study group with a viewing of Kit Eason's F# Functional Data Structures class. We have 1.5 hours scheduled and will be able to make it through the first two modules -- the exact modules are listed below, if you want to watch on your own time and catch up with us for the next meeting! We'll have some discussion afterwards, to make sure the concepts are solidified. Looking forward to this! 

Description: F# Functional Data Structures

This course describes the important data structures - especially collections - available in F#, together with the functions which F# provides for working with them.

About Kit

Kit is a senior software developer for an energy trading systems provider. He has also developed software for automotive engineering companies, universities, energy suppliers, banks, and financial services companies. Kit has run many educational and training courses, including evening classes, women's electronics classes and CNC training for engineers. Kit is a regular speaker at SkillsMatter in London, and at various conferences and meetups. He works mainly in F# and C# and normally speaks on F# and related matters.

Introduction 13:15

Why Functional Data Structures Matter  1:57

What Is a Functional Data Structure?  1:45

Prerequisites: F# Interactive (FSI)  1:40

Prerequisites: The let Keyword  2:20

Prerequisites: The Forward Pipe Operator |>  1:45

Prerequisites: Tuples  1:13

Prerequisites: Records  1:30

Summary  1:01

Arrays 41:49

Introduction  1:18

Creating an Array  6:56

Accessing Array Elements  2:33

The Array Module  1:47

Array.map  3:23

Array.mapi  2:07

Array.iter and Array.filter  3:42

Option Data Type and Array.choose  3:27

Array.sum, Array.sumBy, Array.sort, and Array.sortBy  4:00

Array.reduce  4:04

Array.fold  2:43

Array.zip  2:27

Multi-Dimensional and Jagged Arrays  2:12

Summary  1:02
results.how_to_find_us: Enter from the River St. entrance, and security will send you up. We're on the 8th floor. Once you get in the office, reception will guide you to the room.
results.name: Kit Eason's F# Data Structures class, part 1

results.description:
Come join us for the changing of the seasons at the beautiful Ramapo Mt. State Forest Park! Enjoy expansive veiws, of the NYC skyline, The Ramapo River,   remains of The Majestic Foxcroft Mansion, Ramapo Lake, tranquil streams, whispering waterfalls and lots of rock outcroppings perfect for breaks to take it all in! 

 PARKING IS LIMITED SO ITS A PERFECT HIKE FOR A WEEKDAY. Carpooling is always helpful. THE PARKING LOT HAS BEEN REDONE! NO MORE DEEP RUTS!

THIS IS A MODERATELY CHALLENGING  HIKE on woods trails  with some rocky areas one OF WHICH is FAIRLY STEEP. THERE IS ALSO A POSSIBLE STREAM CROSSING, SO HIKING BOOTS, OR HIKING SHOES ARE RECOMMENDED AS ARE WALKING STICKS. There is also a rock wall at the top of the trail going up to the ruins with PILED rocks below to help you climb over.  NOT FOR BEGINNERS.

THIS WILL BE About a 2 1/2 HOUR HIKE (GUESS-TIMATE UNDER 3 MILES) WHICH INCLUDES BREAKS. WE WILL BE TAKING THE BLUE TRAIL TO THE WHITE CASTLE TRAIL(SORRY NO BURGERS!) lol BACK TO THE BLUE and retrace our steps back. 

BRING WATER, SNACKS, Bugspray AND CAMERAS OF COURSE! DON'T FORGET TO DRESS IN LAYERS FOR THE WEATHER CAN CHANGE QUICKLY NOW AS THE DAYS grow SHORTER. 

INCLEMENT WEATHER CANCELS, SO ALWAYS CHECK THE DAY OF AN EVENT FOR ANY CHANGES. AS WITH ALL OF OUR EVENTS YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY AND WE CANNOT BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY INJURIES YOU MAY SUSTAIN. 

DIRECTIONS: from rockland 287 west to exit for 287 South and  17S. Stay on 287 South to  EXIT 57 SKYLINE RD., GO NORTH A VERY SHORT DISTANCE ON SKYLINE RD, BROWN SIGN FOR PARK WILL QUICKLY BE ON YOUR LEFT WHERE YOU WILL TURN IN. 

(additional directions provided by one of our Jerseyites for you guys coming from the other direction! : from Route 4, take 208 N and go to 287 S to Skyline Drive - the parking lot is VERY soon on your left.

 THERE IS ALSO AN UPPER LOT AT THE PARK, (a little further up the road on your left if the lower lot is full) that WE CAN UTILIZE FOR SHUTTLING IF NECESSARY.  HOPE TO SEE YOU THERE!!!
results.how_to_find_us: LOWER LOT AT 1
results.name: FRIDAY AUTUMN  HIKE AT THE RAMAPO MT. STATE FOREST PARK!

results.description:
On Friday October[masked] Columbia University's School of International and Public Affairs will present a lunchtime panel The High Politics of Internet Governance: Global Policy Conflicts a Decade after the World Summit on the Information Society. On December 15-16 in New York, the United Nations is convening a General Assembly High-Level Meeting to review the goals of the World Summit on the Information Society after a decade (WSIS+10) and to craft a future vision for the information society. Input from various stakeholders has raised questions about the future of the Internet and who will run it. This Columbia SIPA panel will explain the implications of this dialog for Internet sustainability, security, and freedom, and how this high-level discussion connects to the planned transition of U.S. oversight in Internet governance. Moderator: Merit Janow, Dean, School of International and Public Affairs (SIPA), Columbia University. Panel: Laura DeNardis, Professor, American University, and Senior Research Scholar, Columbia SIPA; Gordon Goldstein, Managing Director and Head of External Affairs, Silver Lake Group; Ambassador David Gross, Partner, Wiley Rein; Veni Markovski, Vice President, ICANN; Ambassador Janis Mazeiks, Ambassador, Permanent Mission of the Republic of Latvia to the United Nations. The event will be webcast live via the Columbia SIPA Livestream Channel.

What: The High Politics of Internet Governance: Global Policy Conflicts a Decade after the World Summit on the Information Society
Where: School of International and Public Affairs, NYC
When: Friday October[masked]pm-2pm EDT | 17:00-18:00 UTC
Webcast: http://livestream.com/sipa/events/4458501
Twitter: @ColumbiaSIPA | #WSIS10
results.name: WSIS+10 PANEL at Columbia SIPA

WordCamp NYC 2015 is in our front yard at the Brooklyn Marriott Hotel.

Let's show up and represent Brooklyn!

Three days of WordPress learning and fun.  You’re in for an exciting weekend of WordPress goodness!


Tickets are $40, which is a bargain!

With each ticket you receive:

• Admission to WordCamp NYC 2015


• WordCamp NYC t-shirt

• Lunch on Saturday afternoon

Where else can you get the full-on experience of a three-day WordCamp... plus lunch and a t-shirt for that price?


You can also volunteer to help out. I already have!

DO NOT wait to register. Tickets ran out early last year... then they sold privately at premium prices.


Register now, https://nyc.wordcamp.org/2015/tickets/


See you at WordCamp NYC 2015!

Best,

D.K.

****We have reserved 10 Rooms in our Block. They can be any combination of Single or Doubles, so if you wish to room with someone, be sure to click on the link below for a Double Room (choose the Single link if you want your own room). If we have enough interest and deposits, we will expand our room block, but for now, we are only holding 10 rooms, so be sure to rsvp and make your payments before the deadline dates listed below****

**Also, Airfare is NOT included, in the Group Rates. For the lowest airfares, I suggest checking out fly.com.**


**UPDATE (Airport Transfer): We have arranged a Group Airport Transfer  for $25 (USD) roundtrip between the Airport and the Resort. Our tentative time will be leaving the airport for the Resort @ 3pm, but we can have a car waiting for you at the same rate if you plan on arriving earlier or later!***

**Also, FINANCING is available as an option as well for all of our NYBL Meetup trips. Scroll below for details!!!**


****************************************************************


You are invited to join us for a fun Tropical Halloween Weekend in beautiful Punta Cana, in the Dominican Republic! Halloween is a huge celebration in DR, and we have picked a beautiful resort to celebrate, Ocean Blue & Sands!

Room Rates (Total for the weekend, taxes included)


Junior Suite Double Room: $230 per person


Junior Suite Single Room: $ 320

**Note, the rate is All Inclusive, for lodging, meals, drinks (including alcohol) and basic resort entertainment and taxes are all included in the rate**

Payment Schedule (Click on the links below to make your deposits via Paypal).

1st Deposit: $75 due 3/13

2nd Deposit: $75 due 3/30

Remaining Balance: Due 4/30 (Double Room)

Remaining Balance: Due 4/30 (Single Room)

Full Payment Options

Paypal Credit: Choose Paypal Credit at checkout for one of the links below. If you are approved (in seconds), your order for your Hotel Slot will be paid in full immediately and you will have up to 6 months to repay (details will be emailed to you directly by Paypal).

Pay In Advance: Instead of choosing Paypal Credit, just choose Credit or Debit Card or Prepaid Card at checkout to complete your order. If you already have a Paypal account (or create a new one) and have your checking account attached to it, you can make your payment via an e-check from your checking account as well).


Full Payment Link: Junior Suite Double Room: $230 per person

Full Payment Link: Junior Suite Single Room: $ 320

***Note, all payments are NON REFUNDABLE, so be sure you are able to attend the group trip. ****

In addition to our All Inclusive benefits we will receive:

• Personal coordinator

• Private check in

• Welcome with: Cocktail / Wet refreshing towels

• Free games at the bowling alley

• Reserved area for our Meetup Group at the buffet restaurant

In addition to the many beach and entertainment activities we will have to choose from, we will of course be celebrating the Halloween Weekend both at the on site Disco and the Casino as well!

We hope you can join us for this special Tropical Halloween Weekend in the Dominican Republic! Be sure to RSVP and make your deposit today! :)

results.description:
an exhibition dedicated to Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, the Postimpressionist famous for empathetic scenes of Paris brothels and nightclubs. “

The Paris of Toulouse-Lautrec: Prints and Posters

” pulls from the museum’s collection of over 100 posters, lithographs, and illustrated books and marks the museum’s first Lautrec solo exhibition in 30 years. Highlights include his characteristic depictions of the Moulin Rouge and its performers, and his “Elles” portfolio of brothel workers in quiet, everyday moments.
results.name: Museum

results.description:
Image taken by Malcolm Kahn

   Image taken by Martin Joffe

  Image taken by Malcolm Kahn

You might be able to capture images like the above images but you'll have to go to DUMBO to stand a chance.

Join AIP on Friday, October 30th, 2015 when Malcolm Kahn and Martin Joffe lead a group of AIP photographers to DUMBO for a late afternoon/evening photo shoot at DUMBO (Down Under the Manhattan Bridge Overpass).

We will meet at DUMBO at 4:00 p.m. and take some test images. We'll then get into position for a 5:56 p.m. sunset photo shoot.

We'll continue to shoot until around 8:00 p.m. changing positions to get a variety of images.

The logistics of this photo shoot require that we car pool from New York/New Jersey to Brooklyn. To that end, we'll set up two car pool locations, one in Fort Lee and the other at Unique Photo in Fairfield, N.J. (Unique Photo will allow AIP members to use their parking lot.) We'll drive into Brooklyn and park in private parking lots adjacent to our shooting sites. Car pooling will allow us to share transportation expenses such as gas, tolls and parking. (Tolls and parking could come to, as much as $40.00 per vehicle (that's only $10.00 per person if we car pool with 4 photogs per vehicle. However, we'll be within easy walking distance from our shooting locations.

The following images  are indicative of what you can expect to find at DUMBO.

  Image taken by Malcolm Kahn

  Stylized treatment of image taken by Martin Joffe

Image taken by Martin Joffe


Join us on Friday October 30th and fulfill your vision.

Martin Joffe and Malcolm Kahn, your AIP Organizers
results.name: DUMBO (Down Under the Manhattan & Brooklyn Bridges Overpass) - Photograph from

results.description:
Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Renate, cell[masked]
results.name: Meet and play in Jersey City ( in German language )

Bloody Deviled eggs will set the tone, while Mummy Dogs will give you the energy to scare away vampires! End the party with yummy chocolate cookie feet.

This class will cover:

• Bloody Deviled Eggs

• Mummy Dogs (Hot Dogs)

• Apple Vampire Lips

results.description:
You are invited to the 4th Edition of Albanian Film Week. It will be held on Oct. 30 – Nov. 5 -2015 in New York City.  

Albanian Film Week is the first Albanian film festival in United States, established in 2012 by Mrika Krasniqi. AFW plays a major role in introducing Albanian film to American audiences.

This 4th Edition of the AFW will screen 30 films, including feature, short and documentary films. The finalists are selected from works of Albanian and foreign filmmakers around the world.

RSVP for preferred seating.

See who is going: https://www.facebook.com/events/883681978390886/


Albanian Film Week 2015 will accommodate as part of its 4th Edition a presentation of the culture and traditions of Illyrians, our ancestors.
We are proud to provide to you the possibility to see artistic works and handicrafts with Illyrian motifs that will be exclusively displayed during Albanian Film Week 2015.

These works clearly witness our nation's ancientness and civilization we belong to.

Contact Erin K.,at (978)[masked] or [masked]  for more info if you are interested for travelling from Boston to New York on the weekend of October 30th-November 1st to see the movies. 


Order your tickets asap to secure seats.

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/albanian-film-week-2015-4th-edition-in-new-york-tickets-18493221724

results.description:
A seminar with Sidney N. Nakahodo on his experiences at Singularity University.

In this talk, Sidney will describe his summer experience as a participant at Singularity University's flagship academic program. This year, with support from Google, the organization brought together a group of outstanding social and tech entrepreneurs, designers, and emerging thinkers to discuss ideas and work on projects aimed at impacting 1 billion people over the next 10 years. 


He will focus his presentation on the topic of space, one of SU's Global Grand Challenges. The talk will based on his interaction with leading figures such as Peter Diamandis (Co-Founder of SU and Planetary Resources) and Gregg Mayriniak (X-Prize), as well conversations with Planet Labs, Deep Space Industries, Made-in-Space, Aquila Space, and other upcoming NewSpace companies based in Silicon Valley. 

About the speaker

Sidney Nakao Nakahodo is a co-founder of NewSpace NYC, an open community for the development of private companies commercializing outer-space. He is also a lecturer at Columbia University, where he teaches graduate courses in international and public affairs. Previously he worked at the World Bank headquarters in Washington DC. An international development specialist with economics and engineering backgrounds, he received his education from Columbia, the Kiel Institute for the World Economy (Germany), and the University of S. Paulo (Brazil). In 2015 he was awarded a scholarship from Google to attend Singularity University at NASA Ames Research Center, in Silicon Valley.
results.name: Space & The Singularity Univeristy: The future of outer space commerce

results.description:
UNITED NATIONS ASSOCIATION OF NEW YORK

UNA-NY SCREENING THE ISSUES

P R E S E N T S

THE TRIALS OF SPRING

30 October 2015 | 6:00 PM


ADMISSION

$10 UNA Members 

FREE UNA Student Members

$15 Non-Members and Guests

CLICK HERE to purchase tickets online in advance or make your reservation and pay at the door.

Not a member? Join UNA with a $25 introductory one-year membership and attend most of our events for free or at a discounted rate! Students join UNA for free!

WHERE & WHEN

Dolby 88 Screening Room

1350 Avenue of the Americas

(at West 55th Street)

Lobby Level

New York, NY 10019 

Friday | October 30, 2015

6:00 - 6:15 p.m. |  Registration 

6:15 - 7:30 p.m. |  Film Screening

7:30 - 8:00 p.m. |  Q+A Discussion

Screening begins promptly at 6:15 pm

FilmTalk UNA with Special Guests GINI RETICKER and HEND NAFEA

In a world of revolution,
among those fighting for peace
in a state of war . . .

Do women's voices matter?

THE TRIALS OF SPRING recounts the story of 21-year-old Hend Nafea, who travels from her village to Cairo to add her voice to the hundreds of thousands of Egyptians demanding an end to sixty years of military rule, and is beaten, arrested, and tortured. After her release, she is punished and imprisoned by her family for daring to speak out and shaming their name.

Unbreakable, she sets out in a search for freedom and justice in a country gripped by a dangerous power struggle. Buoyed by the other activists she meets along the way, she forges ahead despite the odds mounting against her.

Hend's story mirrors the trajectory of the Arab Spring—from the ecstasy of newfound courage to the agony of shattered dreams.

Despite crushing setbacks, it is resilience that sustains the hope for reform for Hend and her fellow activists, even during the darkest hours of their struggle for a better Egypt.

"It has been said that the world knows little about its greatest heroes. It knows even less about its heroines," said director Gini Reticker. "With the eruption of the Arab Spring, I watched with enormous curiosity as country after country joined the universal call for bread, freedom and social justice. My past experiences made me curious about the role of women in these extraordinary revolutions. I wasn't surprised to find that they not only participated in the front, but, in many cases, they were pioneers. I wanted to know more about their stories.

"During numerous scouting trips, I met woman after woman who stood in utter contrast to the stereotype of Arab women as oppressed and downtrodden. They challenged widely held assumptions about gender, religion, the veil, and political participation of women in the Arab world. In making TRIALS OF SPRING, I have come to learn that Arab women are more than powerful agents of change in their own communities. In a region gridlocked between religious and military conflict, women do not need saving; women are the saviors. They just might be the best answer to the violent radicalism that plagues the region and inspires fear and prejudice around the world."

Please join us for this exclusive NYC screening of THE TRIALS OF SPRING, which had a sold-out world premiere at the Human Rights Watch Film Festival this summer. It will be followed by a Q+A with two guests: GINI RETICKER, the film's award-winning director and producer, and HEND NAFEA, the young Egyptian woman who is the subject of this exceptional and stirring film.

Gini Reticker has been directing and producing award-winning independent documentary films for over 20 years.

Reticker's first film The Heart of the Matter (1994), a groundbreaking film about women and AIDS, won the Sundance Freedom of Expression Award. She directed Pray the Devil Back to Hell (2008), the inspiring story of Liberian women whose actions helped bring an end to a brutal civil war. It premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival, where it won the Audience Award, and was also a past highlight of our Screening the Issues film-talk series.

She produced the Academy Award-nominated short Asylum (2003) the story of a Ghanaian woman who fled female genital mutilation to seek political asylum in the U.S. That year she also produced A Decade Under the Influence, which looks at the heyday of 1970s filmmakers; it was nominated for an Emmy, and garnered the National Review Board Award for Best Documentary. She received an Emmy for Ladies First (2004), the story of women rebuilding post-genocide Rwanda.

She was a creator and executive producer of the PBS series Women, War & Peace (2011), recipient of the Overseas Press Club's Edward R. Murrow Award as well as The Academy of Television Honors Award.

Reticker has also co-produced or executive-produced such notable films as The Betrayal (Nerakhoon), which was nominated for both an Academy Award and an Independent Spirit Award; 1971, Alias Ruby Blade, Citizen Koch, Hot Girls Wanted, and She's Beautiful When She's Angry.
results.name: Screening: 'THE TRIALS OF SPRING', Fri., 10/30

results.description:
This is our special Halloween edition of BlackLightBall so costumes are encouraged but not required.

 BlackLightBall, it's like regular indoor soccer but under the BlackLights and with music!! This is our Monthly BLB event (usually the 3rd Sat of the Month but for Halloween it's on Fri night) at this location. 

This is a fun laid back social event. You can come later if that fits your schedule better, no problem.  We will have music playing, there will be healthy snacks and drinks, and we will be playing indoor soccer till the sun goes down. Once it's dark enough we will switch over to BlackLightBall for the rest of the evening. You can play as much or little as you like. When you get off the court and you would like to play again just get back into the line. Otherwise if you like, take a break, eat a snack, socialize, and watch others play a game. It's all for fun and to raise funds for Street Soccer USA.

WHITE T-SHIRT or Costume is recommended .  (Shorts, socks, shoes - the more white or fluorescent colors the better)
BRING INDOOR SHOES OR SNEAKERS.
PINNIES WILL BE PROVIDED but sometimes you will be wearing just the white shirt.

Street Soccer USA's unique court with walls and medium sized goals creates a very fast paced and exciting match! 

Rules:


8min games

Fun Play 

No Sliding 

Game restarts from goalie 

Kick-ins.. no throw ins

Corner kicks 

Directions:

By Car - Cross the RFK Bridge and take the I-278 exit towards Randalls Island. Turn right onto Central Rd until it turns into Hell Gate Circle. Turn Right crossing under the RFK Bridge onto Sunken Garden Loop.  Help SEC is across from Fields 90-91.  Use the comments section to arrange carpooling if you like. Typically there is at least a group doing a car pool from the Court Square/Murray Playground area in LIC.

By Bus - Take the M-35 bus which leaves from 125th St and Lexington Ave in front of the Duane Reade. It is the second to last stop on the bus route. 

By Train - Take the 4-5 train to 125th St. Transfer to the M-35 bus.

PS2G promotes clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.


The fee is  $10 via paypal, (includes insurance, permit, security guard) 100% of the proceeds go to Street Soccer USA. Learn more about our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Street Soccer USA is sports for social change. Using our entrepreneurial instinct as well as evidence based practices, we make a measurable difference in the lives of undeserved youth in urban areas and special needs populations, including homeless families, adults, people in recovery, among others.

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game. 


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? Go take jujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.


If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play. 

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers Help USA nor Street Soccer USA are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Halloween Social BlackLightBall Party 6pm - Ward's Island for SSUSA

results.description:
Friends,

Join us for a fun evening this coming Friday, October 30. We will first meet for a night of mingling, drinking and more @ Suite 36.

Later that night we will go to Monarch rooftop. There we will continue the party till 4am. We normally leave the first venue @10:15pm.

Both venues are less than 5 minutes away. Doors for Monarch opens @ 10pm.

Both venues are free for our group members (mention Rory's List to the door person)

Many of our Meetup groups have been invited to this event. Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Feel free to come solo or with your friends.

Contact us if you have further questions.

We look forward in seeing you for a fun weekend.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory

results.description:
Friends,

Join us for a fun evening this coming Friday, October 30. We will first meet for a night of mingling, drinking and more @ Suite 36.

Later that night we will go to Monarch rooftop. There we will continue the party till 4am. We normally leave the first venue @10:15pm.

Both venues are less than 5 minutes away. Doors for Monarch opens @ 10pm.

Both venues are free for our group members (mention Rory's List to the door person)

Many of our Meetup groups have been invited to this event. Get to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

Feel free to come solo or with your friends.

Contact us if you have further questions.

We look forward in seeing you for a fun weekend.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory

[masked]

Friday Night Social Mixer @ Suite 36! Multi Meetup! Free Admission!

Date: Friday, October 30, 2015

Time: 6pm- 10pm

Venue: Suite 36

16 West 36th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue.

Admission: Everyone free (Mention Rory's List at the door)

Dress Code: Business Casual/Chic (No t-shirts, no tank tops, no flip flops, no sneakers. no large bags)

Subway: TAKE 1,2,3,N,Q,R, B and D train to 34th Street.

  AFTER PARTY @ MONARCH NY! DRINKS, MUSIC & MORE! NO COVER! RORY'S LIST!

Date: Friday, October 30, 2015

Time: 10:15pm- 4am

Venue: Monarch Rooftop Lounge

71 West 35th Street between 5th and 6th Avenue.

Admission: Gents free before midnight. Ladies free before 1am. (Mention Rory's List to the door person)

Dress Code: Business Casual/Chic (No t-shirts, no tank tops, no flip flops, no sneakers. no large bags)

Subway: TAKE 1,2,3,N,Q,R, B and D train to 34th Street.

results.name: Friday Night Social Mixer Followed By After Party! Multi Meetup! Free Admission!

results.description:
Hello Everyone:

We have many events each year but none rival our annual Halloween extravaganza! Drawing a crowd of over 500 creatures of the night, it is a party not to be missed.

Below is a terrifying glimpse at Halloween's past:

Halloween 2014!

Halloween 2013!

Halloween 2012!

Halloween 2011!

Halloween 2010!

Halloween 2009!

Halloween 2008!

Halloween 2007!

Halloween 2006!

Now for this year's event!

THE DATE: Friday, October 30st

THE TIME: 6:00 until...

THE LOCATION:


***230 FIFTH's exclusive Fifth Avenue Empire Room*** 

230 FIFTH (west side of Fifth Avenue between 26th & 27th Streets)

230 FIFTH.com

Admission: FREE!!


This event will include:

A costume contest with valuable prizes!

Two 1st Prizes: * The top man's & woman's costume will each win a 5 day 4 night hotel stay for 2 in your choice of 2 Cancun resorts!  

***To win at least one of the parties going must be over 25 years of age!


(Cancun Gift Cards are courtesy of Creative Group LLC.)

</a> * DJ Vinnie Campisi terrorizing you with all your favorite tunes!


*Drink specials including $6 wine & $8 well drinks!


*Classic horror films shown all party long on the big screen!

Lots of other surprises!

This will make for the Halloween event of the year, something you'll have to see to believe!

For More Info: <a href="mailto:[masked]">[masked]

OR call/text[masked]


This will be one of the year's best events. Don't DARE miss it!
results.name: Our 10th Annual Halloween Bash @ 230 Fifth: Drink Specials, Free Admission!

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

FALL IS HERE! Learn healthy seasonal recipes that are inspired for a healthy scrumptious thanksgiving. Taste never has to suffer when you are cooking, Charles will teach you how! Get inspired to reclaim your vitality with help from Charles Chen! Having lost over 100 pounds by making healthier choices, Chef Charles will demonstrate how to create scrumptious dishes that will take your taste buds on an adventure. You’ll learn about alternatives for pasta, dairy and coffee; how to alkalize your body; top anti-inflammatory foods; “superfoods,” and more. Join us to explore how delicious and energizing gluten-free vegan food can be.

results.description:
This event is hosted by Date Walking - The Easiest Way to Meet Someone Special.  


Join a bunch of singles from multiple Meetup groups for a Singles Pizza Crawl. 

What is this Date Walking I keep hearing about? See the answer here: http://datewalking.nyc 

What is a pizza crawl and how does it work? It goes like this: We will be visiting 3 award-winning pizza places within a relatively short walking distance from each other that serve slices. We will consume a slice and then head to the next place to consume another slice and so on. When we have completed our pizza-eating crawl we can move onto more important matters, like drinking.


For those of you who can't or don't want to eat 3 slices, I have a solution: You can buddy up with someone and split slices so by the end of the crawl you will only have eaten 1 and a half slices. Problem solved. 

We will meet at 6 PM at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch and get to know each other for 30 minutes. Be advised that if you show up even 1 minute late you will miss us.  

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing at the base of the Washington Square Park Arch</a> and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your <a href="http://www.meetup.com/DateWalking/">Date Walk organizer. If you are unsure you can call Beau at[masked] and he will wave you over to where the group is. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter
results.name: Singles Pizza Crawl + Date Walk | Age: 21 to 49

Join us at another edition of Afrojam ShowCase at Mist Harlem on Friday October 30.

AfroJam is a creative platform that thrives on showcasing the musical and poetic artistry of rising and seasoned artists. Performances related to the diaspora or based on any influences are welcome. results.description:
THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT (ALSO A LOT OF SINGLES FROM OUTSIDE OF MEETUP WILL BE ATTENDING). THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS A VERY SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Event runs from 6:30-9:30pm

It's hard to believe it but Halloween is already here! Come on out this Halloween Eve and mingle with over 100 mature singles. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 somethings. That's why we've created this great event filled with more mature singles. Our events have been called "The Best Place To Meet Quality Singles In NYC".

Costumes are welcomed but are not necessary (based on past similar events we expect about 35% of the crowd to be wearing costumes so with or without a costume, you'll fit right in). We will also have box of masquerade style masks, Halloween hats and other fun Halloween props that you can grab from!

So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.

  We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of early 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. This event is perfect for you! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone.

* Over 200 Single Professionals Attending!


* Drink Specials!


*  Icebreaker With Chances To Win Prizes!


* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling


* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)


* Suggested Age Range: Late 30's to 50's

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
results.name: Halloween Eve Singles Happy Hour - Ages 35-55

So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.

  We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of early 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. This event is perfect for you! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone.

* Over 200 Single Professionals Attending!


* Drink Specials!


*  Icebreaker With Chances To Win Prizes!


* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling


* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)


* Suggested Age Range: Late 30's to 50's

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
Getting honest answers about what's actually in our food isn't always easy. As a result, most of the time we have little information about what's in our food and we often lack the education to be able to actually interpret it. This class covers everything you wanted to know about how to read nutrition labels and make healthier food choices. 

We will walk you though the questions to consider when you are food shopping so that you know you are making healthy choices, rather than just guessing or being influenced by words that sound healthy. 

We will go into depth about: 

- the most important factors to consider when making food choices
- healthy sugars
- how to determine the best juices
- recipes
- what ingredients to stay away from
- what labels are meaningless and which ones to pay attention to 

Contact with any questions. Looking forward to seeing you there!
results.how_to_find_us: We will be meeting by the benches right outside the park
results.name: Decoding Ingredient Lists: What's Your Food Hiding From You?

results.description: What is a Lantern Parade? These last days of October not only bring us Halloween, but also mark the anniversary of Hurricane Sandy, when many of us felt powerless and were literally without power. Neighbors pulled together, sharing electricity and other resources to help each other survive. Resilience Paddle Sports is hosting this year's Hoboken SUP and Kayak Lantern Parade as a first annual, pilot event, meant to serve as a reminder of our community's resilience, to call attention to the need for a more resilient waterfront and to support ongoing youth and community empowerment programs. All proceeds will support the Hoboken Jubilee Center. Bring a "no-flame" lantern if you have one. We'll have some cool, hand-made (of recycled material) lanterns for sale ($5) and we'll have some lights to borrow as well as some treats! $25 is the suggested donation. If that fee doesn't work for you just join us and contribute whatever you are able. Please RSVP!
results.name: Night Paddle with Lantern Parade!

results.description:
Please join a fun group of people who are interested in a diverse mix of strategy, card, and party games.  We play games such as Ticket to Ride, Avalon, Hanabi, Pandemic, Tzolk'in and many others. 

We encourage you to bring your own games; there are always people looking to learn something new, as well as find a new favorite board game.

Mass Transit to this location is available by taking the Q54 bus or by the E-F-M-R train stop at 71st-Continental Ave then to the Q23 bus. 

You can purchase drinks, foods, and snacks, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks.  We want this restaurant to enjoy our presence! 

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us.  Newcomers are always welcome!

If you want to join our board game facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buy/sell games or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:


https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Forest Hills

results.description:
Hey Brooklyn Swing Friends!

SWING DANCE with Dancewave this Friday at our Halloween Themed East Coast Swing Class!

6:30-7:30pm at 182 4th Avenue Brooklyn!

Costumes are welcome!

Want to learn to Swing Dance? Intimidated by the "Pros"? Here's your chance to learn the basics of swing that will get your feet hoppin! Build your swing dance vocabulary each week as we learn a new step every class! Suzie Q, Hammerlock, and Swivel your way to become a pro! East Coast Swing is a fun and easy-to-learn class is not only good exercise, but it's a great way to meet new people and make new friends! Classes are designed for both drop-in students and regular attendees, so even if you can't attend every class, you'll still be able to pick up the moves, have fun and make great progress in your swing technique. No dance partner is necessary, as we will rotate dance partners throughout class. Each month we'll learn a new dance routine so there will always be new material to learn! 


Join us every Friday from 6:30 – 7:30 pm at 182 4th Avenue Brooklyn

For more information about Dancewave’s Swing Class – CLICK HERE!

Questions?  <a>[masked]</a>
results.name: Brooklyn Swing Dance Fall Meetup

results.description:
You know those escape room type games where you have to team up with strangers to solve a puzzle in real time? I found a zombie themed one that's happening next Friday! :D

Here's the event description:

"You and 11 other adventurers will enter a room and are challenged to find the clues, solve the riddles, and get the key to escape.... or get eaten. As the clock dwindles down from 60 to 0, every 5 minutes the hungry zombie's chain gets longer and the danger zone increases. Communication and teamwork are musts if you want to make it out alive."

Tickets and info at this link: https://goo.gl/sIwlOE

Seems like it'd be much more fun with a group! It's an adventure, although quite a unique one. Anyone interested?
results.name: Zombie Escape Game! Want to try?

results.description:
Friday Night Futsal

Please wear futsal/indoor shoes or regular flat bottom sneakers.


$10 for one hour or $15 for two per player!!

NOT ALLOWED:

-Slide Tackles

-Unnecessary Contact

-Unnecessary Trash Talk


We are here to enjoy the game not to argue or fight!


Once you RSVP please show up!!


Please feel free to contact me with any questions you may have :)

**By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit to participate in this game. You voluntarily release NYC Futbol from any and all liability resulting from your participation and/or receipt of instruction.
results.how_to_find_us: The entrance is on the corner of Baltic Street and 4th Avenue in Brooklyn.  Gym is on the 3rd Floor
results.name: Friday Night Futsal

results.description:
If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. No prior reading or experience required to attend. You can leave early as we usually do this every half hour. Gotham Writer's Workshop charges $25 for this. Cost of this meetup? Free.

Jessica

<a>[masked]</a>
results.name: Just Write!

$30 at the door if available

Event runs from 6:30-9:30pm

It's hard to believe it but Halloween is already here! Come on out this Halloween Eve and mingle with over 100 mature singles. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 somethings. That's why we've created this great event filled with more mature singles. Our events have been called "The Best Place To Meet Quality Singles In NYC".

Costumes are welcomed but are not necessary (based on past similar events we expect about 35% of the crowd to be wearing costumes so with or without a costume, you'll fit right in). We will also have box of masquerade style masks, Halloween hats and other fun Halloween props that you can grab from!

So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.

  We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of early 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. This event is perfect for you! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone.

* Over 200 Single Professionals Attending!


* Drink Specials!


*  Icebreaker With Chances To Win Prizes!


* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling


* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)


* Suggested Age Range: Late 30's to 50's

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

results.description:
The way these Stargazer events go (appx every other week) is as follows:


We wait until 10 minutes before lecture starts for members to arrive at meetup location (I'll try to take a picture in four orthogonal directions where I am waiting) 

The location this time is Pupin Hall's Front Entrance Lobby. It is indicated on the map.

The main event is two-part usually:

Part A: We attend a lecture at a +20 row auditorium for between 30-50 minutes. Last Stargazer Meetup many of the seats and most of the good seats were filled at 15 minutes after lecture began. 

Part B: There may be an opportunity to go to Pupin's Roof and Rooftop Observatory. There is an approximately half hour when your position in the line reaches the entrance of the observatory. I believe you are welcome to bring your own telescopes (future foreshadow*). 

We'll wait 30 minutes and then round up anyone interested in a discussion and decide on a place to sit, talk, and eat. 

Last time at that late Friday Night Hour, M2M's upper floor was vacant, so I'm going say we're going there unless there are any other suggestions among those interested in convo.

You can leave any time during the event, please let us know if you can via talk or Meetup comment.

Please Support MLC:

*Check out CNY's first Kickstarter Campaign!


----

Speaker: David Hendel 

Title: Re-Tuning the Hubble Diagram 

Lecture: 7:00-7:30 PM Telescope 

Observation: 7:30-9:00 PM Astronomy Q&A and/or Slideshow: 7:30-9:00 PM

Source: Columbia Astronomy Outreach
results.how_to_find_us: We'll Gather in the Front Lobby of Pupin. At appx 9PM, we'll relocate to M2M upperfloor.
results.name: MLC Stargazers Meetup: Re-tuning the Hubble Diagram

venue.address_1: Tito Puente Education Complex 240 East 109th Street. Entrance right off 2nd Ave
venue.name: Tito Puente Education Complex

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

venue.name: Columbia University Pupin Physics Laboratories on the Morningside Campus

results.description:
Listen to a fascinating lecture on astronomy and then do a little stargazing in Columbia's observatory! If you like science/space, these are really fun events.

This lecture is: Re-tuning the Hubble Diagram, presented by David Hendel. The lecture is 30 minutes and stargazing (weather permitted) is 90 minutes, using the telescopes in the observatory.

Link with more info: http://outreach.astro.columbia.edu/calendar/ 

Let's meet around 6:30, as the lecture hall does fill up. If people are interested we can go out for drinks after!
results.how_to_find_us: So the lecture hall is actually closer to 120th, but I think you have to enter at 116? Then just walk through campus. Let's meet outside building and go in together.
results.name: Columbia Astronomy Stargazing and Lecture Series

venue.address_1: 236 West 73rd Street, 5th floor Fellowship Hall, near Broadway
venue.name: Rutgers Presbyterian Church

results.description:
Please join us in screening of "Bag It," a documentary film about single-use, carry-out plastic bags. These bags are made from finite fossil fuel resources such as oil and natural gas. The bags are usually given out for free by retailers and are generally used for a very brief time. Ultimately, most of them end up in landfills, trees, sewerage systems, and most disturbingly, in our oceans and other waterways. The toxins contained in them are being found in marine animals and thus in our food supply. They are decimating the aquatic ecosystem. Screening starts at 6:30 pm. Doors open at 6:00 pm. Following the 79-minute film, Jennie Romer will lead a Q&A session. Ms. Romer is a national expert on plastic bag laws (see her website: http://plasticbaglaws.org/). Int 209 (http://legistar.council.nyc.gov/LegislationDetail.aspx?ID=1687953&GUID=492A60EA-D352-462A-915A-BB2C34A58D61&Options=ID|Text|&Search=Int+209) is a bill which has been introduced in the NYC Council to encourage reusable bags. The bill is being spearheaded by Council Members Lander and Chin and is currently before the NYC Council. It is also awaiting an answer from the Mayor on whether or not he supports it. Come hear from Jennie what lessons have been learned from other cities’ efforts and how those lessons were incorporated into the proposed law for NYC. You’ll also learn more about the BagItNYC coalition and their work to help encourage Mayor de Blasio and council members who have not yet signed on to support the bill. Here is a trailer (http://bagitmovie.com/trailer.html) for the film. Please note that Rutgers Presbyterian Church which donated this venue for our screening has standard communications equipment found in most offices, including WiFi, that cannot be disconnected for the purposes of our event.

About the Film

Americans use 60,000 plastic bags every five minutes—single-use disposable bags that we mindlessly throw away. But where is “away?” Where do the bags and other plastics end up, and at what cost to our environment, marine life and human health?

Bag It follows “everyman” Jeb Berrier as he navigates our plastic world. Jeb is not a radical environmentalist, but an average American who decides to take a closer look at our cultural love affair with plastics. Jeb’s journey in this documentary film starts with simple questions: Are plastic bags really necessary? What are plastic bags made from? What happens to plastic bags after they are discarded?

Jeb looks beyond plastic bags and discovers that virtually everything in modern society—from baby bottles, to sports equipment, to dental sealants, to personal care products—is made with plastic or contains potentially harmful chemical additives used in the plastic-making process. When Jeb’s journey takes a personal twist, we see how our crazy-for-plastic world has finally caught up with us and what we can do about it. Today. Right now.

See you at the movies on Friday October 30, 2015.
results.name: Fri 10/30/15 Free Screening of Documentary Film "Bag It"

A reluctant conscript drafted into an elite Military unit, Private William Mandella has been propelled through space and time to fight in the distant thousand-year conflict; to perform his duties and do whatever it takes to survive the ordeal and return home. results.description:
Hi folks,

I'm sorry to report that due to dwindling attendance, we've been bumped from our coveted Friday night slot.

This Friday will be our final Friday night engagement. Future events will take place on Wednesday nights.

Come out and celebrate our final Friday with one of the year's most compelling documentary films, "Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief"


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zllYkNu1sl4

About the film:

An in-depth look at the inner-workings of the authoritarian Church of Scientology, which has infiltrated the US Government to stymie investigations into its own behavior, kidnapped and impersonated detractors and even asks members to sign billion-year contracts.

Directed by Oscar winner Alex Gibney and based on the book by Pulitzer Prize winner Lawrence Wright, Going Clear profiles eight former members of the Church of Scientology, whose most prominent adherents include A-list Hollywood celebrities -- shining a light on how the church cultivates true believers, detailing their experiences and what they are willing to do in the name of Scientology.

One of the most talked about films at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival, this powerful documentary highlights the Church's origins, from its roots in the mind of science fiction writer and founder L. Ron Hubbard to its rise in popularity in Hollywood and beyond.

Going Clear is a provocative tale of ego, exploitation, and lust for power.


Not to  be missed!


The film runs 119 minutes and will be followed by mingling and a moderated discussion.

Approximate timeline for the night:


• 7pm - Arrival & mingling

• 7:15pm - Film starts


• 9:15pm - Short moderated discussion breaking out into smaller discussion groups

Directions  & Parking:

The coffee house we've graciously been offered as a venue is located inside the Union Train station, near Kean University. It's in an unmarked building, so it might be tough to spot from a distance. To help you find it, here's what it looks like from down the street.

In addition, here is an overhead map to help you get your bearings and familiarize yourself with the area.

If you're driving to the event, you can park in any open spot at no charge. At this hour, there is no parking enforcement.

If you are taking the train, the venue is right inside the Union Train station, which is on the Raritan Valley Line. Here's an NJ Transit Map of the rail system to help you figure out if taking the train would be convenient for you.


To Find Us:

Rock'n' Joe is a cozy place. You'll see us gathered around the big pulldown movie screen on your left as soon as you walk in the front door. Grab a beverage or something to eat and come sit with us!

Please support the venue, Rock'n' Joe with a food or drink purchase (their coffee is sooo good!) so they can continue to welcome us back month after month!
results.name: Final Friday showing: "Going Clear: Scientology and the Prison of Belief"

results.description:
Brazilian guitarist/singer/songwriter Márcio Faraco will be in New York presenting his new album Cajueiro as part of the A World Music Series.


Tickets are $25, but members of of the NY Brazilian Portuguese Meetup group get $5 off!! To buy your ticket access the link http://www.liveat365.org/concert02.php and use the code Take5Off


NOTE:  Your RSVP does not guarantee your participation. You need to purchase the ticket through the link above (or at the venue) in order to attend this event.

About the artist

Marcio Faraco has quietly built a solid international reputation, mixing bossa nova and samba with a French twist, since the release of his debut solo album in 2000. Sometimes referred to as the “Leonard Cohen of Brazil,” Faraco’s compositions employ a variety of rhythmic styles rooted in the unlimited breadth of Brazil’s musical culture, the South American sonic pastiche of African, European, and indigenous traditions. The early influences on his songwriting, Antonio Carlos Jobim, Joao Gilberto and Vinicius de Moraes, still reverberate strongly through his current musical compositions. Cajuiero, his seventh and most recent recording, captures Faraco at an inventive peak in his continual artistic evolution.


See you there,

Aparecida Teixeira
results.name: Brazilian Samba and Bossa Nova: Márcio Faraco's show

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
